categories_jobs_title: Professional Big Data Software Eng BIG DATA
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Roswell, Georgia
Responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies. Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM are desirable.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Uses Big Data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented. Works in a highly agile environment. Job Contribution: Fully functioning technical professional. Develops new concepts/methods/techniques. Has meaningful team/dept impact.
KNOWLEDGE Subject matter expert within own discipline/specialty area. Applies specialized knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards and work processes. Integrates company experience and deep technical knowledge. Advanced understanding of select AT&T technologies/systems/procedures. ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Solves non routine problems based on analysis of multiple factors. Independently identifies key issues, patterns or deviations from norm. Works on problems requiring judgment and in depth evaluation of multiple factors. Analyzes/interprets research to evaluate and recommend solutions.
INDEPENDENCE Guided by team goals and operational objectives. Applies judgment to determine appropriate processes and technical area standard; provides technical direction to others in own work area.
CONTRIBUTION TO AT&T TECHNOLOGY Key contributor on diverse projects of moderate scope. Recommends new procedures/processes to drive desired results.
COMMUNICATION Mentors less experienced team members in work area explaining advanced technical information and providing specialized technical guidance. Builds productive internal/external relationships. Collaborates with others in own team or across teams.
Education: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred. Experience: Typically requires 3-5 years experience. Supervisory: No.
Principal Functional Skills / Competencies associated with this Title:
Agile Development
Application Design, Architecture
Application Development (Web)
Application Development Tools
Application Programming Interface (API)
Big Data Software Engineering
Data Mining and Data Science
Emerging Technologies
Information Security Management
Programming
Requirements Analysis
Software Development Life Cycle
Statistics and Actuarial Modeling
Testing
User Interface Design
Requisition ID: 1566511
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Big Data Software Eng BIG DATA
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Sunnyvale, California
AT&T is expanding the Mobile Engineering Big Data team. We are looking for people with embedded Android and iOT experience who: Enjoy solving challenging problems with creative solutions; Can make the tough tradeoffs when designing for low power/low bandwidth devices; Can package solutions into proven, low friction, turn key deployments for varied customer needs.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design, implement, and extend packaging for the core IQ Agent library and test frameworks for various platforms.Coordinate and communicate changes through specification, design, development, testing, and deployment. Act as subject matter expert in iOS, Android, and/or WP8 development environment. Familiar with Android SDK/NDK architectures and RIL is preferred.Work with teammates to enhance the system architecture. Collaborate with product management to understand system requirements.
5 years of experience designing, documenting, writing, unit testing, releasing, and supporting software.
5 year of embedded software development experience.
3 years of C++/Java experience including IPC and multithreading issues.
3 years of embedded application development experience on at least one mobile platform (iOS, Windows Mobile, WP8, Android, BB QNX, etc.). Android, WP8, iOS or experience is a plus.
Strong operating system and data structures expertise.
Experience debugging assembly level issues is a plus.
Experience with wireless telecomm protocols a plus (CDMA, GSM/ UMTS, LTE etc.) and performance analysis, battery performance optimization is a plus.
Good communication skills; Good technical writing skills
Possibility of occasional travel
Requisition ID: 1614935
Apply now Apply now

Location: Plano, Texas
With the acquisition of DIRECTV, AT&T is now the largest paid-TV provider. Content Analytics at AT&T Big Data examines video viewership patterns to derive valuable insights and drive smart business decisions across AT&T. The Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing processes and layouts for complex, large-scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.
Specific responsibilities and requirements of this opportunity include:
Use data mining techniques to reveal patterns in the data that have implications on the business decisions.
Explore content viewership data using tools such as Pig, Hive, R, Python to create insights that the business can use.
Progressively combine data science skills and knowledge with industry/business knowledge to derive and deliver innovative solutions to business partners.
Use machine learning techniques to build learning models that allow the organization to predict outcomes with business implications.
Continuously monitor industry trends in the data science domain and apply them to create innovative solutions.
Be adept at translating the meaning and significance of the insights.
Collaborate with other experts to constantly innovate.
Expert level competency with scientific data analysis methods, leveraging statistics, data modeling, anomaly and outlier detections, and machine learning methods for classification and deep learning for pattern recognition.
Strong communication and presentation skills are required to effectively convey relevant insights to teams.
Perform analysis, concept implementation, and creates detailed methodology descriptions for data research activities.
Provide documentation and skill mentoring to others.
Exercise judgement on how to effectively communicate highly technical and complex details through the use of visualization and careful selection of "knowns" vs "hypotheticals".
Education: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing required. Masters or Ph.D strongly preferred.
Experience: Typically requires 5-8 years experience.
Supervisory: No.
Requisition ID: 1632740
Apply now Apply now

Location: Roswell, Georgia
Overall Purpose: The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing processes and layouts for complex, large- scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: This position will work closely with the IT, Sales and Marketing organizations functional leads to formulate hypothetical insights and work through the lifecycle of delivering these insights to production. Design and build large and complex data sets, from spurious sources while thinking strategically about uses of data and how data use interacts with data design. Design and implement statistical data quality procedures around new data sources. Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources. Implement any software required for accessing and handling data appropriately. Implement and hand off data checking and updating procedures to teams. Perform statistical analyses with existing data sets in statistical packages. Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization. Research and implement software and hardware related to mobile technology.
Job Contribution: Expert level technical professional. Advisor on technical knowledge and ATT technologies. (JE).
Advanced proficiency in AT LEAST two of the following: Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, SQL, Python, Java, R. Mentor to Big Data interns and to data scientist.
Education: Preferred Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing; Data Analytics nanodegree; or equivalent experience. Experience: Typically requires 8-10 years experience. Supervisory: No.

Location: Roswell, Georgia
Overall Purpose: Responsible for analyzing data in response to new business requests, performing maintenance and changes on interfaces, and identifying and resolving data discrepancies across multiple business applications.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Works directly with the client user community and business analysts to define and document data requirements for data integration and business intelligence applications. Determines and documents data mapping rules for movement of medium to high complexity data between applications. Adheres to and promotes the use of data administration standards. Supports data selection, extraction, and cleansing for corporate applications, including data warehouse and data marts. Creates and sustains processes, tools, and on-going support structures and processes. Investigates and resolves data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies of definition, format and function. Creates and populates meta-data into repositories. May create data models, including robust data definitions, which may be entity-relationship-attribute models, star, or dimensional models. May also create data flow diagrams and process models and integrates models across functional areas and platforms. Works closely with DBAs to transition logical models to physical implementation. May be responsible for employing data mining techniques to achieve data synchronization, redundancy elimination, source identification, data reconciliation, and problem root cause analysis. May also be responsible for quality control and auditing of databases, resolving data problems, and analyzing system changes for quality assurance. Job Contribution: Technical professional with limited experience. Working knowledge of technical principles, learning ATT technologies.
Education: Preferred Bachelors degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering, Math, or Sciences; Data Analytics nanodegree; or equivalent experience. Experience: Typically requires 1-2 years experience. Technical Career Pathway (TCP) role. Supervisory: No.
Requisition ID: 1631921

The Principal Big Data Software Engineer is responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies. This position will use Big Data programming languages and technology, write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications. It will also analyze, design, program, debug and modify software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Position will interact with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented.
Specifically this Principal Big Data Software Engineer provides the backbone (the data and data platform) for the team as well as for the enterprise. This position helps to derive valuable insights and drive smart business decisions across AT&T. Additional responsibilities include the following:
Works with the raw data, cleanses it and finally polishes it to the format where it can be consumed by Data Scientists to create critical insights.
Assists with ad-hoc requests coming from business partners. These can be simple statistics or complex operations.
Expert level competency with Scala, Java, Spark, Map/Reduce, high performance tuning, machine learning methods for classification and deep learning for pattern recognition. In addition, the candidate must also have the ability to mentor and develop others in these technologies.
Strong communication and presentation skills are required to effectively convey relevant insights to the teams.
Performs analysis, implementation, and performance tuning for engineered artifacts.
Exercises judgment on how to effectively communicate highly technical and complex details through the use of visualization and careful selection of "knowns" versus "hypotheticals".
KNOWLEDGE - Has extensive specialized technical expertise. Applies expert knowledge and broad understanding of multiple disciplines. Integrates expert knowledge of technical principles/methods of multiple disciplines with knowledge of products/services and internal operations. Advisor on AT&T technologies/systems/procedures.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING - Solves complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues. Uses extensive research and interpretative thinking. Utilizes innovative methods in developing solutions. Works on abstract problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables.
INDEPENDENCE - Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent.
CONTRIBUTION TO AT&T TECHNOLOGY - Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives.
COMMUNICATION - Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers.
Education: Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred.
Experience: Typically requires 8-10 years experience.
Supervisory: No.

It‰Ûªs an exciting time for us! We are responsible for optimization and prototyping strategic platform elements in AT&T‰Ûªs Domain 2.0 architecture that leverages cloud technologies, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), and Software Defined Networking (SDN), to intelligently scale AT&T‰Ûªs network, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security, performance and reliability. Using Big Data analytics, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations.
We are looking for you, if
You are a strong data scientist with a passion for digging into large data sets and extracting knowledge through data analysis, management, and visualization
You would like to work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business: network and service management, customer and business analytics, network design and optimization, and new service creation
You are able to provide end-to-end predictive and analytical solutions for non-standard problems even when the problem is not well defined

You desire to join an amazing team of professionals helping AT&T solve real world problems through analytics of massive data sets

categories_jobs_title: Principal Software Engineer Big Data (Plano TX)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Are you a Big Data Engineer who loves to put things together and build the future from the world's most massive data sets? Why? Because AT&T is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to develop high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, and text mining. We are looking for people with a ton of passion, a desire to try big things, people who have a lot of curiosity and can go deep into the lowest layer of a complex system. We want people who want to learn new things, and people who have a clear customer point-of-view.
The selected candidate will write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications within our Big Data Organization; Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions; Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented; Enjoy working in a highly agile environment.
AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment. If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you!
Desired Qualifications:
8+ years‰Ûª experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies
Hadoop certification is desired and highly relevant
A passion for building things from massive data sets and a passion to create the future in technology
Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM
Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred
Viewed as a pioneer within field
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V
Requisition ID: 1624841
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist Big Data Research
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for massive data. This helps us learn about our network and our customers, understand products, and improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies - leading our industry in novel methodologies for fraud detection, service quality management, statistical computing, visualization, text mining, data stream management, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for a strong analyst/data scientist with a passion for digging into large data sets and extracting knowledge through data analysis, data management, and visualization. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business: network and service management including new approaches to virtualizing and managing a software defined network, customer analytics such as understanding customer use of entertainment services such as U-verse and DirecTV, and modeling and building of tools which may include anonymized location analytics.
The candidate will partner with research staff to develop and implement statistical models of both structured and unstructured data: call records, locations, text, video, audio. The candidate must have in depth understanding and experience in the entire data ÌÊ analysis ÌÊ results presentation ÌÊ software prototyping process. Deep knowledge of statistical computing ‰ÛÒ with expertise in Hadoop and R ‰ÛÒ are critical to success in this position. The selected candidate will research data sets, apply basic statistical analysis and modeling techniques to characterize customers and extract learnings, and support mapping and other visualizations of results. The successful candidate will practice in broad areas of complex technical project work that requires in-depth analysis using advanced techniques, knowledge, and expertise and provide technical expertise within project teams.
Required Qualifications:
Candidate shall have a PhD or Master's degree in an approved field from an accredited university and a minimum of 0 - 6 years of relevant experience.
Degree such as Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Mathematics from an accredited university.
Entry into this title will require Technical Title Plan (TTP) Board Approval.
Experience and passion for finding solutions to real world, applied problems.
Demonstrated expertise working with large industrial scale data sets and extracting useful actionable insights from that data.
Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic models and iterations in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
Experienced programmer working in the data science ‰ÛÏpipeline‰Û: skilled at data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, and integration. Must be able to write re-usable tools that support other data scientists. .
Accomplished R programmer.
Experience with modern data management and parallel compute systems like Hadoop, HDFS, NoSQL, Spark, etc.
Skilled in Python and at least one tool in the Hadoop ecosystem (e.g. Pig, Hive, MapReduce, or Spark) and experience with SQL and UNIX scripting.
Skills in application development integrating R, HTML and Javascript a plus
Requisition ID: 1619416
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist (Labs Big Data Research)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: New York, New York
External and Internal
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for strong analysts in a data science field with a passion for extracting insights from large data sets. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business, including network and service management, marketing and customer care, network design and optimization, and new service creation. Many analysts work directly with business unit leaders. All have opportunities to invent novel, publishable methodology that address real-world problems. Increasingly we contribute to multiple data science disciplines through open source projects, led by AT&T.
We typically hire to fill two positions:
Our PhD level Inventive Scientists are technical leaders in their field, establishing external recognition while creating innovative, business-impacting solutions.
Data Scientists will usually have a Master‰Ûªs; they are responsible for the entire data ‰ÛÒ to ‰ÛÒ solution pipeline. They both support the Inventive Scientists and are responsible for their own projects.
Location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise:
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Data visualization - AT&T creates algorithms, systems, and techniques for visualizing new data sets at increasingly large scale. AT&T is especially interested in interactive visualization of very large geospatial and temporal data. One example is our open source project Nanocubes http://nanocubes.net .
- Database management and data quality - AT&T is building high-performance and low latency systems to manage high velocity data streams. These systems are critical for accurate processing and analysis of data from the AT&T mobile network. Analyzing the data to identify glitches, and cleaning the data to minimize distortion while preserving maximal underlying variation, are essential to ensure meaningful big data analytics.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
Please visit http://www.research.att.com to learn more about AT&T Research.
Qualifications
- Inventive Scientist candidates shall have a PhD or equivalent in a data science field, including these most commonly: Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Engineering, and Mathematics.

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist (Labs Big Data Research)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
External and Internal
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for strong analysts in a data science field with a passion for extracting insights from large data sets. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business, including network and service management, marketing and customer care, network design and optimization, and new service creation. Many analysts work directly with business unit leaders. All have opportunities to invent novel, publishable methodology that address real-world problems. Increasingly we contribute to multiple data science disciplines through open source projects, led by AT&T.
We typically hire to fill two positions:
Our PhD level Inventive Scientists are technical leaders in their field, establishing external recognition while creating innovative, business-impacting solutions.
Data Scientists will usually have a Master‰Ûªs; they are responsible for the entire data ‰ÛÒ to ‰ÛÒ solution pipeline. They both support the Inventive Scientists and are responsible for their own projects.
Location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise:
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Data visualization - AT&T creates algorithms, systems, and techniques for visualizing new data sets at increasingly large scale. AT&T is especially interested in interactive visualization of very large geospatial and temporal data. One example is our open source project Nanocubes http://nanocubes.net .
- Database management and data quality - AT&T is building high-performance and low latency systems to manage high velocity data streams. These systems are critical for accurate processing and analysis of data from the AT&T mobile network. Analyzing the data to identify glitches, and cleaning the data to minimize distortion while preserving maximal underlying variation, are essential to ensure meaningful big data analytics.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
Please visit http://www.research.att.com to learn more about AT&T Research.
Qualifications
- Inventive Scientist candidates shall have a PhD or equivalent in a data science field, including these most commonly: Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Engineering, and Mathematics.
- Data Science candidates shall have a Master‰Ûªs or PhD in a data science field.
- Experience and passion for finding solutions to real world, applied problems. In addition for Inventive Scientists, established excellence in applied research through publications, new research techniques, open source contributions, and patents.
- Expertise working with large industrial scale data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate data, prototype new tools, and extract actionable insights from that data.
- Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic solutions in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
- Expert-level skills and abilities within field of knowledge, and demonstrated ability to develop new ideas from inception to prototype.
- Accomplished R programmer, and experience coding with other languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java.
- Experience with modern data management systems like Hadoop, NoSQL, and Spark.
- Candidates with 5+ years of relevant experience may be considered for a more senior position.
Qualified candidates may be asked to submit a Research Statement (required for Inventive Scientist applicants) and 3-5 references (required for Inventive Scientist applicants, optional but encouraged for Data Scientist applicants).
Requisition ID: 1615655

categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Deliver the highest level (Tier-3) of network technical support within AT&T's technical support structure requiring 24x7 on call from escalating organizations including but not limited to Tier-2 Operations and NPE. Provides the technical troubleshooting and leadership skills required to recover from the most complex network problems in real time, directing the activities of technical resources from Tier-2, Labs, and the vendor(s) to restore service. ‰Û¢ Assist SAM managers with processing New Order requests

Location: Denver, Colorado
Description
We have a need for a new FTE within our AT&T Entertainment Group to join our Technology Development Application Services Production Support group supporting our Supplier Payments & Dealer Compensation Applications.
We‰Ûªre looking for an experienced technical resource who can help us support new applications built on the Hadoop big data platform.
We‰Ûªre looking for senior-level candidates with hands-on experience managing complex application environments in an enterprise IT setting. Deep technical skills are not enough, we‰Ûªre looking for someone who can understand the bigger picture and can take a logical approach to solving business problems for which the root cause may reside outside of a given technology stack.
Work Schedule:
M-F, Typical business hours (+/-)
Occasional off-hour or on-call support when the situation dictates
Work Location can be either:
El Segundo, CA
Englewood, CO
Responsibilities
Lead technical troubleshooting efforts and perform analysis to identify workarounds and determine root causes of production issues
Analyze PL/SQL/Java/Pig code to identify logic errors and potential optimizations
Develop and execute queries against large datasets to support impact analysis, reconciliation, and data validation
Create and deploy scripts to automate tasks to evaluate and manipulate file data
Establish relationships with business partners, understand business processes, and promote business unit interests
Analyze reported production issues within the context of business requirements and design specifications to determine the appropriate remediation path
Assess potential impacts to business operations and negotiate potential solutions and associated priorities with stakeholder groups
Author executive summaries to explain issues and implications to senior leaders
Facilitate regular meetings with cross functional stakeholders to review status and next steps for outstanding issues
Install & configure software updates and deploy application code releases to Production & Non-Production environments
Proactively identify opportunities to streamline integrated job workflows, implement automation and monitoring solutions
Contribute subject matter expertise to IT projects to support the design and delivery of quality solutions
Evaluate solution designs to proactively eliminate potential production problems and contribute supportability requirements
Participate in standard processes for Access, Incident, Problem, and Change Management
Coordinate with Development, Network, Infrastructure, and other organizations necessary to get work done
Qualifications
Qualifications
Must be able to demonstrate strength development and data analysis using PL/SQL, Hive/HQL, Pig, Scoop, Java
Must take a logical approach to solving complex technical problems
Must be able to work in a team atmosphere
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to articulate complex technical issues within a business context
Must be presentable to senior leadership and business partners.
Must demonstrate aptitude for learning new technologies
Must be a self-starter who exhibits motivation to contribute, develop, and succeed
Must have familiarity with ITIL framework for Incident & Problem Management and AGILE software development methodologies
Experience:
Required
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent experience
6 years experience in a professional IT Role doing systems administration, development, quality assurance or production support
6 years working with Oracle databases, performing administration tasks, writing SQL, and analyzing large datasets
4 years of development experience using PL/SQL, Java, web technologies, or Hadoop tools such as Hive, Pig, Scoop
4 years OS administration experience with Linux / Windows, with basic knowledge of Unix administration
4 years experience with wlst, ant, perl, shell or other scripting languages
An understanding of J2EE and basic java application management tasks
Preferred
Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent experience
Experience working with the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem using Cloudera Manager Enterprise and associated tools
Experience administering Hadoop cluster environments and tools ecosystem: Cloudera/Horton Works/Sqoop/Pig/HDFS
Experience using ETL & Reporting tools such as Informatica, Business Objects, Cognos, and MicroStrategy
Experience setting up batch processes using scheduling tools (Autosys)
Experience working with monitoring tools such as AppDynamic and Splunk
Experience administering java application servers: Oracle WebLogic Server, Tomcat, jBoss

Location: Atlanta, Georgia
The emergence of big data is creating an opportunity to join an organization within AT&T that turns big data into big insights through the use of unique data discovery techniques and quantitative models. In this Principal Data Analyst role, you will work closely with a diverse, innovative team of quantitative and data experts to solve client problems using Big data and Advanced Solutions (BDAS) platforms and data assets. Additionally, you will support our premium Big Data service offerings by relentlessly finding the 1% of data that matters through our proprietary data discovery processes. Come to work everyday focused on growing this business to a meteoric level (and feel appreciated and rewarded for it too)!
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Develop, maintain, test and evaluate big data solutions
Apply best practices in big data engineering for the scalability and efficiency of software
Process, apply rigorous experimentation and iterative analytics on raw data
Design and implement data structures and APIs
Visualize data and synthesize insights of commercial value
Support Data Scientists in algorithm implementation
Contribute to BDAS IP on data analytics and visualization concepts, methods and techniques
Position is located in Atlanta, GA.
Minimum Qualifications:
Proficient in several of the following MapReduce, Hive, MongoDB, Cassandra, Spark, NoSQL, Hadoop, Python, R, Pig
Experience with object-oriented design, coding and testing patterns
Experience in software platforms and large-scale data infrastructures
Well versed in diverse quantitative techniques
Motivation to collaborate with a diverse, innovative team
Previous experience working with analytics platforms, standard business intelligence dashboards, and data enrichment techniques
Previous experience in developing and maintaining analytical solutions
Minimum 6 years experience with Ph.D., 8 years with M.S., or 10 years with B.S.
Desired Qualifications:
Advanced Degree in computer science, software engineering, mathematics, operations research or other quantitative disciplines
Knowledge of machine learning methodologies
Knowledge of technology platforms and user interfaces
Prior experience in a client servicing role
Marketing and Advertising Analytics Experience in Consumer Packaged Goods, Retail, Automotive or Media and Entertainment verticals

Location: Middletown, New Jersey
The Optimization, Reliability and Customer Analytics (ORCA) department within AT&T Research creates delivers original solutions to some of our Company‰Ûªs and industry‰Ûªs most compelling and urgent challenges, ranging from network optimization and reliability, to predictive analytics and modeling, Big Data insights, and agile development and analytics solutions prototyping. We are responsible for optimization as well as prototyping for strategic platform elements in AT&T‰Ûªs Domain 2.0 architecture that leverages cloud technologies, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), and Software Defined Networking (SDN), to intelligently scale AT&T‰Ûªs network, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security, performance and reliability.
We are looking to expand our Research and Development staff in the area of reliability engineering. Example tasks include reliability modeling and optimization for advanced services that will be virtualized; reliability improvement recommendations; recommendations to optimize distributed cloud implementations of virtualized services; cloud infrastructure and NFV resource analytics; planning and visualization analytics; NFV services control algorithms; optimization, event detection & control actions for virtualized services.
Desired Areas of Expertise:
Candidate must have strong background in mathematical optimization, probability theory and stochastic modeling, performance, reliability, and capacity analysis.
Strong verbal communication along with excellent technical documentation and presentation skills.
Strong collaboration skills.
Ability to create innovative solutions.
Ability to work both independently and as a team member
Required Qualifications:
A Ph.D. in a relevant field from an accredited university or a Master‰Ûªs of Science degree with 3 or more years of technical experience will also be considered to meet job standards.
Degrees such as Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Distributed Computing, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Statistics from an accredited university.
Desired Qualifications:
Applied telecommunications research experience is a plus, including knowledge of IP networking and services.
Knowledge of SDN, NFV, Cloud and Distributed Computing optimization is highly desirable.
Domain knowledge of mobility and IMS is desirable.

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist Labs Resarch SDN
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Middletown, New Jersey
Our Labs Technology Research Group is looking for a Senior Inventive Scientist to join their team. If you are interested in performing research and development with software defined networking then read below. We look forward to hearing from you!
AT&T Labs Advanced Technologies goes beyond today‰Ûªs current solutions to invent disruptive technologies that will drive future innovations. Our research programs are at the tip of the spear in creating advanced technologies in Data Analytics, Cloud Services, Intelligent Systems, and Networking and Service Quality Management. AT&T Labs draws on a rich heritage of innovation, including eight Nobel Prizes, and a strong culture that encourages openness, teamwork and collaboration across AT&T and within the industry.
The candidate will perform research and development for automation of control systems for our software defined network. This includes research, creation, on boarding, and life cycle management of analytics micro-services based on machine learning and expert systems. These services are critical to the implementation of control loop automation that is necessary to scale AT&T's software-centric network effectively. The individual will contribute to the control loop initiative by developing optimization algorithms and software that automatically learns from available information such as agent tickets etc. to drive improved automation.
Education: Master‰Ûªs Degree with 2 years of experience or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering from an accredited university.
Experience: Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence technologies
What makes you stand out:
Strong software skills
Familiarity with virtualization and Software Defined Networking (SDN).
Strong and up-to-date theoretical and practical knowledge of machine learning, AI and analytical algorithms, and strong and up-to-date software skills
Familiarity with Agile development process, continuous integration, big data, networking and SDN, natural language processing, and distributed processing technologies.

categories_jobs_title: Principal Inventive Scientist Networking & Service Quality Management
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
AT&T is on a transformative journey creating next generation networks that leverage virtualization technologies and Software Defined Networking (SDN). This modern architecture will simplify and scale AT&T‰Ûªs networks to help support the continued growth of Internet traffic, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security and service experience. This initiative opens up exciting opportunities for research in how networks and services of tomorrow should be designed, operated, and managed at planetary scale. Having access to our real-world systems and data of immense scale, and being able to fundamentally impact one of the largest operational networks and millions of consumers offers unique career opportunities.
Researcher Positions
AT&T Labs Research is looking for passionate and talented researchers to join our team. The team of the Networking and Service Quality Management (SQM) Research organization invents cutting edge technologies that revolutionize how networks and services of tomorrow are designed, operated and managed. We are looking for unique and exceptional individuals who will engage in forward-looking research and who have a passion to drive new and innovative concepts to operational reality. Our researchers are expected to think big, focus on the future, and conceive, rapidly prototype and explore new ideas and solutions to challenging real-world problems. They are independent thinkers able to lead and drive novel ideas from concept to operational reality. Successful candidates will work closely with fellow researchers, academics, and members of various AT&T business units, and publish high-quality papers at top-tier technical conferences.
Outstanding individuals with a Ph.D. or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or applied sciences are encouraged to apply. Candidates must demonstrate excellence in research, strong technical and thought leadership skills, a collaborative spirit, strong communication skills, software and systems expertise, and possess a strong passion to make a difference and impact real world systems.
We are seeking candidates with skills in the following areas:
Large-scale systems design and controller technologies
Large-scale data mining and analytics
Software-Defined Networking (SDN), Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Network Virtualization (NV)
Cloud computing
Location
Bedminster, NJ (with possible flexibility for Middletown, NJ)
Requisition ID: 1626246
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_requirement:

AT&T is on a transformative journey creating next generation networks that leverage virtualization technologies and Software Defined Networking (SDN). This modern architecture will simplify and scale AT&T‰Ûªs networks to help support the continued growth of Internet traffic, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security and service experience. This initiative opens up exciting opportunities for research in how networks and services of tomorrow should be designed, operated, and managed at planetary scale. Having access to our real-world systems and data of immense scale, and being able to fundamentally impact one of the largest operational networks and millions of consumers offers unique career opportunities.
Researcher Positions
AT&T Labs Research is looking for passionate and talented researchers to join our team. The team of the Networking and Service Quality Management (SQM) Research organization invents cutting edge technologies that revolutionize how networks and services of tomorrow are designed, operated and managed. We are looking for unique and exceptional individuals who will engage in forward-looking research and who have a passion to drive new and innovative concepts to operational reality.
Our researchers are expected to think big, focus on the future, and conceive, rapidly prototype and explore new ideas and solutions to challenging real-world problems. They are independent thinkers able to lead and drive novel ideas from concept to operational reality. Successful candidates will work closely with fellow researchers, academics, and members of various AT&T business units, and publish high-quality papers at top-tier technical conferences.
Description of position
ECOMP represents a fundamental change in how we will control and manage our networks. While existing operational capabilities may be sufficient to manage individual ECOMP components, proper functioning of ECOMP will depend on cross-component interactions that must be understood and managed. The role of this position will be to invent, build and deploy new operational technology needed to provide a cross-component ECOMP view, understand the end-to-end service performance of ECOMP, expose the ECOMP service topology in order to support service isolation, and enable rapid troubleshooting and resolution of cross-component issues. This new technology will reduce OpEx by automating ECOMP operations, and it will improve overall AT&T customer experience for ECOMP operated services by reducing disruptions in ECOMP and minimizing resolution times when they do occur.
Why this position is critical
While ECOMP and D2 will allow rapid service creation and enable operational savings, the complexity of the new technology we are deploying will bring with it new and significant operational challenges. The ability to effectively understand, manage and address end-to-end cross-component interactions in ECOMP will be critical to realizing the benefits of ECOMP and D2 (i.e., reduced operational cost and improved service delivery.) With the recent loss of key personnel in my organization, we are short staffed to deliver on this vision.
Outstanding individuals with a Ph.D. or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or applied sciences are encouraged to apply. Candidates must demonstrate excellence in research, strong technical and thought leadership skills, a collaborative spirit, strong communication skills, software and systems expertise, and possess a strong passion to make a difference and impact real world systems.
We are seeking candidates with skills in the following areas:
Large-scale systems design and controller technologies
Large-scale data mining and analytics
Software-Defined Networking (SDN), Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Network Virtualization (NV)
Cloud computing
Location
Bedminster, NJ (with possible flexibility for Middletown, NJ)
Requisition ID: 1626244
Apply now Apply now

Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
The selected candidate will play a critical role within the Network Security field by providing critical Tier 2 support for large commercial and government customers from within the 24x7 Security Operations Center. This PRINCIPAL TECHNOLOGY SECURITY. Candidate will be joining a team of highly skilled analysts who use a combination of standard and custom built tools to analyze data from a wide range of data sources. The candidate will work on projects that analyze network activity data for security relevant events using a large scale data processing platform. Candidate will be developing alarming strategies for new feeds into all of our Threat Management platforms, and identifying opportunities to improve them for existing feeds. This position will have a strong focus in enhancing our commercial and government services. Develop tools (queries, reports, etc.) to simplify the analysis function and support the overall work done by analysts. Custom query building in a proprietary database will be required. Responsible for creating, testing and validating custom correlation rules using our SIM tools to address the latest vulnerabilities. Will also be asked to do detailed botnet and malware analysis. Respond to requests from our level 1 analysts to provide a more in-depth perspective on cases they are investigating. Candidate will also be asked to perform this level of analysis for requests from our senior executives and be able to present their findings and possible mitigation steps. Other critical activities include the identification, research and reporting on security trends and anomalies. Participate in the improvement and or development of Security Monitoring and Incident Response process and procedures documentation. The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, customer-focused, team player, flexible shift worker, and be able to coordinate and collaborate on multiple issues simultaneously with many stakeholders. Multiple program differentiation and operating in a 24x7x365 faced-paced environment requires precise management of customer interaction and experience on a range of functional issue areas. When escalation is needed, the candidate must be able to coordinate with program management and other operations centers to create a seamless customer experience. The candidate must maintain
visibility of all active security-related customer issues and follow up with escalation centers on each issue through resolution. Candidate must be capable of working with other operations and analysis team members closely to maintain maximum awareness of customer account information and standard issue requests on a per-customer basis. Candidate must have experience with ticket or case management platforms and other coordination systems. Foremost, candidate must possess exceptional customer experience skills, be committed to understanding the customer needs, and then taking appropriate steps to meeting those needs.
Desired Qualifications:Certifications: GIAC: reverse engineering malware, GIAC network forensic analyst, GIAC certified intrusion analyst, CISSP. Must also be able to holds a suitability HSPD-12 security clearance.
Desired Skills: Malware and exploit analysis (debuggers, disassemblers, sniffers, and hex editors) ; Snort (IDS) rule development and PCap analysis; Scripting (perl, python, javascript, powershell, shell, etc.) ; SIEM (ArcSight, Splunk, Trustwave, or QRadar); Big Data Tools (Hadoop, Spark, ElastiSearch, Solr, HBase, R)
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Engineering in Mechanical Engineering with specialization in Industrial Production Engineering or a technical related field
5-8 years experience in IT security.
Knowledge in application security standards and process.
Proficient in database security.
Knowledge in identity and access management (access control and provisioning, theft tactics, etc.) and tools (SecurID cards, etc.)
Knowledge in network architecture and infrastructure components (Carrier-based network routers and switches, IPv6, etc.)
Knowledge in business continuity and disaster recovery (planning, etc.)
Proficient in Security Engineering, Planning and Monitoring
Knowledge in security hardware and software
Knowledge in Anti-virus (Virus, Worm, Malware, etc.)
Proficient in Cyber security tools (Sensage, etc.)
Understands identity and access management tools (SecurID cards, etc.).
Proficient in Cloud Computing (Internet data center architectures, hosting and application services, etc.).
Understands content distribution networks.

Knowledge in security audit, review, risk assessment, regulatory, controls (Audit and control structures, audit processes (SAS 70), Compliance assessment tools, etc.)

Description
DIRECTV is looking for a highly motivated out of the box thinking individual with strong data analysis and strategic skills to join its research and analytics team. This individual will partner with the Ad Sales group to provide campaign analysis, insight and direction for our Audience Measurement and Addressable Advertising client businesses. Must possess expert abilities in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word

Location: Columbia, Maryland
This opening is for a software design engineer (junior to mid-level developer) working in an agile development and engineering environment. The selected candidate will use an agile Scrum based framework to collaborate with peer software engineers, systems engineers, customers, and lifecycle tier support personnel. The technology domain is cyber security and information assurance. The work focuses on building and supporting applications and tools used to protect networked computing infrastructures from security threats. A sizeable portion of the work involves evaluating and integrating commercial and custom developed software products into application software solutions.
A working understanding of information assurance and network communications security is required with up to 2 years of experience in software design and development; Experience writing software using C, C++ or Java on Linux-based platforms, a working understanding of Linux, some scripting experience (shell, perl, tcl/tk, ruby, and python), and a working knowledge of the IP protocol suite (TCP, UDP, ICMP, etc); Working knowledge of Splunk, nanocubes or like big-data analysis and visualization tools; Familiarity with modern software development methods and a working understanding of how unit and integration test fit into the development lifecycle; Hands-on experience with configuration and change management tools and practices; An ability to work independently, take on commitments, communicate and cooperate to resolve issues, and work collaboratively in a fast paced environment demanding the ability to quickly respond to rapidly changing requirements driven by world events. A BS degree, in Computer Science/Math or related discipline is preferred.
Required: US Citizenship; Candidates currently holding a TS/SCI clearance is desired.
Desired: Knowledge and experience performing unit and integration test and an understanding of how to build testability into the product from early in its lifecycle; Experience in rapid or agile development; Familiarity with intrusion detection systems, forensics and data mining and analysis techniques; UI language skills using Java and knowledge of databases to include MySQL and Hadoop.

Our Wireless Network Architecture & Design group is looking for a Principal Member of Technical Staff to work on projects with the AT&T network. The position will rely on solid academic education and professional experience as someone who will architect, design, develop, and test end to end software solutions on network and service data collection, database engineering, and web tools.

Experience:
The position requires good understanding of Software Defined Network (SDN),VNF (Virtual Network Function), Cloud and virtualization architecture.
Knowledge and solid experience of CPE management, big volume data collection and tools spanning wireline and wireless networks.

That leadership includes client interaction at all/senior levels and accountability/oversight/management of: 1) Plans and schedules, 2) Risk management and mitigation, 3) Technical solutioning & engineering design, 4) Security accreditation & certification (APL, RMF, FedRAMP, FISMA), 5) Vendor/product management, 6) Integration & Testing, 7) Service Delivery and Assurance Life cycle. In addition to SSM, the candidate will pursue new business in the Cyber Security domain including Threat Insights, Big Data Platform and cyber analytics
Technical management expertise in developing, deploying, and managing technology insertion, and professional and network services solutions to Defense clients' on a fee-for service or billable hour basis. Candidates shall have experience managing toward a strategic direction & vision while maintaining regular contact with tactical duties of a complex technical and functional projects or group of projects. Candidates shall have experience overseeing results of multi-functional project teams and administrative/operational leadership of a project within the program guidelines set by the customer.
Candidates shall have demonstrated skills with monitoring projects to ensure work scope, schedule, and budget are well defined and maintained and setting policies for resource managers/supervisors to ensure all necessary reviews and approvals are received.
Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with 15 years or more of professional experience (with minimum of ten years being Project Management experience); or 10 years of professional experience (with minimum five years being Project Management experience) with a related Masters degree. Requires PMP or equivalent certification.

categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Atlanta, Georgia
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From mobile apps to revolutionary devices, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
The TDP-ET Program is focused on transforming college graduates into skilled technologists. Here, you‰Ûªll be part of a strong network and learn alongside a group of highly motivated peers just like yourself. It‰Ûªs a collaborative environment full of learning opportunities designed to help you evolve your capabilities, challenge your strengths and reach your fullest potential. You‰Ûªll also build mentoring relationships, have access to senior leadership and gain exposure across the company.
Whether you're in the full-time program or the 10-week internship, you'll team up with our internal Technology experts. You‰Ûªll work on high-value projects to help shape the future of Cloud Services, API & Developer Programs, Big Data, Mobile Development, and our User-Defined Network Cloud initiative.
Applying to our Emerging Technologies track means you will be considered for one of four roles ‰ÛÒ Software Engineer, Business Analyst, Scrum Master or Project/Program Manager ‰ÛÒ being placed based on your input and experience identified throughout the interview process. Explore your TDP-ET career possibilities by checking out the Detailed Duties & Requirements here.
Becoming a member of this tight-knit community of innovators has its share of perks including a full benefits package with medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and strong corporate citizenship and environmental stewardship. To qualify you must have a Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree or higher in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math), Information Systems or a related field.
Our employee‰Ûªs say it best. Watch now!

AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position.

Location: Los Angeles, California
Description
Mobile Analytics Manager /
Analytics Center of Excellence Product Owner
‰ÛÒ AT&T Entertainment Group
DIRECTV / AT&T seeks a Mobile Analytics Manager. The person in this role will help to define and guide Mobile Engineering‰Ûªs Analytics team. Reporting directly to the Director of Mobile Software Engineering, as a product owner he/she will be responsible for refining the vision and strategy for Mobile Analytics; building a cross-functional Mobile Analytics Center of Excellence; and managing the portfolio and ecosystem of Mobile Analytics systems ‰ÛÒ including tools, data, and reporting.
The Mobile Analytics Manager also needs to be extremely proficient as an Adobe Sitecatalyst (Omniture) Admin, who is especially familiar with setting Adobe Processing Rules, and knows Conviva well too. As a Product Owner, this Mobile Analytics Manager must be highly knowledgeable working with data architecture, and highly competent in providing guidance and training to individual contributors working with mobile application, web, video player, and client (external device) data.
The successful candidate will be able to think strategically about business issues and be able to prioritize the team‰Ûªs backlog based on business needs and priorities. The successful candidate will have a strong command of data warehousing, data mining, analytics, big data, data validation, data systems, and data visualization.
Responsibilities
Data SME ‰ÛÒ Subject matter expert in analytics, data management, and SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) with high proficiency in:
Data architecture, including context variable mapping;
Data mining;
Data visualizations;
Data validation.
Adobe Sitecatalyst & Conviva Guru ‰ÛÒ Expert knowledge of modern analytics tools and systems, especially Adobe Omniture (Sitecatalyst) ‰ÛÒ including Adobe processing rules, and Conviva.
Leader & Manager ‰ÛÒ Ability to effectively lead, expand, coach and train an existing team of data and business analysts, owning the end-to-end process for all of Mobile Analytics.
Including, strong mentoring, negotiating, communicating, and meeting facilitation skills.
Product Owner (PO) ‰ÛÒ Owns the vision, strategy, and backlog prioritization for Mobile Engineering‰Ûªs Analytics team. This includes responsibility for creating clarity around process direction and roles and responsibilities, setting standards and best practices.
Collaborator ‰ÛÒ Work cross-functionally to improve alignment ‰ÛÒ especially on goals and strategic objectives, visibility, transparency and communication for mobile analytics needs.
Comfortable working in various frameworks ‰ÛÒ Ability to work within both various Agile and more traditional/waterfall planning methodologies.
Stakeholder Manager ‰ÛÒ Familiar with impactful communication and change management strategies, and has the ability to level set realistic expectations with stakeholders, including managing internal and external client expectations on requirements and deliverables.
Qualifications
Minimum Requirements
5+ years experience in related field
Thorough understanding as well as practical experience with the software development lifecycle
Familiarity with; user interface design, product development, and system architecture design
Understanding of data management and warehousing
Lead and develop direct reports
Must have excellent analytical and organizational skills and demonstrate great attention to detail

Location: Richardson, Texas
This is the big leagues. AT&T is a world leader in communications, business solutions and entertainment. As part of our Business Sales team, you'll work with small to large enterprises as well as government agencies to sell our full-scale business solutions.
Our wireless division serves 95 percent of the Fortune 100 companies and counts more than 80 percent of the Fortune 500 and more than 1200 federal, state, and local government agencies as customers. Companies and organizations with the most complex networking and communications requirements in the world look to our powerful global IP backbone network, extensive portfolio and expertise to help them increase business velocity by making them more productive, collaborative, competitive, and cost-effective.
You'll be part of the team that walks our customers through AT&T's cutting-edge products, shows them the benefit of our advanced services, and ultimately closes the deal. We aren't just the phone company anymore and you aren't just any sales person.
This could be your chance to join a company that's known for being innovative, successful and ahead of the curve.
With AT&T's history of success and commitment to emerging technologies, this is the ideal sales environment for a professional looking to build an amazing career.
AT&T Technical Sales Consultant is responsible for providing technical consultation and technical support to the AT&T sales team. As a key resource and partner, Technical Sales Consultant assures the successful integration and implementation of established company products for AT&T Customers.
Additional Responsibilities:
Participate in joint sales call with AT&T sales representatives providing technical support
Consult with customers in selling and supporting company products and systems
Consult, sell and support highly complex company products/services/systems/solutions
Work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors
Support unit sales plan through pre-sales and/or post-sales technical consulting activities
Provide technical support in sales presentations, product demonstrations, and installation and maintenance of company products
Design technical solutions involving new and emerging technologies
Ensure system is functioning according to specifications
Answer customer inquires concerning system software and applications and provides software development and consultation to prospective users.
Understand, develop and deliver systems/applications solutions to customers business, information, technical and educational needs
Follow both standard & unique non-standard practices and procedures in analyzing situation or data from which answers cannot be readily obtained
May build a mini-application, based on customer requirements, to demonstrate feasibility of the application, often requiring rapid prototyping
Create recommendations, and implements new methods, techniques, and/or procedures
Contributes to unit sales plan through pre-sales/post sales technical consulting activities
Position Self and Subject Matter Expert, Mentor and coach
Leads the technical discussions in client meetings across multiple levels and disciplines to identify business and technical needs, issues and priorities.
Formulate responses to customer inquiries/questions concerning highly complex system software and applications, and provides software development and consultation to prospective users
Qualified candidate will be required to work at customer site, remote response center, corporate location and or other site as needed
Travel as needed
Required Skills and Experience:
Minimum of eight to twelve years in the telecommunications and/or network engineering
Five or more years of previous sales engineering and/or technical sales consultation experience
Exceptional corporate presentation, and relationship-building skills
Strategic thinker with sales intelligence, a strong presence and the ability to create, influence, and drive customer vision
Effective writing skills; ability to support the development of technically focused, solutions-oriented sales proposals
Highly motivated and self-directed with the ability to work well both independently and as proactive team member
Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements into technology based solutions
Extensive working knowledge of AT&T company products and services
In-depth knowledge of functional/process areas
Strong communication skills to collaborate with internal cross-functional organizations and customers
Excellent customer communications, interaction and presentation skills are required.
Must be a team player, who is self-motivated, organized and pays strict attention to detail
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Valid driver's license in the state of employment and insurance
Pass required sales and data assessments
Ability to travel as needed
Desired Skills, Experience and Education:
8 or more years experience in a similar position within the same industry
Proven ability to work with wide range of organizations and extended teams
Network Engineering and/or Capacity Planning Expertise
BS degree in technical related field, Computer Science or Engineering preferred

This technical sales position is responsible for identifying, closing and growing accounts. As an Application Sales Executive, you will be responsible for selling complex/technical products, services, applications, and/or solutions to customers in order to solve their strategic business needs. This technical sales position is responsible for identifying, closing and growing accounts.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
åá This overlay/sales specialist position sells highly complex technical products, new and emerging application services, generates sales and supports the sales efforts of others leveraging product, industry, and/or technological expertise. These applications, products, services and solutions are a high priority for the company and require a high degree of technical product expertise.
åá Typically not account-assigned and called into accounts as opportunities are identified.
åá Manages and coordinates the sales and technical team in support of the sale of the company's highly complex products.
åá Demonstrates broad technical knowledge of company's products and new and emerging application services, in order to develop and present sales proposals and systems solutions for highly critical and complex projects.
åá Serves as technical product expert to develop and present sales proposals and systems solutions, and close complex technical sales.
åá Works independently without supervision and is viewed as an expert in the field by both the company and the customer.
åá Helps to assist less experienced peers and support or close a sale by account-assigned Account Managers, or may identify and close additional opportunities in cooperation with assigned account manager.
Required Qualifications:
Must have 10+ years experience in Firewall, Content Filtering, Intrusion Detection, Secure Email, Secure Access, End Point Security and Network sales.
Must have 10+ years Application Service Solutions Sales Experience
Must have 10+ years telecommunications products, solutions, and services; including security, data sales experience.
Must have 10+years networking solutions, and or leading systems integration sales experience.
Valid driver's license and clean driving record.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelors or Advanced Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Marketing/Sales, or Communications.
Requisition ID: 1630448

categories_jobs_title: Associate Applications Developer TDP Emerging Technologies
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Middletown, New Jersey
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From mobile apps to revolutionary devices, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
The TDP-ET Program is focused on transforming college graduates into skilled technologists. Here, you‰Ûªll be part of a strong network and learn alongside a group of highly motivated peers just like yourself. It‰Ûªs a collaborative environment full of learning opportunities designed to help you evolve your capabilities, challenge your strengths and reach your fullest potential. You‰Ûªll also build mentoring relationships, have access to senior leadership and gain exposure across the company.
Whether you're in the full-time program or the 10-week internship, you'll team up with our internal Technology experts. You‰Ûªll work on high-value projects to help shape the future of Cloud Services, API & Developer Programs, Big Data, Mobile Development, and our User-Defined Network Cloud initiative.
Applying to our Emerging Technologies track means you will be considered for one of four roles ‰ÛÒ Software Engineer, Business Analyst, Scrum Master or Project/Program Manager ‰ÛÒ being placed based on your input and experience identified throughout the interview process. Explore your TDP-ET career possibilities by checking out the Detailed Duties & Requirements here.
Becoming a member of this tight-knit community of innovators has its share of perks including a full benefits package with medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and strong corporate citizenship and environmental stewardship. To qualify you must have a Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree or higher in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math), Information Systems or a related field.
Our employees say it best. Watch now!
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V
AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position.
Requisition ID: 1536684
Apply now Apply now

Location: Middletown, New Jersey
Have you created really cool web applications? Have you developed coding skills without easy-to-use web design framework tools? Do you have some awesome skills and creative genius and you just need the right environment to show it all off? AT&T is looking for a dedicated developer with strong front-end experience, and a proven track record of building high quality web applications.
The selected candidate will be responsible for...
The performance of any/all functions involved in the development and/or maintenance of new or existing applications
Using programming language and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications
Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs
May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications
AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment with a team of designers, architects, engineers and managers who create new applications, maintain existing ones, support production, create designs and enforce policies and standards within our Big Data organization.
If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you!
Required Qualifications -
3+ years of professional front-end development experience using 3rd party libraries and limited web design framework tools - Proficiency with writing code
Desired Qualifications -
3+ years of HTML5, AJAX, JavaScript development, jQuery, and CSS
2+ years of AngularJS experience
Experience with Spring, Tomcat, Jenkins & Maven
Scripting experience
Working knowledge with database technologies, such as MySQL, NoSQL, and MongoDB
Former AT&T employee with experience using Daytona
Experience writing and working with REST APIs and JSON data format
Experience developing in an Agile environment
Must be a self-starter who loves to learn, explore, and most importantly create
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education and technical training
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V
Requisition ID: 1631909
Apply now Apply now
