categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Illinois
Technology Development Program (TDP) ‰ÛÒ Technology Operations
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From our industry leading wireless platforms to fully software-defined networks and world-class cloud infrastructure, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
This 36-month program is designed to transform you into an engineering expert at an accelerated rate. Here, you‰Ûªll learn from diverse perspectives, ideas and talents to gain well-rounded knowledge of the business. Through job rotations across our Network Operations & Engineering organizations, you‰Ûªll be able to gain exposure and explore the career areas that match your unique strengths. That means you may have the chance to customize your career path with multi-faceted placement opportunities ‰ÛÒ from network planning and design, to implementation and optimization.
You'll also have plenty of opportunities to build a lifelong career through project and team leadership opportunities, a specialized development curriculum, and our dedicated mentoring program. Here‰Ûªs your chance to break new ground and help us evolve our business to stay on top ‰ÛÒ all while building your technical, business and leadership skills. You‰Ûªll also be encouraged to join initiatives outside of the program to enhance your experience and share your passion.
After the program? You‰Ûªll have everything you need to support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations & Engineering. That means you‰Ûªll be a big part of keeping AT&T on the cutting edge.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Responsibilities may also include working with Labs, product development, and engineering teams to actually author process documentation, methods, procedures, and guidelines for current network planning, capacity management, and network builds. Coordinates and interfaces with internal and external customers to ensure service commitments are met. Uses engineering tools, various software applications and databases to assist in creating the engineering documents. Prepares / oversees cost/benefit estimates, presentations, negotiations, installation, problem resolution and multivendor product integration. May provide initial implementation support of networks to assure proper execution and provides resolution for system failures or degradations. Provide project management and documentation as required.
Job Contribution: Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within discipline/specialty area. Contributes to development of concepts/methods/techniques. Moderate team impact.
This is a full-time, paid position with employee benefits.
KNOWLEDGE Acquires/demonstrates basic knowledge of principles and methods. Knowledge limited to specific processes/procedures needed to perform assignments within own work area. Basic knowledge of ATT technologies. Limited skill in technical field.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Focused on data gathering/compilation/verification. Completes routine tasks. Reviews/solves routine problems applying clearly defined standard procedures.
INDEPENDENCE Highly directed and supervised; work is assigned, scheduled and prioritized by others. Works on detailed assignments. Work assignment is guided by standard procedures; judgment is minimal.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Contributes through quality and efficiency of own work. Supports technical teams maintaining current technologies.
COMMUNICATION Displays appropriate listening skills to receive training/directions. Exchanges procedural information with immediate colleagues and/or internal customers. Collaborates with others in own area and seeks assistance and feedback as appropriate. Seeks self-development opportunities; demonstrates aptitude for growth.
If you have a degree in Engineering (or a related technical field), a 3.0+ GPA and a passion for innovation, this program just might be your next big thing.
Apply now
Must possess a valid driver‰Ûªs license and successfully complete a Motor Vehicle Record check for rotations that require driving.

Location: Bothell, Washington
The Digital Experience Technology unit at AT&T is seeking a highly motivated, self-starter who is able to effectively implement complex business requirements during the project life-cycle into flexible, reusable, highly scalable and performing components in order to enable new and exciting technology on the att.com website and in the industry leading consumer web store.
Primary Responsibilities:
The Individual should have excellent communication skills that can be used to effectively communicate technical concepts to business teams.
The individual must be able to understand consumer customer requirements with respect to its impact to the success of the business goal and be able to translate them to a technical implementation.
The individual must be able to analyze, design and develop software components in a fast paced multidisciplinary environment and should take complete ownership of technical solution.
The individual must be able to suggest innovative solutions to business problems/processes that leverage technology to provide marketing differentiation, performance improvements, and better user experiences.
The individual must be able to interact well with other technical team leaders such as architects, testing, analysts, and release managers as a lead member of the development team in order to accomplish the business goal.
The individual must be motivated and a self-starter that is able to cope well with uncertainty and change.
The individual must be a self-starter, tenacious, proactive.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or related experience
6-8 years‰Ûª experience in developing software applications including: analysis, design, coding, testing, deploying and supporting of applications
Understand API design/development, Web Services design/development (REST, SOA,etc.)
Proficient in application/software architecture (Definition, Business Process Modeling, etc.)
Proficient in application/software testing (Unit, Integration, System, Case Planning, Design and Execution).
6+ years of J2EE and Java programming experience
6+ years of strong experience in ATG Commerce.
5+ years of experience with ATG Performance Monitor tools.
5+ years of strong experience in trouble shooting production issues in big ATG based
cluster environments.
5+ years of experience in performance tuning of ATG based web applications.
6+ years of experience in object oriented designing using UML and design patterns.
5+ years of experience in using UML development tools like Enterprise Architect,
Rational Software, Borland Together etc..
Strong understanding of Java programming best practices
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS, DHTML, JSP, AJAX, XML, XSLT and basic UI ‰ÛÒTechnologies
6 + years of strong experience in distributed computing concepts
6 + years of experience w/ Java Application Servers, preferably Weblogic.
Strong understanding of SDLC processes and methodologies
6+ years of strong relational database SQL and data modeling experience diagnostic skills
Requisition ID: 1610156
Apply now Apply now

Location: Roswell, Georgia
The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing processes and layouts for complex, large- scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: This position will work closely with the IT, Sales and Marketing organizations functional leads to formulate hypothetical insights and work through the lifecycle of delivering these insights to production. Design and build large and complex data sets, from spurious sources while thinking strategically about uses of data and how data use interacts with data design. Design and implement statistical data quality procedures around new data sources. Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources. Implement any software required for accessing and handling data appropriately. Implement and hand off data checking and updating procedures to teams. Perform statistical analyses with existing data sets in statistical packages. Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization. Research and implement software and hardware related to mobile technology.
Job Contribution: Senior level technical expertise. Deep technical knowledge and subject matter expert on ATT technologies.
Education: Preferred Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing; Data Analytics or Machine Learning nanodegree; or equivalent experience. Experience: Typically requires 5-8 years experience. Supervisory: No.
Requisition ID: 1632678

Location: Roswell, Georgia
Overall Purpose: Responsible for analyzing data in response to new business requests, performing maintenance and changes on interfaces, and identifying and resolving data discrepancies across multiple business applications.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Works directly with the client user community and business analysts to define and document data requirements for data integration and business intelligence applications. Determines and documents data mapping rules for movement of medium to high complexity data between applications. Adheres to and promotes the use of data administration standards. Supports data selection, extraction, and cleansing for corporate applications, including data warehouse and data marts. Creates and sustains processes, tools, and on-going support structures and processes. Investigates and resolves data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies of definition, format and function. Creates and populates meta-data into repositories. May create data models, including robust data definitions, which may be entity-relationship-attribute models, star, or dimensional models. May also create data flow diagrams and process models and integrates models across functional areas and platforms. Works closely with DBAs to transition logical models to physical implementation. May be responsible for employing data mining techniques to achieve data synchronization, redundancy elimination, source identification, data reconciliation, and problem root cause analysis. May also be responsible for quality control and auditing of databases, resolving data problems, and analyzing system changes for quality assurance. Job Contribution: Technical professional with limited experience. Working knowledge of technical principles, learning ATT technologies.
Education: Preferred Bachelors degree in Business, Information Systems, Engineering, Math, or Sciences; Data Analytics nanodegree; or equivalent experience. Experience: Typically requires 1-2 years experience. Technical Career Pathway (TCP) role. Supervisory: No.
Requisition ID: 1631921
Apply now Apply now

Location: Plano, Texas
With the acquisition of DIRECTV, AT&T is now the largest paid-TV provider. Content Analytics at AT&T Big Data examines video viewership patterns to derive valuable insights and drive smart business decisions across AT&T. The Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing processes and layouts for complex, large-scale data sets used for modeling, data mining, and research purposes.
Specific responsibilities and requirements of this opportunity include:
Use data mining techniques to reveal patterns in the data that have implications on the business decisions.
Explore content viewership data using tools such as Pig, Hive, R, Python to create insights that the business can use.
Progressively combine data science skills and knowledge with industry/business knowledge to derive and deliver innovative solutions to business partners.
Use machine learning techniques to build learning models that allow the organization to predict outcomes with business implications.
Continuously monitor industry trends in the data science domain and apply them to create innovative solutions.
Be adept at translating the meaning and significance of the insights.
Collaborate with other experts to constantly innovate.
Expert level competency with scientific data analysis methods, leveraging statistics, data modeling, anomaly and outlier detections, and machine learning methods for classification and deep learning for pattern recognition.
Strong communication and presentation skills are required to effectively convey relevant insights to teams.
Perform analysis, concept implementation, and creates detailed methodology descriptions for data research activities.
Provide documentation and skill mentoring to others.
Exercise judgement on how to effectively communicate highly technical and complex details through the use of visualization and careful selection of "knowns" vs "hypotheticals".
Education: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing required. Masters or Ph.D strongly preferred.

Location: Roswell, Georgia
Overall Purpose: This position is typically found in Big Data and/or customer focused organizations where analysis of Big Data is critical to the success of the business. Uses advanced skills in the use of predictive modeling, statistics, trend analysis, and other data analysis techniques to collect, explore, and identify the right data to be analyzed from internal and external sources to explain or predict behavior and or solve a variety of business problems and monetize products for sale.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Gathers, analyzes, and interprets a wide variety of data to identify causal relationships, trigger points and ultimately make predictions on customer behavior. Projects may include churn analysis, customer behavior and segmentation, sales analysis, product level analysis (adoption, price elasticity modeling) and customer experience analysis. Builds predictive models using data, tests the model on results outside of the sample size and verifies the model in the real world. Quantifies significance of data variances, applies an array of statistical methods ranging from traditional to newly-developing within the Big-Data space. Develops reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids in support of findings. Advises business partners with regards to patterns and relationships in data to recommend business direction or outcomes.
Job Contribution: Senior level technical expertise. Deep technical knowledge and subject matter expert on AT&T technologies.
Education: Preferred advanced college degree in Statistics, Mathematics and or Computer Science or Ph.D. in related fields; Data Analytics nano degree; or related expertise.
Experience: Typically possesses strong understanding of internal business segment or stakeholders and strong presentation skills. Typically requires 5-8 years related experience in advanced analytics, big data, relational database structures, research methods, sampling techniques, and system testing. Supervisory: No.

Description: The Optimization, Reliability and Customer Analytics (ORCA) department within AT&T Research creates and delivers original solutions to some of our Company‰Ûªs (and industry‰Ûªs) most compelling and urgent challenges, ranging from network optimization and reliability, to predictive analytics and modeling, Big Data insights, and agile development and analytics solutions prototyping.
It‰Ûªs an exciting time for us! We are responsible for optimization and prototyping strategic platform elements in AT&T‰Ûªs Domain 2.0 architecture that leverages cloud technologies, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), and Software Defined Networking (SDN), to intelligently scale AT&T‰Ûªs network, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security, performance and reliability. Using Big Data analytics, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations.
We are looking for you, if
You are a strong data scientist with a passion for digging into large data sets and extracting knowledge through data analysis, management, and visualization
You would like to work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business: network and service management, customer and business analytics, network design and optimization, and new service creation
You are able to provide end-to-end predictive and analytical solutions for non-standard problems even when the problem is not well defined
Your solutions involve developing and integrating novel statistical methods and algorithms and then presenting them to clients using R in the AT&T open source collaborative environment RCloud (http://rcloud.social/index.html)
You desire to join an amazing team of professionals helping AT&T solve real world problems through analytics of massive data sets
If selected, you will have opportunities
To invent novel, publishable methodology that advances the multidisciplinary fields of data science and addresses real-world problems
To contribute to these fields through open source projects, led by AT&T
Work closely with other analysts and also various AT&T business unit leaders
Desired Areas of Expertise:
Research background with emphasis on computational statistics, graphics, visualization and/or engineering applications of statistics and data analysis techniques for Big Data
Ability to work well within and between small teams to accomplish data science tasks from data ingestion and cleansing to analysis and presentation
Expertise in one or more of the following areas: time series analysis, multivariate analysis, spatial statistics, functional data analysis, machine learning techniques, statistical computing in R
Experience with very large data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate large data and build implementations of ideas
Strong communication skills
Strong combination of data analytic techniques and algorithm skills
Ability to create innovative solutions
Experience in analyzing text streams, documents, social media and big data, with emerging Hadoop-based big data

Research background with emphasis on computational statistics, graphics, visualization and/or engineering applications of statistics and data analysis for Big Data
Degree such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering from an accredited university

Location: Plano, Texas
The Principal - Technology Security position is responsible for review and analysis of security requirements, works with senior team members to develop integrated plans to protect corporate assets and information technology, and administers security systems to support daily security operations.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Includes researching, recommending, documenting, and coordinating implementation of changes to policies, procedures, facilities, and systems to enhance security as well as developing and delivering corporate security awareness training for users and technical security training for system administrators.
Facilitates compliance with company security policies, practices and legal requirements.
May provide support to non-management employees, including coaching, on-the-job and formal training, reference materials, procedures and system documentation.
Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.
May interface with other stakeholders including vendors, application development and technical support staff, and clients.
May provide inventory and asset management resources to security operation, including administrative supplies, security specific resources such as SecurID cards or cryptographic key management, and specialized security software.
Expert level technical professional. Technical SME within organization.
Contributes through own development of advanced technologies/concepts with global reach or industry application.
Has direct impact on creation of technical products/services.
Serves as a role model and mentor.
KNOWLEDGE - Has extensive specialized technical expertise. Applies expert knowledge and broad understanding of multiple disciplines. Integrates expert knowledge of technical principles/methods of multiple disciplines with knowledge of products/services and internal operations. Advisor on ATT technologies/systems/procedures.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING - Solves complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues. Uses extensive research and interpretative thinking. Utilizes innovative methods in developing solutions. Works on abstract problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables.
INDEPENDENCE - Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY - Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise-wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives.
COMMUNICATION - Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Engineering in Mechanical Engineering with specialization in Industrial Production Engineering or a technical related field
5-8 years experience in IT security.
Knowledge in application security standards and process.
Proficient in database security.
Knowledge in identity and access management (access control and provisioning, theft tactics, etc.) and tools (SecurID cards, etc.)
Knowledge in network architecture and infrastructure components (Carrier-based network routers and switches, IPv6, etc.)
Knowledge in business continuity and disaster recovery (planning, etc.)
Proficient in Security Engineering, Planning and Monitoring
Knowledge in security hardware and software
Knowledge in Anti-virus (Virus, Worm, Malware, etc.)
Proficient in Cyber security tools (Sensage, etc.)
Understands identity and access management tools (SecurID cards, etc.).
Proficient in Cloud Computing (Internet data center architectures, hosting and application services, etc.).
Understands content distribution networks.
Proficient in data leakage prevention (DLP) technologies.
Knowledge in security audit, review, risk assessment, regulatory, controls (Audit and control structures, audit processes (SAS 70), Compliance assessment tools, etc.)
Desired Qualifications -
Certification in CISSP, CISA, CISM, other security or security technologies related certifications (i.e., CISCO, MSFT, Checkpoint, etc.)

categories_jobs_title: Senior Big Data Software Eng (Plano TX)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Do you have a strong understanding of data science applications and the ability to not only bring forward new insights, but also present them in a fashion that allows peer groups to monetize them? How about having the ability to take code and apply it to massive data sets and come up with key business solutions? If so, we may have the perfect career opportunity for you!
Within this role you will get to swim within deep pools of data looking for new insights with the freedom to utilize strategic leadership skills and current technology tools to bring forward the next big thing.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Uses Big Data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications
Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions
Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented
Our mission
Enable discovery and development of meaningful insights from data that inspire continuous innovation and accelerate smarter decision-making.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies
Familiarity with JVMbased function languages including Scala and Clojure
Experience using Hadoop query languages including R, Pig, Hive, Cascalog, and PyCascading
Experience with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark are desirable
Experience working in a highly agile environment
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V
Requisition ID: 1631927
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist (Labs Big Data Research)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: New York, New York
External and Internal
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for strong analysts in a data science field with a passion for extracting insights from large data sets. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business, including network and service management, marketing and customer care, network design and optimization, and new service creation. Many analysts work directly with business unit leaders. All have opportunities to invent novel, publishable methodology that address real-world problems. Increasingly we contribute to multiple data science disciplines through open source projects, led by AT&T.
We typically hire to fill two positions:
Our PhD level Inventive Scientists are technical leaders in their field, establishing external recognition while creating innovative, business-impacting solutions.
Data Scientists will usually have a Master‰Ûªs; they are responsible for the entire data ‰ÛÒ to ‰ÛÒ solution pipeline. They both support the Inventive Scientists and are responsible for their own projects.
Location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise:
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Data visualization - AT&T creates algorithms, systems, and techniques for visualizing new data sets at increasingly large scale. AT&T is especially interested in interactive visualization of very large geospatial and temporal data. One example is our open source project Nanocubes http://nanocubes.net .
- Database management and data quality - AT&T is building high-performance and low latency systems to manage high velocity data streams. These systems are critical for accurate processing and analysis of data from the AT&T mobile network. Analyzing the data to identify glitches, and cleaning the data to minimize distortion while preserving maximal underlying variation, are essential to ensure meaningful big data analytics.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
Please visit http://www.research.att.com to learn more about AT&T Research.
Qualifications
- Inventive Scientist candidates shall have a PhD or equivalent in a data science field, including these most commonly: Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Engineering, and Mathematics.
- Data Science candidates shall have a Master‰Ûªs or PhD in a data science field.
- Experience and passion for finding solutions to real world, applied problems. In addition for Inventive Scientists, established excellence in applied research through publications, new research techniques, open source contributions, and patents.
- Expertise working with large industrial scale data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate data, prototype new tools, and extract actionable insights from that data.
- Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic solutions in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
- Expert-level skills and abilities within field of knowledge, and demonstrated ability to develop new ideas from inception to prototype.
- Accomplished R programmer, and experience coding with other languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java.
- Experience with modern data management systems like Hadoop, NoSQL, and Spark.
- Candidates with 5+ years of relevant experience may be considered for a more senior position.
Qualified candidates may be asked to submit a Research Statement (required for Inventive Scientist applicants) and 3-5 references (required for Inventive Scientist applicants, optional but encouraged for Data Scientist applicants).
Requisition ID: 1615655-1
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist Big Data Research
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for massive data. This helps us learn about our network and our customers, understand products, and improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies - leading our industry in novel methodologies for fraud detection, service quality management, statistical computing, visualization, text mining, data stream management, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for a strong analyst/data scientist with a passion for digging into large data sets and extracting knowledge through data analysis, data management, and visualization. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business: network and service management including new approaches to virtualizing and managing a software defined network, customer analytics such as understanding customer use of entertainment services such as U-verse and DirecTV, and modeling and building of tools which may include anonymized location analytics.
The candidate will partner with research staff to develop and implement statistical models of both structured and unstructured data: call records, locations, text, video, audio. The candidate must have in depth understanding and experience in the entire data ÌÊ analysis ÌÊ results presentation ÌÊ software prototyping process. Deep knowledge of statistical computing ‰ÛÒ with expertise in Hadoop and R ‰ÛÒ are critical to success in this position. The selected candidate will research data sets, apply basic statistical analysis and modeling techniques to characterize customers and extract learnings, and support mapping and other visualizations of results. The successful candidate will practice in broad areas of complex technical project work that requires in-depth analysis using advanced techniques, knowledge, and expertise and provide technical expertise within project teams.
Required Qualifications:
Candidate shall have a PhD or Master's degree in an approved field from an accredited university and a minimum of 0 - 6 years of relevant experience.
Degree such as Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Mathematics from an accredited university.
Entry into this title will require Technical Title Plan (TTP) Board Approval.
Experience and passion for finding solutions to real world, applied problems.
Demonstrated expertise working with large industrial scale data sets and extracting useful actionable insights from that data.
Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic models and iterations in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
Experienced programmer working in the data science ‰ÛÏpipeline‰Û: skilled at data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, and integration. Must be able to write re-usable tools that support other data scientists. .
Accomplished R programmer.
Experience with modern data management and parallel compute systems like Hadoop, HDFS, NoSQL, Spark, etc.
Skilled in Python and at least one tool in the Hadoop ecosystem (e.g. Pig, Hive, MapReduce, or Spark) and experience with SQL and UNIX scripting.
Skills in application development integrating R, HTML and Javascript a plus

AT&T Big Data is growing!
We looking for an experienced SDET to help us build and streamline on our Mobile and Big Data testing and integrations. You will be creating end to end testing that starts by exercises data gathering on mobile devices, pushes that data all the way into the our AT&T data lakes, and then verifies that the data has been properly crunched.

categories_jobs_title: Principal Software Engineer Big Data (Plano TX)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Are you a Big Data Engineer who loves to put things together and build the future from the world's most massive data sets? Why? Because AT&T is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to develop high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, and text mining. We are looking for people with a ton of passion, a desire to try big things, people who have a lot of curiosity and can go deep into the lowest layer of a complex system. We want people who want to learn new things, and people who have a clear customer point-of-view.
The selected candidate will write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications within our Big Data Organization; Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions; Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented; Enjoy working in a highly agile environment.
AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment. If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you!
Desired Qualifications:
8+ years‰Ûª experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies
Hadoop certification is desired and highly relevant
A passion for building things from massive data sets and a passion to create the future in technology
Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM

categories_jobs_title: Sr Specialist Advanced UNIX Technical Support BIG DATA
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Deliver the highest level (Tier-3) of network technical support within AT&T's technical support structure requiring 24x7 on call from escalating organizations including but not limited to Tier-2 Operations and NPE. Provides the technical troubleshooting and leadership skills required to recover from the most complex network problems in real time, directing the activities of technical resources from Tier-2, Labs, and the vendor(s) to restore service. Responsible for the investigation and management of all follow-up activities needed to determine root cause, attempt problem recreation in the Tier Support lab, identify workarounds when feasible, coordinate with Labs for delivery and certification of vendor fixes or design changes, and planning for the eventual implementation within the network. Develop scripts to pro-actively identify known defect signatures and define the least intrusive recovery processes. Develop scripts to extract forensic data from network elements and analyze to identify potential patterns of unexpected behavior needed to understand root cause. Ultimately responsible for the reliability of the end-to-end network and the quality of the delivered service - tracking and analyzing outage patterns leading to identification of chronic issues.
Nature of Contribution- Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within a discipline or specialty area. Contributes to the development of concepts, methods and techniques.
Knowledge - Has expanded technical knowledge in own discipline/ specialty area. Applies broader knowledge of discipline / specialty area standards to work assignments. Sound understanding of one or two specific AT&T technologies, systems and procedures. Deepens technical knowledge through exposure and continuous learning.
Analysis and Problem Solving - Identifies problems and issues. Solves non-routine problems by independently applying judgment to established analysis and standard approaches. Integrates and evaluates multiple factors to develop creative and practical solutions.
Independence - Guided by project and work deadlines; sets own priorities. Uses discretion to complete assignments, independently applying knowledge of technical practices and specialty area standards. Independently completes assignments and participates in projects of diverse scope.
Contribution to AT&T Technology - Supports technical initiatives normally as part of a larger project. Works on development of new technologies or maintenance of existing technologies. Contributes to milestone completion of projects
Communication- Exchanges complex technical information. Provides training and guidance to others in work area by breaking down information in a systematic and logical manner. Cultivates good working relationships with peers.
Additional Responsibilities
Coordinate with and interact as an advocate to the vendor to resolve technical issues as well as troubleshoot with vendors, customers, and peers, and perform root cause analysis
Implement changes to new or existing products and features and will need to have the Use skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry practices and company policies and procedures
Report to a second level manager
Must be available to work in a 24x7x365 environment
Occasional travel may be required
This position may be responsible for contributing to AT&T's compliance with environmental laws and regulations as applicable to its job function. This may include, but is not limited to, work related to fuel tanks, emergency and stand-by generators, boilers, hazardous waste, hazardous materials, batteries, manholes and vaults, water wells, linear and other construction projects, water discharge, or air emissions.
Required Qualifications -
Basic Understanding of Operating Systems
Basic Understanding of Design and Implementation and database development
Basic Understanding of UNIX, shell, awk
Basic Understanding of c, c++, java, python
Basic Understanding of Network Protocols and troubleshooting
Basic Understanding of Hadoop
Desired Qualifications -
Bachelor of Science in CS, EE, Math, Physics, MIS, Telecom, Sciences

categories_jobs_title: Senior User Experience Research BIG DATA
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Applies human behavior principles and methodologies to research problems in order to design the best customer experience for ATT products and services.
At a Senior level, leads the overall user experience design for medium to large projects, and independently executes tasks in the areas of ethnography, user needs analysis, interaction design recommendations, and usability testing.
Project responsibilities include accountability for the outcome of research; applying principles of good User Experience research to all work; helping translate User Experience research findings into design decisions; understanding business objectives and how to balance them with user needs; and develop and analyze business requirements to define and improve applications and business processes. Advanced ability to interpret design principles and standards to evaluate effective designs. Responsible for demonstrating ability to independently conduct research in several research areas - Usability (formative and summative), ethnographic/field studies, surveys, Card Sorts, Personas, time-in- motion studies, heuristic evaluations and Big Data analyses. Should have advanced skills in both qualitative and quantitative analysis methods. Works with some supervision on large to complex projects.
Strong experience User Experience research and wireframe creation (include persona development and user journey recommendations). Strong understanding of visual design principles and implementation
Education: Preferred Master of Science degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interactive Media, Applied Psychology, Information Science, Industrial Engineering, Human Factors Engineering or equivalent experience.
Experience: Typically requires 8+ years of experience.
Requisition ID: 1622793

Location: Sunnyvale, California
AT&T Lead Product Manager is a seasoned professional skilled in developing and implementing marketing strategy for highly complex products and services. As a seasoned marketing professional, the AT&T Lead Product Manager understands the dynamics of the industry, new and emerging products technologies and or applications, has a thorough understanding of AT&T customers needs and ensures the development of a compelling customer experience; driving results and product accountability.
Roles and responsibilities of the Lead Product Manager include but is not limited to the following:
åá Responsible for the success of a product or group of products through development and execution of comprehensive marketing plan including new and emerging products, technologies and/or applications.
åá Be product owner throughout the life cycle
åá Conduct multi-year product planning to determine product life-cycle decisions, ensure consistency with overall marketing and corporate strategy, and achieve product performance, revenue, market share/penetration, and profitability objectives
åá Identify, monitor and analyze internal (e.g. financials, movement, revenue, cost, sales) and external (e.g., technology, market share, competitive) performance parameters in order to reposition, modify features and identify new uses for the product
åá Provide continuing product surveillance and management of established product to attain financial objectives
åá Accountable for revenue attainment and profitability and success of product or group of products through development and execution of comprehensive marketing plan
åá Act as the foremost expert within the product marketing discipline and an acknowledged authority within the organization
åá Develop business plans and product positioning in the marketplace.
åá Provide readout to leadership level regarding products and plans as assigned.
åá Collaborate with other AT&T offer teams to ensure customer experience and business services positions AT&T as the continued leader
åá Work with marketing and sales operations teams to develop service delivery and channel enablement plans.
åá Develop compelling positioning and value proposition and selling tools
åá Market Analysis: assess market and customer dynamics and incorporate into offer development and lifecycle activities.
åá Perform competitive analysis to evaluate product capabilities, pricing, promotion, distribution; analyze how these impact market share;
åá Recommend and implement changes required to be competitive.
åá Rationalize solution offerings by performing map/gap analysis against current offering and market opportunities.
åá Establish requirements to effectively manage and track to a plan of record, including total sales, revenue, churn and contribution
åá Motivate others to action and provide leadership qualities as needed.
åá Foster strong relationships with internal and external resources. Engage with different functional teams and business units (in order to drive business success and optimization.
åá Acts as team lead as needed to provide leadership to less experienced professionals
Required Qualifications:
Five years product management experience with wireless/telecom industry products
Experience with Mobile Analytics
Must be comfortable with conveying the value of new and emerging products, technologies or applications to senior level management and across a diverse product team
Product launch and lifecycle management experience
Previous experience leading a cross-functional organization in executing projects from ideation to completion
Strong analytic and fact-based decision-making skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and operate in a fast-paced, high-growth professional environment
Must possess both outstanding written and oral communication skills
Must be proficient using Microsoft Office products including Word, Power Point, Excel and Outlook.
Ability to clear a criminal background check and drug test.
The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation:
Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax
Desired Qualifications:
Six or more years product management experience, preferably in consumer new product development
Requisition ID: 1608738
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Sr Member of Technical Staff Data Scientist
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
AT&T Labs is seeking qualified candidates to join the Access Architecture & Analytics team to solve challenging technology planning and optimization problems. Successful candidates will utilize advanced statistical and software skills to analyze large scale, complex data sources to develop critical insights to support network architecture, network planning and network operations. The Sr. Member of Technical Staff develops solutions to complex business and technical problems or issues of complex scope using advanced engineering and scientific principles.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Applies engineering principles and practice in broad areas of complex technical project work that requires in-depth analysis using advanced techniques, knowledge, and expertise.
Utilizes advanced statistical and software skills to analyze large scale, complex data sources to develop critical insights to support network design and planning.
Develops advanced software applications with proven skills in the areas of cloud computing, real time analytics, Linux, Hadoop, no SQL databases, Java, Python, C++ and Oracle.
- Has solid academic background in Computer Sciences, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics or closely related fields (PhD or MS).
åá Provides technical expertise within project teams.
åá Seasoned technical professional. Contributes through proven technical expertise. Has significant dept/functional impact.
o KNOWLEDGE - SME within own discipline/specialty area; basic knowledge of other disciplines/specialty areas. Deep technical knowledge. Applies in-depth knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards/processes. Integrates industry experience and deep professional/technical knowledge. Technical leader and recognized expert on select ATT technologies/systems/procedures.
o ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING - Solves unique problems through evaluative judgment/precedent. Independently applies sophisticated analysis in evaluating issues. Develops new concepts/methods/techniques for cross-functional initiatives. Recognizes/pursues alternative methods.
o INDEPENDENCE - Guided by department goals/objectives. Exercises latitude in determining objectives/approaches to projects. Leads multiple small to medium sized projects and technical breadth.
o CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY - Key contributor on complex projects/initiatives. Impacts current and future business opportunities through application of specialized technical/industry knowledge. Develops methods/techniques based on strategic project objectives.
o COMMUNICATION - Mentors and provides technical guidance and explains advanced concepts to others in work area. Coordinates across multiple departments. Promotes active listening and open communication. Provides leadership/guidance to others.
Education:
PhD or MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or applied Mathematics
What makes you stand out:
Proven experience in software development using Java, Python, C++, Oracle, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, TITAN/Cassandra or other No SQL DBs
Experience in cloud computing, virtualization and SDN. Familiar with OpenStack
Strong analytical skills with experiences in real time analytics. Knowledge in SPARK, STORM and R
Requisition ID: 1628803

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist Statistics Research Department Big Data Research
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We have an immediate need for a PhD level Statistician with a passion for extracting insights from data to join our Statistics Research Department. We work on problems from all aspects of AT&T‰Ûªs business, including new service creation, network design and optimization, marketing and customer care. These challenging business problems offer opportunities to establish external recognition while creating state-of-the-art, business-impacting solutions. You will make a difference: to our customers and employees by improving their experience; to our stakeholders by developing cost-effective solutions; and to the academic community as you contribute novel methodology or open source software that address real-world problems.
Our Research Lab enjoys a highly collaborative and academic environment, encouraging experimentation and innovation. Project roles are fluid ‰ÛÒ anyone can be the project lead or team member. Many researchers work directly with business unit leaders, and developing algorithms and solutions can be an interactive experience with them. Primary location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
Qualifications
- PhD or equivalent in Statistics, Machine Learning, or a data science field with an extensive statistics curriculum.
- Established excellence, passion, and curiosity in applied research demonstrated through publications, new research techniques, open source contributions, and patents.
- Expertise working with large industrial scale data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate data, prototype new tools, and extract actionable insights from that data.
- Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic solutions in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
- Accomplished R programmer, and experience coding with other languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java.
- Experience with modern data management systems like Hadoop, NoSQL, and Spark.
Qualified candidates will be asked to submit a Research Statement and 3-5 references. Please visit http://www.research.att.com/ to learn more about AT&T Research.
Requisition ID: 1628166-1
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_requirement:

AT&T is on a transformative journey creating next generation networks that leverage virtualization technologies and Software Defined Networking (SDN). This modern architecture will simplify and scale AT&T‰Ûªs networks to help support the continued growth of Internet traffic, enable rapid deployment of advanced cutting-edge features and services, and provide industry leading security and service experience. This initiative opens up exciting opportunities for research in how networks and services of tomorrow should be designed, operated, and managed at planetary scale. Having access to our real-world systems and data of immense scale, and being able to fundamentally impact one of the largest operational networks and millions of consumers offers unique career opportunities.
Researcher Positions
AT&T Labs Research is looking for passionate and talented researchers to join our team. The team of the Networking and Service Quality Management (SQM) Research organization invents cutting edge technologies that revolutionize how networks and services of tomorrow are designed, operated and managed. We are looking for unique and exceptional individuals who will engage in forward-looking research and who have a passion to drive new and innovative concepts to operational reality.
Our researchers are expected to think big, focus on the future, and conceive, rapidly prototype and explore new ideas and solutions to challenging real-world problems. They are independent thinkers able to lead and drive novel ideas from concept to operational reality. Successful candidates will work closely with fellow researchers, academics, and members of various AT&T business units, and publish high-quality papers at top-tier technical conferences.
Description of position
ECOMP represents a fundamental change in how we will control and manage our networks. While existing operational capabilities may be sufficient to manage individual ECOMP components, proper functioning of ECOMP will depend on cross-component interactions that must be understood and managed. The role of this position will be to invent, build and deploy new operational technology needed to provide a cross-component ECOMP view, understand the end-to-end service performance of ECOMP, expose the ECOMP service topology in order to support service isolation, and enable rapid troubleshooting and resolution of cross-component issues. This new technology will reduce OpEx by automating ECOMP operations, and it will improve overall AT&T customer experience for ECOMP operated services by reducing disruptions in ECOMP and minimizing resolution times when they do occur.
Why this position is critical
While ECOMP and D2 will allow rapid service creation and enable operational savings, the complexity of the new technology we are deploying will bring with it new and significant operational challenges. The ability to effectively understand, manage and address end-to-end cross-component interactions in ECOMP will be critical to realizing the benefits of ECOMP and D2 (i.e., reduced operational cost and improved service delivery.) With the recent loss of key personnel in my organization, we are short staffed to deliver on this vision.
Outstanding individuals with a Ph.D. or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or applied sciences are encouraged to apply. Candidates must demonstrate excellence in research, strong technical and thought leadership skills, a collaborative spirit, strong communication skills, software and systems expertise, and possess a strong passion to make a difference and impact real world systems.
We are seeking candidates with skills in the following areas:
Large-scale systems design and controller technologies
Large-scale data mining and analytics
Software-Defined Networking (SDN), Network Function Virtualization (NFV) and Network Virtualization (NV)
Cloud computing

Location: Greenwood Village, Colorado
As a BI Solutions Analyst, you support the BI Practitioner in the delivery of strategic value to business partners. Success will be measured by your understanding of the business‰Ûªs data requirements and fostering a solution with design of data integration for data visualization that meets the business‰Ûªs needs for monitoring their KPIs/metrics. BISA will also provide ongoing support of the BI information infrastructure to improve the quality and enhance the value of data delivered to business for strategic business projects. As a BISA, you must have the ability to prioritize business requirements, schedule tasks, and communicate progress in a timely manner. Additionally, you must have the ability to present findings in a logical and visual manner to all levels of the organization including executives, management, analysts, and developers.
Essential duties & responsibilities:
Business Collaboration and Drive BI Value for Business Partners (15%)
Provide support to the BI Practitioner for all BI activity for one or more business areas
Engage with business stakeholders on all facets of BI activity
Consult with the business to determine information needs and identify new opportunities to use data assets and analytical tools to drive competitive advantage
Develop business case for new BI solutions
Business Requirements and Analysis (35%)
Provide subject matter expertise of business rules, data definitions and logic
Gather and analyze requirements for BI projects and data requests
Develop prototypes and storyboards to facilitate requirements definition
Facilitate QA and UAT activities with business and BI Delivery teams
BI Project and Business Request In-Take and Prioritization (25%)
Define and initiate BI requests for business stakeholders
Prioritize and validate all BI requests with the business
Ensure quality delivery of BI deliverables (projects, tickets)
Collaborate with IT on enterprise projects with BI impact
Manage stakeholder communications, status, and expectations for BI delivery
Ensure BI project closure / post-mortem
Enterprise Data Governance (25%)
Drive Data Custodianship with key business stakeholders
Engage business partners in Enterprise Data Governance program
Conduct review and solicit feedback of key metrics and KPI with business stakeholders
BA/BS in Computer Science/Management Information Systems or equivalent business degree or strong work experience
Master‰Ûªs degree with emphasis in Computer Science, Computer and Electrical Engineering; Master‰Ûªs in Business Administration is ideal/preferred
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence area
Experience in management consulting preferred
Knowledge, skills and abilities:
Experience using Business Intelligence tools relevant to business area (such as Cognos, Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE), SAS, TM1, Qlikview, Omniture)
Strong knowledge of SQL with relational databases (such as Teradata; Oracle; MS SQL Server)
Strong knowledge with Microsoft Office software
Excellent oral/written skills
Experience using data warehouse/analytical tools for business purposes
Strong knowledge of Business core processes/data required to drive those processes
Strong understanding of source data (its strengths/weaknesses/semantics/formats)
Ability to work with/effectively communicate with people at all levels of the enterprise from Executives to developer
Flexibility/diplomacy/problem-solving skills
Ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements
Ability to effectively work independently/motivated; ability to handle multiple priorities

Roles and Responsibilities:

- Prepare job aid for the features and conduct training for the user teams.

- Manage and maintain active user profile, roles, functions and access to application.

Location: Hyderabad, India
o The Data Implementation Engineer is responsible for delivering integrated network solutions based on the Cisco and Juniper hardware platforms and client specific requirements.
o The Data Implementation Engineer acts as a technical expert and liaises with the Client facing Support, Global Network Architecture and Regional Operations teams to deliver best of class service.
o During times of major faults the Data Implementation Engineer may be called upon to provide problem diagnosis and resolution.(3rd level support)
Roles and Responsibilities:
‰Û¢ Service Delivery
o Provide client solutions based on global standards and hardware blueprints
o Provide capital and resource requirements to Service Delivery team
o Provide design documentation including operational processes and procedures.
o Deployment of fault tolerant client solutions
‰Û¢ Change Management ‰ÛÒ Maintain the integrity of the production environment
o Participate in weekly peer technical and procedural review of all changes submitted to the regional networking team.
o Perform Complex and Client based System Installations
o Track metrics on success and failures
‰Û¢ Optimization ‰ÛÒ Deliver best of class service
o Design Assurance ‰ÛÒ Liaise with Regional Operations team to ensure proposed solution engineered to fit client needs and accounts for all levels of resiliency and allows for growth.
o Ensure compliance with global standards including configuration and OS best practices are applied.

‰Û¢ Strong knowledge of Internetworking theory and practical applications based on the Cisco's and Juniper's design paradigms
‰Û¢ Working knowledge of TCP/IP, routing and tunneling including but not limited to BGP, VRRP/HSRP/GLBP, GRE, IPSec, OSPF, PIM, QoS

‰Û¢ Minimum of five years professional experience with at least two years supporting tier-one global financial organizations.
‰Û¢ Problem-solving skills with an emphasis on resolution of complex technical problems and demonstrated comprehension of integrated Cisco and Juniper enterprise level architecture and design principles
‰Û¢ Familiarity with application load balancers, DNS, DHCP, Windows and Unix operating systems, security architecture including firewalls and proxies
‰Û¢ Ability to focus and perform in time-sensitive high-pressure environment
‰Û¢
Education and Qualifications:
Strong interpersonal skills, including verbal and written communication skills as well as attention to details
Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification required and CCIE is a plus
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering highly desirable.

AT&T Government Customer is looking for a Senior Security Engineer resource with primary focus on the design, implementation and maintenance of network and application firewall instances in accordance with agency security policies and guidelines. Successful candidate should be well-versed with network and security design and implementation best-practices. The resource will support the Web Application Firewall (WAF) tuning and maintenance activities. The WAF requires us to work closely with other network security staff to eliminate threats that could attack our web applications, corrupt data, or steal Customer data. The resource would also be responsible for working with the SOC to tune and improve the firewall intrusion detection systems. This activity would enhance our ability to detect and prevent real attacks by reducing the incidents seen in the SOC. The person may work directly with the Firewall Auditing Tool staff to deploy firewall changes that improve our security posture based on the Firewall Auditing Tool Analysis.
*Imperva WAF certified

* 6-8 years security engineer experience, firewalls, IDS/IPS devices and signatures
* Experience with generating system as-built guides as well as key standard operating procedures in the network security area.
* Strong architectural design and implementation skills
* Bachelors in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience.
* Ability to support operation and maintenance activities in non-business hours as needed
* Ability to work independently as well as in team environments
* Strong oral and written communication skills necessary to clearly understand and document work.
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced team environment and multitask many ongoing tasks simultaneously.
* All work is performed at the customer site in Washington D.C.
* Management has the right to add or change duties and job requirements at any time.
* US Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status.

categories_jobs_title: Professional Systems Administrator Atlanta GA Cricket Wireless
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Atlanta, Georgia
Responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining operating system workstations and servers, including web servers, in support of business processing requirements. Performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages. Schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT policies and procedures. Monitors and tunes the system to achieve optimum performance levels. Ensures workstation/server data integrity by evaluating, implementing, and managing appropriate software and hardware solutions.
Ensures data/media recoverability by implementing a schedule of system backups and database archive operations. Supports media management through internal methods and procedures or through offsite storage and retrieval services. Develops and promotes standard operating procedures. Conducts routine hardware and software audits of workstations and servers to ensure compliance with established standards, policies, and configuration guidelines. Develops and maintains a comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation.
Nature of Contribution- Fully functioning technical professional. Develops new concepts, methods and techniques.
Knowledge - Subject matter expert within own discipline/ specialty area. Applies specialized knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards and processes to work. Integrates company experience and deep technical knowledge and has advanced understanding of select AT&T technologies, systems and/or procedures.
Analysis and Problem Solving - Solves non-routine problems based on analysis of multiple factors. Independently identifies key issues, patterns or deviations from norm. Works on problems requiring judgment and in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Analyzes and interprets research to evaluate and recommend solutions.
Independence - Guided by team goals and operational objectives. Applies judgment to determine appropriate processes and technical area standards to use and provides technical direction to others in own work area.
Contribution to AT&T Technology - Key contributor on diverse projects of moderate scope. Recommends new procedures and processes to drive desired results.
Communication- Explains advanced technical information to less experienced team members. Provides specialized technical guidance to others in work area. Builds productive internal/external relationships and collaborates with others in own team or across teams.
Required Qualifications -
5-8 years experience
Knowledge of UNIX (Solaris, AIX, HPUX, Windows, Linux)
Understanding of Change Management Life Cycle Principles
System Support and Trouble Analysis skills (root cause analysis, alarm management platforms, troubleshooting, etc)
1st level vendor certifications
Desired Qualifications -
BS in Engineering, Computer Sciences or other technical field
Knowledge of call processing
Server & System Administration skills
Knowledge of Analysis Tools (Access 7, GeoProbe, GSTool, RCATS)
Hardware installation and repair skills
Knowledge of OSI network protocol design
Hardware/software skills necessary to support the telephony/voice infrastructure (Aspect, Avaya, Cisco, Nortel)
Knowledge of Configuration, Backup, and Restoral processes necessary to support the telephony/voice infrastructure
Experience using and writing technical documentation
High level vendor certifications (i.e. CCNA)
Requisition ID: 1625050-C
Apply Apply now

Develops and maintains a comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation.

Knowledge - Subject matter expert within own discipline/specialty area and basic knowledge of other disciplines / specialty areas. Deep technical knowledge. Applies in-depth knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards and processes to work. Integrates industry experience and deep professional/ technical knowledge. Technical leader and recognized expert on select AT&T technologies, systems and/or procedures.
Analysis and Problem Solving -Solves unique problems through evaluative judgment and precedent. Independently applies sophisticated analysis in evaluating issues and develops new concepts, methods and techniques for cross-functional initiatives. Recognizes and pursues alternative methods.
Independence - Guided by department goals and objectives. Exercises latitude in determining objectives and approaches to projects. Leads multiple projects of small to medium size and technical breadth.
Contribution to AT&T Technology -Key contributor on complex projects and initiatives. Impacts current and future business opportunities through application of specialized technical and industry knowledge. Develops methods and techniques based on strategic project objectives.
Communication- Provides technical guidance and explains advanced concepts to others in work area. May mentor others in department. Coordinates across multiple departments. Promotes active listening and open communication. Provides leadership and guidance to others.
Required Qualifications -
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or other technical field
8-10 years experience
Knowledge of UNIX (Solaris, AIX, HPUX, Windows, Linux)

MCSE Certified

Knowledge of Configuration, Backup, and Restoral processes necessary to support the telephony/voice infrastructure
Experience using and writing technical documentation
High level vendor certifications (i.e. CCNA)

AT&T Practice Lead - CCIE AT&T Consulting is a seasoned and strategic thought leader with extensive experience designing and developing the IT architecture and implementation plans of total systems solutions for the customer.
Roles and responsibilities of the Practice Lead - CCIE AT&T Consulting include, but is not limited to the following:
åá Support AT&T Consulting and sales opportunities - IT architecture and implementation technologies
åá Key activities include client presentations, Statement of Work (SOW) development and support, RFI/RFP development support
åá Design and develop solutions that assist customers in managing major business processes in their overall enterprise structure
åá Develop and maintain life cycle services including strategy, readiness and other assessments, architecture and complex multi-vendor integration services.
åá Develop third party relationships and coordinate with field leadership to provide resourcing approaches and alternatives to supplement in-house talent based on the portfolio. Partner with Complex Solutions, Network Sourcing, Life Cycle Management, and other AT&T groups in the pursuit of strategic "Capture" opportunities which present potential for both AT&T Consulting and significant pull through.
åá Partner with product and marketing teams to identify ways to improve alignment of AT&T offerings to enhance bundling potential
åá Collaborates and confers with the customer in the strategic design process and translates business needs into technical system solutions.
åá Partner with LCM and other operations teams to define interface points to ensure a smooth transition from discovery / assessment into operational transition for managed services opportunities.
åá Determines the availability and viability of third party components and services as needed and validates third party components comply with established architecture
åá Support development of standardized templates and Knowledge Management artifacts to improve field self-sufficiency. Develop and improve tools and templates for consistent pricing / costing on complex bids. Develop transition and transformation frameworks to enhance standardized approaches for complex and custom deals.
åá Support high level engagement management activities and bill up to 15% on an annualized basis on "wedge" services such as workshops and Strategy and Roadmap.
åá Provide matrixed leadership & communication to field consultants with affinity to IT Architecture and Implementation practices.
åá Assists customer in the development of fully integrated systems including processors, peripherals, communications, operating systems, and applications software
åá Develops and design specifications for products and technologies
åá Designs quality control and test procedures to ensure the deliverables meet established design and performance goals and validates design proposals meet the customer needs
åá Identifies, analyzes, and evaluates alternative design solutions
åá Approves integrated systems design proposals for technical content
åá Establishes the cost and estimates the time for implementations
åá Monitors the implementation for technical correctness to ensure the customer needs are met
åá Creates recommendations and implements new methods, techniques, and/or procedures
åá Travel as needed
Required Skills and Experience
12 or more years of relevant experience
Hands-on experience in IT Architect and Implements on large, complex, and multi-vendor environments
Large scale technical expertise developing proposals and engagement management
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
Experience with Board-level interaction and facilitation of diverse groups and stakeholders.
Outstanding interpersonal skills and responsiveness supporting sales and field management and building best practices for field adoption
Proven ability to grow Consulting and Influenced revenues
Ability to effectively cross-sell multiple practice areas
Demonstrates advanced knowledge of one or more industries, trends, and solutions.
Ability to travel up to 75%

15 or more years of Strategic IT Consulting /Industry experience
Bachelors of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, or MIS is preferred

Location: Bratislava, Slovakia
AT&T Slovakia (Bratislava) is currently recruiting for a programmer/application developer. This is an opportunity for you to work for the world‰Ûªs leading network provider. AT&T is dedicated to providing the next generation of technology and networking. The candidate will have the chance to learn about what is next in the fields of Networking, Workflow design and Cloud Computing to name a few‰Û_.. The future is now, are you ready for the challenge?
Roles and Responsibilities:
A programmer with advance software design and development skills, responsible for designing and implementing the end to end web applications including database, middleware and front end design and development for multiple applications.
- Assess, organize and analyze requirements. Develop and document system specifications.
- Design and implement solutions using Agile/Rapid Development methodology.
- Design and develop data structure and Oracle databases/tables including database partitioning, database performance monitoring and tuning; database backup and replication.
- Develop quality Controls for data mining and data management.
- Design and develop Software (web based or otherwise) for decision support systems, workflow management, data mining/modeling applications.
- Write code and complete programming and documentation using programming language and technology in Unix/Linus and/or web environment. Perform testing and debugging of applications.
- Setup and administer document/file transfer/repository systems such as FTP, SSH, Sharepoint
drive or other similar technologies.
- Analyze, design, program, debug and modify software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs.
Key Competencies and Skills:
The developer should have background/experience in front end application development (Java and related programming) as well as database design/development (Oracle design/development/administration). The candidate should be able to manage the end to end application development/testing/implementation.
- Database Design and Development, database jobs, Oracle SQL and PLSQL
- Java/J2EE, JSP, Servlets, Spring, Hibernate, Web Services, log4j
- SOME Server knowledge on tomcat or weblogic
- Software version control like SVN or CVS
- Web Dev, HTML, JS, CSS, XML, Java Script
- Unix/Linux cmd utilities, shell scripting
- Ability to analyze, manage and process large data volumes
Education and Qualifications:
- MS Degree preferred in Computer Science / Engineering / Math
- Minimum of 5 years experience in software development using skill sets indicated above
Additional Information:
Management/Leadership Skills
- Ability to work with the application users, document user requirements and develop system specifications.
- Ability to work with other programmers, share knowledge and collaborate to deliver applications more efficiently.
- Work on multiple projects at the same time when required.
- Work with users and other team members who are internationally based.
BENEFITS
- Compensation for income loss due to sickness
- Group Life and Health Insurance
- Learning opportunities through the curriculum of AT&T University
- A wealth of discounts in the local area
- Meal Vouchers
