categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Austin, Texas
AT&T Labs Advanced Technologies goes beyond today‰Ûªs current solutions to invent disruptive technologies that will drive future innovations. Our research programs are at the tip of the spear in creating advanced technologies in Data Analytics, Cloud Services, Intelligent Systems, and Networking and Service Quality Management. AT&T Labs draws on a rich heritage of innovation, including eight Nobel Prizes, and a strong culture that encourages openness, teamwork and collaboration across AT&T and within the industry.
This candidate will develop voicemail and Rich Communications Services (RCS) Virtual Network Function (VNF) designs and implementations in support of the next generation Mobility, Enterprise and Consumer products. Candidate will utilize
AT&T Domain Design 2.0 principles and Agile methodology to deliver design work. Responsibilities include:
‰Û¢ Designing Messaging services (VNFs) for deployment in an Openstack environment
‰Û¢ Helping evolve and extend an Open Mobil Alliance (OMA) Network Message Store and associated RESTful API‰Ûªs
‰Û¢ Defining Cassandra or other NoSQL database clustering and replication patterns and schema‰Ûªs
‰Û¢ Managing the definition and maintenance of Heat Orchestration Templates for Messaging VNF‰Ûªs.
‰Û¢ Python scripting in an Openstack environment and devops support.
‰Û¢ Defining service requirements to vendors based on AT&T NVF design principles.
Education: Required: PhD, Masters or Bachelors degree in an approved field such as Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering or Mathematics from an accredited university. Refer to the
Technical Title Plan for a complete list of degrees.
Experience: PhD in an approved field with a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience or Masters in an approved field with a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience or a Bachelors in an approved field with a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience.
Must have working experience with Linux, Python and Openstack.
Experience with ECOMP & AT&T AIC is a plus.
Requisition ID: 1633068

Location: North Carolina
AT&T Strategic Account Manager is considered an expert in providing wireline voice, data and wireless/mobility applications and solutions to AT&Ts global customers. As an expert, the Strategic Account Manager is successful in the development and execution of strategies that focus on meeting and exceeding the business needs of our global clients. AT&T Strategic Account Manager is successful in indentifying key industry trends, leveraging market based knowledge, AT&T portfolio and delivering strategic solutions to the client through a consultative sales approach.
Roles and responsibilities of the AT&T Strategic Account Manager include, but are not limited to the following:
Delivery of technical solutions that meet a wide variety of customer wireline and wireless communication needs
Articulate AT&T strategy and our ability to deliver industry leading network and applications level solutions
Partners with customers to understand business needs, issues, strategies and priorities in order to deliver value-added business solutions
Leverage industry knowledge, applications, and product knowledge in order to find and close opportunities
Acquire and integrate industry knowledge related to general trends, emerging technologies & competitors
Develop and implement AT&T Business Plans
Maintain and cultivate client relationships at management and executive level
Overall revenue growth, customer satisfaction, and the full scope of AT&T relationship performance within a portfolio of one or more assigned AT&T customers. This includes both retention and acquisition activities
Build and Manage sales funnel, analyze and manage pipeline activity, monitor sales activity against assigned quotas, and lead Account Executives toward achieving and exceeding business results
Earn the customer's respect as a business partner and measure success through the use of the Client Relationship Program (Client Business Planning, Stewardship, CAP, and Shared Expectations)
Incorporate executive summary, Return on Investment (ROI) analysis and solutions design to develop customer-specific proposals and presentations

categories_jobs_title: Sr Member of Technical Staff Software Defined Networking
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: San Ramon, California
AT&T Labs Advanced Technologies goes beyond today‰Ûªs current solutions to invent disruptive technologies that will drive future innovations. Our research programs are at the tip of the spear in creating advanced technologies in Data Analytics, Cloud Services, Intelligent Systems, and Networking and Service Quality Management. AT&T Labs draws on a rich heritage of innovation, including eight Nobel Prizes, and a strong culture that encourages openness, teamwork and collaboration across AT&T and within the industry.
The Senior Member of Technical Staff (SMTS) position is part of D2 network system engineering (NSE) organization within at&t labs. D2 NSE organization is responsible to provide design, analytic models and development of Systems Engineering solutions that spans Tech Arch & Design, Tech Dev and Tech Ops to ensure D2 delivery with architectural compliance, homogeneity, optimized capacity, performance and resiliency.
This position will be supporting D2 service realization and system engineering work, including software efficiency study and optimization, capacity planning, and service reliability optimization, including:
Working with cross functional and cross organizational teams (including vendors, Tech Development, and Tech Ops) to define D2 platform and service E2E performance, reliability, capacity planning and management data models;
Develop traffic engineering scenarios for each service in multi-tenant environment under normative, overload, and impaired scenarios;
Develop models to capture service unit cost and optimize VNF software efficiency;
Perform system engineering analysis to validate data models.
Working as SMTS, you will be required to demonstrate your highly technical skills within a specific technology discipline, high self-motivation, fluent oral and written communication skills and sense of urgency. As a SMTS, you will be recognized as a technical leader within a specific area and may lead projects of small to medium size and technical breadth.
Skills and Experience:
Object oriented software development in Java/C++/Python;
Experience and knowledge of Openstack, VMware, KVM/ESXi Hypervisor;
Experience and knowledge of SDN-controllers ODL, Contrail etc.
Experience in system engineering performance analysis or capacity modeling/planning
Understanding of the principles and the current state-of-the-art in SDN and Cloud Computing
Solid knowledge of distributed systems, virtualization, wireless and wireline technologies;
Experience in network modeling, simulation and statistical Analysis using empirical data and field measurements.
.
Required qualifications:
- Ph.D. from top research institutes in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics or another quantitative science with 2-4 years of relevant experience
- Highly motivated individual with fluent verbal and written communication skills and ability to operate in tactical delivery role with sense of urgency
- Passion for understanding and building complex software systems
- Understanding of the principles and the current state-of-the-art in SDN and Cloud Computing
- Solid understanding of distributed systems, virtualization, resource optimization, networking protocols, software
performance and reliability, performance modeling and fundamental design with statistical analysis
- Proficient at algorithm implementation and development in Java/C++/Python
- Knowledge and experience with open source communities
The work location will be San Ramon

Location: Columbia, Maryland
The Information Systems Security Engineer shall perform, or review, technical security assessments of computing environments to identify points of vulnerability, non-compliance with established Information Assurance (IA) standards and regulations, and recommend mitigation strategies. Validates and verifies system security requirements definitions and analysis and establishes system security designs. Designs, develops, implements and/or integrates IA and security systems and system components including those for networking, computing, and enclave environments to include those with multiple enclaves and with differing data protection/classification requirements. Builds IA into systems deployed to operational environments. Assists architects and systems developers in the identification and implementation of appropriate information security functionality to ensure uniform application of Agency security policy and enterprise solutions. Supports the building of security architectures. Enforce the design and implementation of trusted relations among external systems and architectures. Assesses and mitigates system security threats/risks throughout the program life cycle. Contributes to the security planning, assessment, risk analysis, risk management, certification and awareness activities for system and networking operations. Reviews certification and accreditation (C&A) documentation, providing feedback on completeness and compliance of its content. Applies system security engineering expertise in one or more of the following to : system security design process; engineering life cycle; information domain; cross domain solutions; commercial off-the-shelf and government off-the-shelf cryptography; identification; authentication; and authorization; system integration; risk management; intrusion detection; contingency planning; incident handling; configuration control; change management; auditing; certification and accreditation process; principles of IA (confidentiality, integrity, non-repudiation, availability, and access control); and security testing. Support security authorization activities in compliance with NSA/CSS Information System Certification and Accreditation Process (NISCAP) and DoD Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process (DIACAP) process, the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF) process, and prescribed NSA/CSS business processes for security engineering. Candidate may be required to respond to after-hours requests as required in a 24 x 7 environment.
No demonstrated experience is required. Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Computer Science, Information Assurance, Information Security System Engineering, or related discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Four (4) years of ISSE experience may be substituted for a bachelor‰Ûªs degree. DoD 8570 compliance with Information Assurance Systems Architect and Engineer (IASAE) Level 1 is required. CISSP is required.
Required Clearance: Candidate must have a TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph.
Requisition ID: 1622032

categories_jobs_title: Business Insights and Analytics Specialist Cricket Wireless
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Atlanta, Georgia
Be a part of our dynamic team of business and statistical analysts with the goal of providing insight and direction on key questions facing the business. Combine your strategic and technical expertise with your ability to understand the broad view of business initiatives to provide solutions to internal stakeholders. You must be skilled at interpreting and presenting statistical results for a variety of internal audiences, including VPs and Senior Management, using visualization tools such as PowerPoint, Tableau, Power Pivot and Power View, SAS BI or other business intelligence software. Your abilities as a creative thinker and a self-starter will be essential as our team explores emerging growth opportunities for the company and pushes into new territories with subscriber analytics. You must be comfortable manipulating and summarizing large amounts of data and have a true passion to uncover the meaningful insights that can influence action and impacts the bottom line.
Data Management
Ability to access, query, clean and consolidate subscriber data from various sources using SAS & SQL to manipulate large (several million record) data files for regular and ad hoc analyses that can be processed by SAS and/or Excel or visualized by Tableau
Ability to build and support analytical databases as needed
Able to write efficient production level code to support recurring data pulls
Analysis / Modeling
Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and solve for them using analysis to make strategic or tactical recommendations
Work closely with colleagues across Cricket, including: IT, Sales, Operations, Marketing, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, service, and profitability- ROI
A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation.
Develops reports, charts, tables, and other visual aids in support of findings. Advises business partners with regards to patterns and relationships in data to recommend business direction or outcomes.
You will work on projects that help the company integrate strategy, process, technology, and information to increase effectiveness, reduce costs, and optimize performance.
Apply strong experience using Tableau, Power Pivot and Power View, SAS BI or other business intelligence software
Utilize knowledge and experience from gathering, analyzing, and interpreting a wide variety of data as well as modeling experience to describe drivers of subscriber trends. Provide proactive guidance, interpret data and deliver insightful analysis to support churn reducing efforts.
Accurately quantify results of business initiatives, compare against success criteria and, provide variance and root cause analyses
Analyze and predict the effect of macroeconomic and external factors
Projects may include churn analysis, customer behavior and segmentation, sales analysis, productivity analysis, product level analysis and customer experience analysis, time series analysis.
Be able to build explanatory or predictive models using regression, decision trees or neural networks.
Experience using SAS or other Statistical Software
Preferred Education:
BS or Masters in Business, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Decision Sciences
Industry Experience:
Consumer Product
Telecom, high-tech, cable, satellite
Required:
1-2 years in business analysis
1-2 years in creating informative and persuasive presentations with PowerPoint (Tableau experience is a plus)
1-2 years in communicating the results of quantitative analysis to audiences of varying technical expertise
1-2 years of programming in SAS and Structured Query Language (SQL)
1-2 years analytics and data analysis using several of the following statistical techniques
Multivariate regression
Experimental Design and A/B Testing
Forecasting Models
Decision tree analysis
Cluster Analysis
Preferred:
3-5 years in business analysis
3-5 years in creating informative and persuasive presentations with PowerPoint (Tableau experience is a plus)
3-5 years in communicating the results of quantitative analysis to audiences of varying technical expertise
3-5 years of programming in SAS and Structured Query Language (SQL)
3-5 years analytics and data analysis using several of the following statistical techniques
Multivariate regression
Experimental Design and A/B Testing
Forecasting Models
Decision tree analysis
Cluster Analysis
Principal Functional Skills / Competencies associated with this Title:
Business Case Development
Business Process Improvement (BPI)
Business Statistics
Data Gathering and Analysis
Design of Experiments (DOE)
Effectiveness Measurement
Process Management
Process Mapping/Flowcharting
Quality Management
Root Cause Analysis (RCA)
Six Sigma DMAIC Methodology
Six Sigma Framework
Statistical Process Control
Note: Additional skills / competencies may be added to this specific requisition. During the application process, you will be asked to provide your proficiency and experience with all the skills / competencies associated with the requisition.

Our Digital Experience group is looking for a Technical Contractor Team Lead to join their team in either Atlanta, Richardson or Bothell. If you are interested in joining a dynamic team read below. We look forward to hearing from you!

deals and provide critical negotiation support. There is no better time to be a part of our Global Supply Chain team, launching your future at the forefront of strategy development.
As part of the network sourcing branch of Global Supply Chain, you‰Ûªll lead efforts that promote efficiency across AT&T‰Ûªs sourcing process. You‰Ûªll use your experience and knowledge of analytics to negotiate billions in contracts, consult on
strategic initiatives and analyze the implications of sourcing decisions. Your keen eye will come in handy as you conduct engineering design analyses to get detailed breakdowns of vendor products and service costs, using the data to drive
effectiveness in our supply chain.
With projects ranging from digital marketing to sourcing for our multi-billion dollar software defined network, you‰Ûªll need to be comfortable with both technical and non-technical projects while you find new ways to put your talents to work while

To start, you‰Ûªll need superior negotiation, persuasion and communication skills along with a minimum of three years‰Ûª related experience with a Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Business, Finance, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Supply Chain or related field. You‰Ûªll also need the strategic and technical skills to analyze data for problem solving, work with multiple data sources and develop algorithms for data models, and have advanced experience with Microsoft Excel creating pivot tables, arrays and nested formulas. categories_jobs_title: IT Service Delivery Rep Senior Newport RI (Government)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Wakefield, Rhode Island
This position‰Ûªs primary role will be a Field Services Site Lead servicing a large scale Enterprise network. This network includes Cisco, Aruba, Brocade, Juniper, Riverbed and McAfee network devices to include Routers, Switches, Access Points, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), Virtual Private Networks (VPN) and WAN Accelerators. Your team will consist of mid and junior level engineers. As a Site Lead you will be expected to lead a team in network technicians to install and maintain network devices at the site and work with the NOC technicians and Managers to troubleshoot outages and resolve network related issues. You will be responsible to create ticket for maintenance using HPE Service Manager. Candidates will be expected to understand, implement, and follow processes in accordance with current policies and procedures. Perform escalation and additional tasks as directed. The Site Lead will also be expected to educate and train mid and junior network personnel on processes, procedures and technology used in the enterprise.
The successful candidate will be an innovative technical professional, customer service oriented, and highly knowledgeable engineer in the field of Ethernet and IP data engineering with 10 plus years‰Ûª experience as a Network Engineer. Position requires a high level of project coordination skills to manage the execution of maintenance activities and network outages. Experience must include network design, operational support, and configuration of network devices such as servers, routers, switches, associated software tools, and cabling in a large LAN/MAN/BAN/WAN environment. Knowledge of network protocols such as OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP is required. Knowledge and experience working with wireless technologies, Virtual Private Networks (VPN), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and WAN Accelerators and associated technologies is highly desirable. You will be part of a Team of Network Technicians and Engineers. Some travel will be required. Ability to obtain a Government Secret Security clearance is required.
Skills: The ideal candidate will have a passion for excellence and continual improvement, combined with an entrepreneurial spirit, a strong leader, strong written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, innovative thinking in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Strong customer service and communication is necessary to ensure customer satisfaction and network reliability. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills with Servers and Cisco devices is required. Position requires a high level of project coordination skills to manage the execution of maintenance activities. Ability to lift up to 50lbs is required.
Education: A Bachelor in Science with an emphasis in Computer Science or a related technology field is highly desirable. Other evidence of intellectual, technical, business accomplishments, and related technology leadership experiences will be considered. Cisco CCNP and Security+ required. ITIL foundation V3 certification is highly desirable.

Location: Columbia, Maryland
The senior release manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing all activities necessary to implement production platform upgrades across an enterprise consisting of numerous geographically dispersed sites. Duties include: Work with program management, the development and platform engineering teams, impacted internal stakeholders, and the customer to plan the release windows and cycles across the enterprise product portfolio; Plan and manage all release activities; Communicate release plans, details, and schedules to stakeholders as required; Coordinate work between teams at different locations as needed; Conduct Release Readiness reviews and walk throughs as needed; Develop and communicate release schedule and plans and ensure alignment across key partners and vendors; Lead release fielding activities including the execution of deployment plans and post-deployment verification of changes; Manages key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and notification lists; Maintain and control configurations across all deployed assets; and continually work towards making improvements in the release process, including development of scripts and automation tools to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms. The candidate will develop and maintain troubleshooting and problem resolution procedures for common issues, and will share this information with tier 1 staff to enable faster problem resolution. The candidate will also develop sufficient expertise and understanding of operational dataflows and functionality such that they can effectively respond to issues escalated from tier 1 staff. This response may include direct resolution of the issue or deeper troubleshooting to further isolate the source of the problem prior to escalation to the appropriate experts in development or platform/network engineering.
The candidate must have 5+ years experience in release management for complex, distributed data processing and communications systems. This experience must include hands-on execution of software deployments for custom-developed applications running in a Linux-based environment. Linux proficiency is required. Working knowledge of IP networking and communications is necessary to effectively perform this role. The candidate must be thorough and detail oriented, diligent in creating and maintaining release-related documentation, and capable with MS Office products needed to produce comprehensive release plans, schedules, and supporting materials such as diagrams and charts required to help convey detailed release information. The candidate must also possess 1-3 years of experience performing a tier 2/3 support role for application and dataflow issue isolation and resolution. As part of this experience, the candidate must have experience in problem isolation, with the ability to integrate data from multiple sources to quickly and efficiently find and remedy or escalate problems for resolution. Experience utilizing a trouble ticketing system to capture and communicate key information about problem/incident resolution status is beneficial. Excellent verbal and interpersonal skills are a must. The candidate must be comfortable interacting with internal and customer organizations to convey critical release planning and status information, and routinely gather stakeholders to review release plans and gain concurrence. A bachelor‰Ûªs degree is required, preferably in computer science or an engineering discipline.

Responsibilities: As a Site Lead you will be expected to lead a team in network technicians to install and maintain network devices at the site and work with the NOC technicians and Managers to troubleshoot outages and resolve network related issues. You will be responsible to create ticket for maintenances using HPE Service Manager. Candidates will be expected to understand, implement, and follow processes in accordance with current policies and procedures. Perform escalation and additional tasks as directed. The Site Lead will also be expected to educate and train mid and junior network personnel on processes, procedures and technology used in the enterprise.
The successful candidate will be an innovative technical professional, customer service oriented, and highly knowledgeable engineer in the field of Ethernet and IP data engineering with 10 plus years‰Ûª experience as a Network Engineer. Position requires a high level of project coordination skills to manage the execution of maintenance activities and network outages. Experience must include network design, operational support, and configuration of network devices such as servers, routers, switches, associated software tools, and cabling in a large LAN/MAN/BAN/WAN environment. Knowledge of network protocols such as OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP is required. Knowledge and experience working with wireless technologies, Virtual Private Networks (VPN), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and WAN Accelerators and associated technologies is highly desirable. You will be part of a Team of Network Technicians and Engineers. Some travel will be required. Must be a US Citizen. Ability to obtain a Government Secret Security clearance is required.
Skills: The ideal candidate will have a passion for excellence and continual improvement, combined with an entrepreneurial spirit, a strong leader, strong written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, innovative thinking in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Strong customer service and communication is necessary to ensure customer satisfaction and network reliability. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills with Severs and Cisco devices is required. Position requires a high level of project coordination skills to manage the execution of maintenance activities. Ability to lift up to 50lbs is required.
Education: A Bachelor in Science with an emphasis in Computer Science or a related technology field is highly desirable. Other evidence of intellectual, technical, business accomplishments, and related technology leadership experiences will be considered. Cisco CCNP and Security+ required. ITIL foundation V3 certification is highly desirable.
APPLICANTS SELECTED WILL BE SUBJECT TO A GOVERNMENT SECURITY INVESTIGATION AND MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR ACCESS TO CLASSIFIED INFORMATION.
Requisition ID: 1629164
Apply now Apply now

Location: Columbia, Maryland
This is a senior-level engineering job to help define and implement AT&T Public Sector Solutions (PSS) secure mobility solutions for PSS customers. The candidate will work as a member of a technical team to thoroughly understand US Government (USG) guidance on secure mobility such as the NSA/IAD‰Ûªs Commercial Solutions for Classified (CSfC) Capability Packages, NIAP Protection Profiles, and DoDI 8420. The successful candidate will apply/adapt current and future AT&T mobility services, mobile industry technology, and information assurance tools and techniques to build solutions that comply with USG guidance. This job includes consideration of business interests and strategies for cybersecurity and cloud computing, so selected candidates will work with a range of information assurance topics and products. Specific responsibilities are to foster a thorough understanding of mobile threats and vulnerabilities across the technical team; develop and validate design options and architectures; document, explain and demo solutions to clients and business stakeholders; manage technical tasks to budget and schedule. The job requires interaction with cross-functional peers in AT&T, vendors and USG leads to develop product roadmaps, assess impacts, establish priorities, justify schedules and budgets, provide status, resolve issues and mitigate risks
Responsibilities:
- Guide development of security requirements and architect, implement, and evaluate security technologies to protect cloud-based systems
- Provide support for technical issues and ensure that all components of security around the cloud are properly implemented
Qualifications: Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science from an accredited university
- At least six years of hands-on experience in security research or engineering
- At least two years of hands-on experience securing cloud-based platforms and services - Prefer expertise in areas of OpenStack, SDN controllers (Contrail), and virtualization (KVM and VMware)
- Deep understanding of enterprise networks, midpoint, and endpoint security risks both traditional and cloud environments
- Experience with security technologies to include one or more of: IDS/IPS, vulnerability scanning/assessment tools, penetration tools, Wireshark/tcpdump, web proxy, network access control system, data loss prevention, antivirus/malware prevention and analysis, correlation and security and event management and visualization platforms and tools
- Strong understanding of networking protocols to include IP v4/v6, TCP/UDP, SSH, SSL/TLS, DNS, and HTTP; prefer comfort with VLAN and VRF; prefer knowledge of OpenFlow
- Prefer programming experience for testing/prototyping, automation, and analysis/development of OpenStack APIs in one or more languages to include Python, Node, PHP, or Java - Comfortable with Linux and Microsoft Windows-based systems
- Advanced degrees and job-related certifications preferred
Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and possess or be able to attain TS/SCI with poly.
Requisition ID: 1631640

Location: Bangalore, India
Description: AT&T is seeking highly skilled and motivated Storage Administrators who will be responsible for managing and supporting our AT&T Backup and Storage environment.
As part of our senior staff, you will work in cooperation with our Tier1 and Tier2 administration teams as well as our cloud tenants to maintain maximum stability, performance, and security for a large volume of hosts.
Aside from this, Tier3 administration partners with our project management teams to roll out technical enhancements, migrations, and expansion projects to keep our environment scaled appropriately.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Backup and Storage operations and maintenance. Installs new software releases, system upgrades, evaluates and installs patches and resolves software related problems. Sectionalizes trouble between hardware and software. Performs system backups and recovery, possibly using non-standard tools and methods. Maintains data files and monitors system configuration to ensure data integrity. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision; typically reports to a project leader or manager. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.
Provides 2nd and 3rd Tier support, coordinating timely resolution of problems related to computing hardware and software. Involves consulting with clients, hardware and software vendors, application programmers and the networking (WAN/LAN) support groups. Includes direct technical support for all products delivered in this 7x24 hour environment.
Responsible for monitoring and responding to technical hardware and software problems utilizing a variety of testing tools and techniques. Performs capacity planning, system administration, system tuning, problem analysis and hardware/software upgrades. Develops administrative policies, documentation and procedures to ensure that company assets are properly maintained and operated. Performs testing and establishes system acceptance criteria on current and new hardware and software. Develops local administrative policies and procedures to ensure database and system integrity. Conducts meetings with the clients and other support groups to establish critical dates and LAN and client/server requirements, determines training needs and develops system administration guidelines tailored to the work environment. Coordinates the delivery and staging of client/server hardware and software. Completes documentation needed for inventory and installation planning.
This role may have responsibilities for Domain 2.0 deployment and operations. Working with other operations support teams as well as our cloud tenants to maintain maximum stability, performance, and security for our Cloud environments which hosts both VNFs and application VMs. Supporting various Tier 3 partners with development, architecture, and project management to roll out technical enhancements, migrations, and expansion projects associated with Domain 2.0.
Key Competencies and Skills:
Required skills:
‰Û¢ Strong Storage/Backup Experience (preferably NetBackup, Avamar) ‰ÛÒ configurations, tuning, upgrades, migrations, complex troubleshooting
‰Û¢ Skilled in Linux/Windows environment
‰Û¢ Solid understanding of server network routing
‰Û¢ Fluent in English
‰Û¢ Analytical, detail and result oriented team-player
‰Û¢ Experience with working on implementing projects is a plus
‰Û¢ Certifications welcomed
‰Û¢ EMEA working hours
‰Û¢ Willing to participate on a rotational on-call schedule
Education and Qualifications:
‰Û¢Bachelors of Science in Information Systems Technology, Computer Science or Engineering preferred
‰Û¢Technical certifications or experience with one or more of the following; OpenStack, Linux, VMWare, SDN or cloud virtualization
‰Û¢Backup and Storage operations and maintenance
Additional Information:
‰Û¢ Further education, trainings, certifications and career opportunities.
‰Û¢ Demanding and interesting job.
‰Û¢ International and multicultural teams working on Tier 2 and Tier 3 levels of technical Service Assurance and Service Delivery support.
‰Û¢ Modern workplace to make your job comfortable.
‰Û¢ Advanced medical program.
‰Û¢ Company risk life insurance, pension scheme
‰Û¢ Centre teambuilding events

categories_jobs_title: Lead Product Marketing Mgr IOT Analytics
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Dallas, Texas
As a Lead Product Marketing Manager you will have the responsibility for managing the AT&T Analytics-as-a-Service offer and ecosystem supporting AT&T‰Ûªs Internet of Things (IoT) portfolio.
The selected candidate should have a clear understanding and experience in telecommunications including connectivity, IoT hardware such as sensors and asset tracking devices, Software-as-a-Service platform experience and the overall ecosystem needed to support connected cars, connected devices and IoT products. This position will require working with cross functional teams and interfacing with industry/vertical experts to identify future trends and gaps and translating the information into delivering relative IoT solutions and offers to support market demand and evolving market verticals.
In this role you will define the overall IoT market opportunities, pricing, positioning, sales and support models, and the product roadmap based on enterprise customer needs, competitive landscape as well as market and technology trends. You will work with cross-functional teams including Product Development, Operations, Finance, Business Development, Channel Management, Legal, Training, and Marketing Communications specialists to launch new IoT products and services. You will assist in growing the business by creating the external go-to-market strategy including value proposition, target market, channel readiness, new channel development, sales programs, pricing models and marketing programs.
Key Responsibilities include:
Product Marketing and Business Planning: Own the day to day management of the IoT portfolio including the product/solution definition and marketing strategy, setting business goals, positioning and pricing of the product, communication of the product to various sales and distribution channels, develop the product promotion strategies, sales tools and customer experience mapping
Offer Lifecycle Management: Evaluate and enhance the product attributes and develop new or enhanced product feature functionality to achieve business goals. Partner with Supply Chain to manage partner/supplier contracts. Own the product revenue goals, product forecast and business case while also managing customer retention goals by partnering with various sales segment leaders. Monitor performance based on gross add, revenue, churn, ARPU, and marketing program targets
Marketing Analysis: Use primary and secondary market research to assess market and customer dynamics and incorporate into offer development and lifecycle activities. Perform regular competitive analysis to rate product capabilities, pricing, promotion, distribution; analyze how these impact market share; recommend and implement changes required to be competitive. Rationalize product offerings by performing gap analysis against current offering and market opportunities
Product Definition: Define the product roadmaps to deliver differentiated solutions. Craft and implement user experience requirements with internal stakeholders and suppliers. Partner with Product Realization, Operations, Supply Chain, and Business Development to ensure high quality customer experience is delivered
Marketing Programs: Co-develop marketing strategy and work with Marketing Services team and vendors to operationalize marketing programs, including collateral, web, advertising, PR, events, acquisition and customer-based marketing and sales promotions. Partner with distribution channels and Field Marketing to implement and track initiatives
Pricing: Work with Finance, Supply Chain, Product Realization and other cross-functional teams to set product pricing and promotions to meet business goals, cost objectives and ensure compelling and competitive offer
Channel Strategy: Work with the team lead to identify primary distribution channels and continually expand channel breadth in support of offer goals. Develop tools and partner with Channel Management to promote channel effectiveness
Partner Management: Work with team lead to identify channel target partners to drive incremental revenue through new distribution methods. Partner with key software services vendors, Value-added Resellers, Location and messaging aggregators to create an end-to-end solution. Develop joint selling and marketing programs designed to grow revenue and market share, expand distribution channels and market reach, create bundles, and secure funding and dedicated resources
Qualifications:
Existing IoT Product Management and Statistical Analytics experience is required.
Direct experience working with various cloud-based IoT industry leaders such as Jasper Wireless, IBM, HP, Microsoft, etc.
In-depth knowledge of IoT sensors and carrier-based IoT competitive solutions.
Project Management experience (PMP Certification would be considered a plus)
Partner/Vendor relationship management skills
Knowledge in the areas of CTIA and Mobile Marketing Association guidelines for Privacy is also highly desirable
Equivalent of Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business or Engineering. Master's degree preferred
Minimum of 5-8 years of direct experience with IoT, M2M or Connected Car analytics platforms and AaaS services
Demonstrated ability to partner with internal cross functional teams
Self-starter with excellent written and verbal skills
Must have experience managing partners and vendors to include marketing development funds, partner field sales/marketing representatives, and partner strategy
Strong analytic and fact-based decision-making skills (Data Science Certifications are highly desirable)
Proven ability to translate ideas and vision into product definition and requirements
Proven ability to launch and support ideas and vision
Proven ability to work on and track multiple projects simultaneously Proven ability to successfully partner with other organizations including technology, go-to-market, and device teams
Strong written, verbal and oral presentation skills
Strong strategic thinking skills
Working knowledge of assigned product(s), company functions, marketing and/or service policies and procedures and excellent communication.
Requisition ID: 1620981
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: IT Sr. Analyst 2 Service Monitoring and Automation
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Denver, Colorado
Description
Are you someone who loves technology, has a passion for continuous improvement, and can quickly understand and adapt to new concepts? If so, YOU are the person we want to meet! If you want a job that has great compensation and benefits, offers free TV programming including sports packages, an onsite gym, pool table, video games, and a fun culture, you have found your dream job!
Job Summary
In the role of IT Sr. Analyst 2, Service Monitoring and Automation you will work as a member of AT&T Entertainment Group Application Services Monitoring team. Application Service Monitoring is a team of professionals dedicated to improve services, applications and infrastructure availability by providing proactive monitoring and alerting for all components of the application stack (HW, Networking, OS, Middleware, Databases, End-Points, Applications and Business services by minimizing MTTR with tools and data that help during troubleshooting process and root cause detection, by providing automatic remediation and integration with run book automation, by supporting Security with infrastructure, tools and data to help with proactive threat detection and analytics, by extending capabilities of Capacity Planning providing performance data for infrastructure components, middleware and business applications, by supporting compute ready and cloud initiatives with dynamic and fully automatic deployment of monitoring solutions in private and public clouds.
We have a great suite of tools to be successful in the role including the latest technologies in end-to-end performance analysis of applications. The tools set we employed includes HP BSM, HP SiteScope, HP RUM, HP BPM, HP Operations Manager, HP NNMi, HP Virtual Performance Viewer, HP uCMDB, Splunk, AppDynamics, Aternity, TeaLeaf. We also develop some visualization and integrations in hose.
In this role you will be working with internal Networking, Infrastructure, Incident Management, Problem Management, Application support, DBAs, Infrastructure Design, and many other teams providing them with metrics, support troubleshooting effort, designing new monitoring solutions and integration points, develop easy to use data visualizations and dashboards, and providing knowledge transfer and internal training.
The Application Services Monitoring team operates on a 24x7x365 basis; on-call/off-hour may be required.
Essential Duties:
Support and Manage HP monitoring tools: OML, OMW, OMi, BSM, BPM, RUM, uCMDB, SiteScope, NNMi and vPV
Support and Manage Splunk infrastructure
Manage AppDynamics environment
Designing, implementing, and maintaining monitoring policies
Troubleshoot to resolves incidents related to Monitoring tools
Support installs and configurations of Monitoring software products
Deploying, configuring, operationally maintaining and scaling HP Monitoring tools, Splunk, AppDynamics and Aternity for large environment, business critical applications
Mentor peers in the use, administration, and customization of Monitoring team tools and applications
Customize and extend Monitoring solutions based on business requirements
Debug low level operating system, networking, and application problems including Linux (RedHat) and Windows operating systems
Develop Python scripts, Shell scripts, Perl scripts, Visual Basic scripts, PHP scripts and batch scripts for monitoring needs and automations
Develop custom applications using HP and Splunk APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) and industry standard programming languages to meet business needs
Troubleshoot and critical problem resolution
Initiate and maintain service desk tickets to include receiving or identifying incident/problem, track process, find resolution, make necessary correction to the incident/problem area, and close ticket
Support the ITIL model for best practices of IT processes
Create reports for metrics of system incidents, problems, and requests for all Monitoring products and distribute to appropriate members
Proactively monitor the performance and availability of key business components in production environments
Open and follow up on vendor product support tickets and enhancement requests
Troubleshoot hardware and software incidents both locally, and remotely
Maintain quality control and customer service; work with vendors, and customers internal/external
Follow established polices and processes; improve process documentation in areas of responsibility
Take ownership of assigned tasks and drive to completion; provide status and follow-up as needed
On call; must be willing to support flexible working hours, including nights and weekends
Candidate may also be required to participate in the weekly on-call rotation; frequent overtime may be necessary.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or strong relevant and comparable experience.
5+ years of functional experience
Highly tuned problem solving and analytical skills are necessary for this position
Excels in Information Technology in a large distributed data center environment
3+ years of professional administrator level experience with at least two of the following HP Monitoring tools: OML, OMW, OMi, BSM, BPM, RUM, SiteScope, NNMi, uCMDB. Alternatively 3+ years of professional administrator level experience with Splunk.
2+ yeas of system administration and debugging experience on following platforms: Windows and Linux
Automation of common tasks with Perl, Python, Shell scripts, VB scripts, and batch files
Network configuration and troubleshooting on large IP networks
Performance monitoring, system tuning, high availability, and capacity planning experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience writing technical documentation
Must be customer-focused and have demonstrated strong teamwork, problem solving, and organizational/planning skills
The ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is also essential
Ability to produce effective results under pressure
Ability to adapt to technical changes in the industry
Possess good time management and priority skills
Must be self-motivated, maintain positive attitude, high-energy, and able to work with minimal day-to-day project guidance
Exercises wide latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments
Ability to work varying shifts
Support for the environment 24 X 7
Some travel may be necessary (5%)

Location: Great Falls, Virginia
Seeking experienced Cybersecurity and Incident Response Operations Analyst to manage confidentiality, integrity, and availability of internal and customer-facing networks and protection of vital information from cyber adversaries. This position will involve cybersecurity incident response threat validation and reporting, incident and threat coordination and communication, participation in the development of cyber analysis growth and improvement opportunities and advisory boards, extensive writing and briefing opportunities, certification & accreditation activities, and developing reports and risk assessments for several government programs.
The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, customer-focused, team player, and be able to coordinate and collaborate on multiple issues simultaneously with many stakeholders. Candidate must have relevant networking experience (e.g. TCP/IP stack, DNS, BGP, metadata, IDS/IPS) and be able to serve as a Subject Matter Expert in security event identification, known threat validation and analysis, and network vulnerability analysis and reporting. Candidates must have expertise in security information and event management tools (HP, Trustwave, OSSIM, etc.), collecting and analyzing host-based (Windows, Linux, or Solaris) and network-based data, using Computer Network Defense or forensic tools, gathering and interpreting information, performing Internet research, identifying mitigation strategies, and effectively communicating results. Should have demonstrated analytic ability to discover unknown, suspicious or exploitation activity and analyze exploitation opportunities and expertise to evaluate and recommend information security enhancements, product upgrades, and tools to ensure minimal exposures. Excellent communications skills, that include the ability to provide formal documentation of analysis and/or research results to include briefings, reports, writing, training of lower tiers, and editing at a technical/professional level, are required. Candidates should possess a bachelor‰Ûªs degree, as a minimum, in a related field such as math, science, computing, or engineering. A minimum of 5 years of relevant cybersecurity experience is required. Must be flexible with work hours and willing to work shifts when required to meet mission needs.
Required Clearance: Must have and be able to maintain a TS clearance (polygraph desired)
Desired: Desired candidates should be methodical and prolific writers with acute attention to detail. Candidates should have a minimum of 3-5 years security incident handling expertise within a security operations center. Understanding of government Tier 1 security operations center roles and responsibilities and computer network defense playbooks or incident response plans related to security operations are desired. Candidate should have relevant networking experience (e.g. TCP/IP stack, DNS, BGP, metadata, IDS/IPS) and be able to coordinate with other security teams in areas such as security event identification, known threat validation and analysis, and network vulnerability analysis and reporting. Security+, GCIA, CEH, CIH, or CISSP certification is desired. Security operations experience with HP Arcsight in the role of incident responder is desired. Incident handling with 8-10 years security operations center expertise supporting customer-facing elements and internal security information management systems. Prior experience with open source vulnerability tools such as Nmap, Autoscan, Nessus, Wireshark, Snort, etc. is desired. Understanding of government Tier 2 security operations center roles and responsibilities, computer network defense playbooks and incident response plans, and business continuity plans related to security operations are desired.

Location: Los Angeles, California
Description
Senior C++/Java Developer
Part of what makes the DIRECTV experience the best in the world is our cutting-edge technology. Our award-winning Engineering department develops end-to-end technology solutions to are used to provide the best video entertainment experience available. Our Software Engineering division is looking for a passionate and inventive principal engineer to join the Set-Top-Box Platform Development group. The Platform Development group is responsible for turning the vision of our next generation video experience into reality by providing the core services and functionality of our set-top-box platform. We develop the audio & video pipeline, search algorithms, guide databases, recording management systems, encryption/network services, and web/graphics frameworks that are the foundation of the set-top-box platform.
As a principal engineer, you will be entering the world of technical leadership. You will need to take initiative to solve problems and recommend enhancements for our software systems. You will be expected to provide technical leadership on projects and help guide less experienced engineers through development efforts. You will be responsible to design and execute on multiple projects.
You will be expected to work with system engineers, user experience designers, and project leads to scope and plan the design and development phases of project life cycles. Opportunities to lead projects will be available.
At the heart of it, we are seeking someone that wants to design and develop software in fun, challenging, and rewarding environment. You will get the opportunity to see your efforts come to life and be used by millions of people.
Qualifications
Qualifications
5+ years of experience developing software applications with Java and C/C++
5+ years of experience developing multi-threaded and distributed application systems in a Unix/Linux environment
Ability to design the interfaces of software components 25%
Ability to create sequence diagrams and data flow models 10%
Ability to scope and estimate required development efforts 5%
Ability to perform memory analysis or recommend code optimizations 10%
Ability to write automated unit tests 25%
Knowledge of networking and interprocess communication
Ability to learn new technical skills and functional areas
Understanding of software development life cycles
Experience developing in a Linux environment
Must be willing to work occasional extended hours
Domestic and International travel may be required
Embedded Software Development

Location: Durham, North Carolina
The Principal - Technology Security position is responsible for review and analysis of security requirements, works with senior team members to develop integrated plans to protect corporate assets and information technology, and administers security systems to support daily security operations.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Includes researching, recommending, documenting, and coordinating implementation of changes to policies, procedures, facilities, and systems to enhance security as well as developing and delivering corporate security awareness training for users and technical security training for system administrators.
Facilitates compliance with company security policies, practices and legal requirements.
May provide support to non-management employees, including coaching, on-the-job and formal training, reference materials, procedures and system documentation.
Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information.
May interface with other stakeholders including vendors, application development and technical support staff, and clients.
May provide inventory and asset management resources to security operation, including administrative supplies, security specific resources such as SecurID cards or cryptographic key management, and specialized security software.
Expert level technical professional. Technical SME within organization.
Contributes through own development of advanced technologies/concepts with global reach or industry application.
Has direct impact on creation of technical products/services.
Serves as a role model and mentor.
KNOWLEDGE - Has extensive specialized technical expertise. Applies expert knowledge and broad understanding of multiple disciplines. Integrates expert knowledge of technical principles/methods of multiple disciplines with knowledge of products/services and internal operations. Advisor on ATT technologies/systems/procedures.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING - Solves complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues. Uses extensive research and interpretative thinking. Utilizes innovative methods in developing solutions. Works on abstract problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables.
INDEPENDENCE - Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY - Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise-wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives.
COMMUNICATION - Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or Engineering in Mechanical Engineering with specialization in Industrial Production Engineering or a technical related field
5-8 years experience in IT security.
Knowledge in application security standards and process.
Proficient in database security.
Knowledge in identity and access management (access control and provisioning, theft tactics, etc.) and tools (SecurID cards, etc.)
Knowledge in network architecture and infrastructure components (Carrier-based network routers and switches, IPv6, etc.)
Knowledge in business continuity and disaster recovery (planning, etc.)
Proficient in Security Engineering, Planning and Monitoring
Knowledge in security hardware and software
Knowledge in Anti-virus (Virus, Worm, Malware, etc.)
Proficient in Cyber security tools (Sensage, etc.)
Understands identity and access management tools (SecurID cards, etc.).
Proficient in Cloud Computing (Internet data center architectures, hosting and application services, etc.).
Understands content distribution networks.
Proficient in data leakage prevention (DLP) technologies.
Knowledge in security audit, review, risk assessment, regulatory, controls (Audit and control structures, audit processes (SAS 70), Compliance assessment tools, etc.)
Desired Qualifications -
Certification in CISSP, CISA, CISM, other security or security technologies related certifications (i.e., CISCO, MSFT, Checkpoint, etc.)

Location: Atlanta, Georgia
1. Responsible for end-to-end project or program management throughout the life cycle of a software/system development project/program (may be internal or external client facing).
2. Directs and leads the efforts of a project/program team to deliver a completed project/program and/or service.
3. Consults directly with internal or external clients on business goals, tools, strategy and best practices of software development.
4. Has full accountability for managing concurrent projects/programs of any complexity including projects/programs that span multiple regions, functions and/or business units.
5. Directs team's activities utilizing the organization's software development life cycle (SDLC). Interacts with other project/program managers and with the Account Management organization to ensure alignment of project goals and progress with client needs and client priorities.
6. Utilizes knowledge of business, industry and technology to incorporate business process improvements into the organization and/or to develop business strategies and function/business/technical architectures.
7. Must have thorough understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) processes and tools and must advocate for adherence to standards.
8. Must have working knowledge of business practices in at least one specific business software domain. Level 2 and 3 employees must spend 70% or more of time performing the duties described above and must record time accordingly.
9. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Conducts end to end project management of multiple large projects and may also manage sub components of a large program.
10. Leads cross functional teams to complete projects or program deliverables within allotted timeline and budget.
11. Identifies key internal/external stakeholders necessary for project completion and develops overall strategy for executive of high value projects.
12. Defines project scope and objectives, guides activities of a project/program team including delegating tasks to team members, identifies resources, and establishes master timeline for deliverables.
13. Projects/programs are very complex in nature, rarely follow a repeatable framework, typically span multiple business units or are company-wide, and require a high level of analysis to create project/program plans for new concept projects/programs.
14. Work with external vendors and internal stakeholders to champion project(s) across the entire organization. Develops detailed work plans, schedules, estimates, resource plans, and status reports.
15. Conducts project/program meetings and is responsible for project/ program tracking and analysis.
16. Ensure adherences to quality standards and reviews project/program deliverables.
17. Manages the integration of vendor tasks and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables.
18. Provides technical and analytical guidance to project team. Recommends and takes action to direct the analysis and solutions of major problems.
19. Communicates effectively to client/vendors/leadership.
20. This position will be part of team responsible for supporting and maintaining Cisco Enterprise VoIP technologies. In addition, this person will monitor and maintain the TDM and SIP connectivity to all sites on the platform to include remote sites using various standalone PBX technologies. As well as provide Tiered support for telephony users and contact center operations.
21. Job Contribution:
a. Senior level technical expertise.
b. Deep technical knowledge and subject matter expert on ATT technologies.
c. Provide level 3 support for telephony environments
d. Participate as a 'hands-on' engineer on project deployments
e. Perform adds, moves & changes to the Cisco enterprise telephony solution
f. Create & update documentation to ensure operation teams have current and accurate data representation of all deployed telephony environments.
g. Monitors internal voice communication systems performance to assure dependable and uninterrupted operations.
h. Must be able to work on call 24X7 and/or weekends as needed

‰Û¢ Experience with administering, configuring, deploying Session Border Controllers, media gateways, soft-switches and or IP PBX (Cisco ISR/ASR, Sonus Networks)
‰Û¢ Experience with administering, configuring, and deploying unified messaging solutions. Integration of multimedia messaging technologies such as e-mail, voicemail, fax, and short messaging service (SMS).

Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs. May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications. Job Contribution: Fully functioning technical professional. Develops new concepts/methods/techniques. Has meaningful team/dept impact.
KNOWLEDGE Subject matter expert within own discipline/specialty area. Applies specialized knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards and work processes. Integrates company experience and deep technical knowledge.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Solves non routine problems based on analysis of multiple factors. Independently identifies key issues, patterns or deviations from norm. Works on problems requiring judgment and in depth evaluation of multiple factors. Analyzes/interprets research to evaluate and recommend solutions.
INDEPENDENCE Guided by team goals and operational objectives. Applies judgment to determine appropriate processes and technical area standard; provides technical direction to others in own work area.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Key contributor on diverse projects of moderate scope. Recommends new procedures/processes to drive desired results.
COMMUNICATION Mentors less experienced team members in work area explaining advanced technical information and providing specialized technical guidance. Builds productive internal/external relationships. Collaborates with others in own team or across teams.
Required Qualifications -
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or related field
3-5 years experience in developing software applications including: analysis, design, coding, testing, deploying and supporting of applications.

Proficient in application/software architecture (Definition, Business Process Modeling, etc.)
Understand application/software development.
Proficient in application/software testing (Unit, Integration, System, Case Planning, Design and Execution).

Proficient in internet technologies/programming (WSDLS, HTML, DHTML, XHML, XML, .NET, Active X, SSL, HTTP, Weblogic, Websphere, etc.).
Understand operating systems (Linux, Unix, Windows).
Understand programming languages (C, C++, Java, Javascript, Ruby, Jboss, Perl, VXML, XML, etc.).
Desired Qualifications -
Understanding of project management process
Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams

Location: Los Angeles, California
Description
Job Description:
Do you want to have a direct impact on the millions of DIRECTV‰Ûªs satisfied customers?
Do you want a meaningful job that is challenging and know that your work is making a difference to DIRECTV products?
Our award-winning Engineering department develops end-to-end technology solutions to be used to provide the best video entertainment experience available. Our Software Engineering division is looking for a passionate and inventive software engineers to join the Set-Top-Box Applications Development group.
Our Set-Top Box Rapid Application Development team develop our user interface AND the business logic to drives all of the user interface screens which include our DVR functionality, recording management, recommendation engine for the most advanced HDDVR on the market today. Our engineers partner with our design, graphics teams as well as other engineering teams of DIRECTV to define, create and build the best customer experience across our DIRECTV platforms.
DIRECTV isn‰Ûªt just about watching TV. Our software engineering group pushes the limits of our technology. Our goals is to make watching TV easy and simple, AND at the same time, have it truly be an entertainment experience that is only available through DIRECTV.
How is this achieved? It takes a lot of smart people who are passionate about DIRECTV, passionate about technology, and passionate about innovation!
We are looking for developers who have strong computer science fundamentals, who can easily adapt to change and learn, and most of all, are super excited about the rapidly changing world of TV and video.
If you want to be part of this talented team of engineers, we have a home for you!
Qualifications
Responsibilities include:
Develop new features in a large and robust Java user-interface code base in a Linux environment under the direction of a senior developer
Maintenance, bug fixing and stability support of DIRECTV software of multiple STB platforms.
Contribute to the entire software lifecycle: architecture, design, coding, testing, integration, deployment, maintenance and support.
Lead development efforts and
Investigate complex problem reports to identify root causes and propose and implement solutions under strict deadlines under direction of a senior team developer
Must work independently with limited supervision.
Must take initiative on tasks and communicate ideas effectively.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related subject
Basic knowledge of Java and object oriented concepts.
0-2 yrs of developing software application with Java/C/C++ in a Linux environment, using version control in an IDE environment
Strong knowledge of Java/C/C++ Programming
Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, and self-motivated
Ability to learn new technical skills and functional areas
Understanding of software development life cycles
Experience developing in a Linux environment
Experience using software version control and issue tracking systems
Ability to work independently or in a team
Ability to effectively communicate ideas and solutions to software development problems in written and verbal form
Ability to successfully complete multiple tasks
Must be willing to work occasional extended hours
Domestic and International travel may be required
Additional Desired Skills:
Mercurial/GIT Version Control
Embedded Software Development
Interprocess Communication
Memory Analysis
Code Optimization
Unified Modeling Language
HTML5
Multi-threaded Programming
Job
Engineering

categories_jobs_title: Set Top Box Product Test Tool Developer
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: El Segundo, California
STB Product Test, Tool Developer
About DIRECTV
DIRECTV provides world class digital content delivery and is continuing to expand its role as the largest digital video service provider in the world - diving into engineering challenges with OTT Content Delivery, Mobile streaming, Video on Demand, Interactive Services, Recommendations, and Dynamic Ad Insertion. Challenging our teams to produce innovative solutions more quickly we are seeking talented, energetic engineers to develop and architect the future of cloud infrastructure that scales seamlessly to meet the growth of services and exceed customer performance expectations. Our vibrant, fast paced environment is the perfect place for an enthusiastic engineer to thrive in.
Key Metrics:
DIRECTV entertains over 37 Million Subscribers
DIRECTV has $30 Billion in Annual Revenues
DIRECTV is the Undisputed Leader in Sports
DIRECTV offers NFL Sunday Ticket
DIRECTV ingests thousands of Local Channels in the U.S.
DIRECTV has offices in Los Angeles (Headquarters)
DIRECTV Blimp features the world's only 2,100-square-foot LED screen
About YOU
You are a solid software developer (JavaScript) with a strong software engineering background. You have experience with web services, web programming languages, object oriented and other technologies. You have developed software applications, designed and implemented databases and debugged and root-cause analyzed fairly complex software problems. In this role you will play a key role in supporting the testing efforts of our Network Emulation Lab (NEL). You will develop the web applications used to support the validation of the software within the STBs, making the validation process more efficient.
You have the ability to work as an individual contributor as well as a team participant, in a multi-task priority changing environment and you communicate effectively both verbally and on written form.
This is a purely a development role, focused on the development of testing tools used for application validation that will help usher in a new modernized way of doing business. You will get the chance to work with emerging technologies, while working with a large and growing engineering operation where you will have ample opportunity for career growth and mobility opportunities.
What You Will Do @ DIRECTV
åá Design and implement code (primarily in JavaScript, Java/Java EE, HTML and related technologies) in accordance with software design documentation, requirement specifications, and senior staff direction.
åá Maintain (fix/refactor/optimize) existing software applications.
åá Document source code.
åá Troubleshoot and document bugs associated with tools.
åá Perform unit and system testing of code.
åá Support users of test systems and tools.
Minimum Qualifications:
åá BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related disciplines
åá 3-8 years of professional software development experience, with significant experience developing web services (i.e. RESTful) and Ajax applications
åá 3-8 years of experience developing dynamic, web-based applications, with significant experience in JavaScript
åá Experience designing and developing for databases (intermediate level SQL and NoSQL proficiency desired)
åá Experience systematically using version control and bug tracking systems (SVN)
åá Strong foundation in Software Engineering Best Practices
åá Development of medium complexity software applications
åá Web application development
åá Excellent aptitude for debugging and root-causing of software and system issues
åá Ability to work as an individual contributor or as a team participant
åá Ability to work effectively in multiple tasks and with changing priorities
åá Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly orally and in writing
Nice to Have:
åá HP ALM/Quality Center Usage, and development (APIs, Workflows and DB Schema)
åá Linux (user, GUI + command line)
åá MEAN Stack
åá SQL Server/Mongo/MySQL development
If you like this description, you‰Ûªll love this job. We want you to help us get much better at what we do. Want to know more? Contact us.

Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From mobile apps to revolutionary devices, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
The TDP-ET Program is focused on transforming college graduates into skilled technologists. General Responsibilities:
The candidate will develop, validate, and execute high quality test procedures for both the in-house test team as well as third-party test houses. From hardware specifications documents, the candidate will develop and present high-level test plans to the Technical Review Board (TRB) for their approval. The candidate will provide technical assistance to the automation team for automating manual test procedures. The candidate will provide training to other test engineers for newly developed tests, and provide technical assistance to all other members of the team when needed. The candidate will validate test failures and provide additional feedback to the TRB and vendors to help find the root cause.
General Skills:
The candidate should have excellent English technical communication skills, both verbal and written. The ideal candidate would have extensive understanding of RF principles, digital communications, and test engineering methodologies. The candidate must be able to work well in a fast-paced market-driven environment.
Education and Experience Requirements:
åá B.S. degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or related field
åá 3+ years of practical experience in hardware test development and/or hardware test/quality assurance engineering.
åá Extensive understanding/experience in RF communications and digital communications.
åá Understanding of digital communications standards, e.g. 8-PSK, FSK, QPSK, QAM.
åá Good troubleshooting and analytical skills.
åá Expert-level familiarity with different types of electronics lab test equipment such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, signal analyzers, power meters, modulators/demodulators, upconverters/downconverters, signal generators.
åá The candidate must also have knowledge of using different operating systems including: Microsoft Windows XP/7/8, Linux.
åá Direct experience/knowledge with RF components, e.g. power dividers, mixers, couplers, filters, attenuators is required.
åá High RF frequency experience is highly desired (up to Ka band).
åá High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including writing macros
åá Experience with lab view highly desired
åá Familiarity scripting code for automation

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for the strategy, roadmap, performance and requirements of core services that fuel a product experience and delight customers. You will drive the products, features and functionality from end to end of the product lifecycle, understanding the needs of the consumer with a firm grasp of industry trends and competitive landscape. Partner with cross-functional teams from design and concept to innovate‰Û_to engineering and IT to build‰Û_to project management, customer care and operations to execute, launch and support.
In this role, you will be the hub-of-the wheel across these organizations. Join a winning team of great people who are passionate about redefining TV through innovation and unconventional thinking!

- Strategic and creative thinker who understands the broader vision and can formulate a cohesive plan around that vision.
- Extensive domain knowledge in media and entertainment.
- Holds a combination of technical and business acumen.
- Solid interpersonal skills - demonstrated ability to influence and develop strong working relationships with a broad range of individuals across different functions and levels.
- Strong communication skills
- able to distill key information from different points of view, create presentations and articulate recommendations to senior management
- Able to synthesize and articulate complex issues, see how details come together to form the bigger picture.
- Strong organizational and analytical skills; attention to detail.
- Has the mindset of a team player who works in a collaborative, cross functional manner.

- Passion for redefining TV!
