Analyze reported production issues within the context of business requirements and design specifications to determine the appropriate remediation path
Assess potential impacts to business operations and negotiate potential solutions and associated priorities with stakeholder groups
Author executive summaries to explain issues and implications to senior leaders
Facilitate regular meetings with cross functional stakeholders to review status and next steps for outstanding issues
Install & configure software updates and deploy application code releases to Production & Non-Production environments
Proactively identify opportunities to streamline integrated job workflows, implement automation and monitoring solutions
Contribute subject matter expertise to IT projects to support the design and delivery of quality solutions
Evaluate solution designs to proactively eliminate potential production problems and contribute supportability requirements
Participate in standard processes for Access, Incident, Problem, and Change Management
Coordinate with Development, Network, Infrastructure, and other organizations necessary to get work done
Qualifications
Qualifications
Must be able to demonstrate strength development and data analysis using PL/SQL, Hive/HQL, Pig, Scoop, Java
Must take a logical approach to solving complex technical problems
Must be able to work in a team atmosphere
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to articulate complex technical issues within a business context
Must be presentable to senior leadership and business partners.
Must demonstrate aptitude for learning new technologies
Must be a self-starter who exhibits motivation to contribute, develop, and succeed
Must have familiarity with ITIL framework for Incident & Problem Management and AGILE software development methodologies
Experience:
Required
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent experience
6 years experience in a professional IT Role doing systems administration, development, quality assurance or production support
6 years working with Oracle databases, performing administration tasks, writing SQL, and analyzing large datasets
4 years of development experience using PL/SQL, Java, web technologies, or Hadoop tools such as Hive, Pig, Scoop
4 years OS administration experience with Linux / Windows, with basic knowledge of Unix administration
4 years experience with wlst, ant, perl, shell or other scripting languages
An understanding of J2EE and basic java application management tasks
Preferred
Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent experience
Experience working with the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem using Cloudera Manager Enterprise and associated tools
Experience administering Hadoop cluster environments and tools ecosystem: Cloudera/Horton Works/Sqoop/Pig/HDFS
Experience using ETL & Reporting tools such as Informatica, Business Objects, Cognos, and MicroStrategy
Experience setting up batch processes using scheduling tools (Autosys)
Experience working with monitoring tools such as AppDynamic and Splunk
Experience administering java application servers: Oracle WebLogic Server, Tomcat, jBoss
Job
Information Technology

categories_jobs_title: Sr. Manufacturing Test Development & Validation Engineer
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: El Segundo, California
General Responsibilities:
Develop, Setup, Analyze and Perform Parametric measurement test for AEIS/DirecTv Server/Client, Gateway wireless and related indoor/outdoor (LNB, Active Antenna, Reflectors) products. Work closely with Engineering, Global OEM and Contract Manufacturers (CM) and Service/Return Centers to collect and analyze production/field failures data and follow up on implementation of required improvements to enhance quality of test packages and associated coverage at all levels of production. Work collaboratively with Product Management and Engineering teams to identify and document solutions to failures uncovered during source/incoming inspections or reported by the field and ensure that all failures are corrected effectively and efficiently.
Meet products‰Ûª testing needs of the organization by Developing Comprehensive Products‰Ûª Manufacturing Test plans based on functional and technical specifications. Candidate will be a key hands-on contributor in the product development life-cycle. Candidate will work closely with the Design/Development teams to identify, validate and report failures and anomalies uncovered during product testing and ensure that all failures and anomalies are corrected and effectively addressed prior to product launch. Ensure that test results are thorough and clear so that sound decision making can be achieved in relation to the functional specification and customer expectations.
General Skills:
The candidate for this position must have the ability to work as an individual contributor, team member in a position to develop comprehensive test plan for Se-top Box and related products on tight schedules, throughout the development cycle.
Specific Responsibilities:
åá Develop, validate and audit PCBA and System test packages, according to specification, for wired and wireless Server/Client Satellite Receivers, Gateways, and supporting indoor/outdoor (Video Bridge, LNB, SWM, Switchers, etc‰Û_)
åá Strive for efficiency in performing product functionality, usability and interoperability testing according to approved test plan and test schedule.
åá Perform logical validation process of failures prior to dissemination of information to functional groups or suppliers.
åá Analyze problems in processes and resolved them accordingly.
åá Identify, analyze, and document hardware defects and work with the hardware development teams and respective component/system suppliers to troubleshoot and resolve issues.
åá Manage multiple priorities and tasks in a dynamic work environment.
åá Work collaboratively within a team environment to meet aggressive goals and high quality standards.
Core Competencies:
Problem Solving/Analysis: Break down problems into smaller components, understand underlying issues, simplify and process complex issues, understand the difference between critical details and unimportant facts.
Product Knowledge: Be proficient in product feature, understand products limitations and required Functional/End-Users Tests for full functional validation of the products.
Teamwork: Meet all team deadlines and responsibilities, listen to others and value opinions, help PM‰Ûªs to meet launch target and goals.
Education and Experience Requirements:
B.S. Degree in EE, MS preferred
5+ years of practical experience in hardware development and/or software/hardware test/quality assurance engineering. Good troubleshooting and analytical skills is highly required.
In-depth working knowledge and ability to effectively use different types of test equipmentsuch as Digital Oscilloscope, spectrum/Network analyzers and commercially available ATE equipment for RF/Audio/Video, wireless technology and PSU products.
Experience in RF, Wireless communication Protocol, MPEG video compression, ATSC, satellite communication and Internet data transmission protocols.
Detailed working knowledge of test standards and protocols.
Experience in managing and developing engineering processes and equipment according to required specification
Expertise in developing test cases and test plans
Admirable knowledge of test methodologies and related software
Profound knowledge of test workflows and associated products
Excellent communication skills in both oral and written forms
Good understanding Six Sigma and Lean manufacturing method

Location: Sunnyvale, California
AT&T Lead Product Manager is a seasoned professional skilled in developing and implementing marketing strategy for highly complex products and services. As a seasoned marketing professional, the AT&T Lead Product Manager understands the dynamics of the industry, new and emerging products technologies and or applications, has a thorough understanding of AT&T customers needs and ensures the development of a compelling customer experience; driving results and product accountability.
Roles and responsibilities of the Lead Product Manager include but is not limited to the following:
åá Responsible for the success of a product or group of products through development and execution of comprehensive marketing plan including new and emerging products, technologies and/or applications.
åá Be product owner throughout the life cycle
åá Conduct multi-year product planning to determine product life-cycle decisions, ensure consistency with overall marketing and corporate strategy, and achieve product performance, revenue, market share/penetration, and profitability objectives
åá Identify, monitor and analyze internal (e.g. financials, movement, revenue, cost, sales) and external (e.g., technology, market share, competitive) performance parameters in order to reposition, modify features and identify new uses for the product
åá Provide continuing product surveillance and management of established product to attain financial objectives
åá Accountable for revenue attainment and profitability and success of product or group of products through development and execution of comprehensive marketing plan
åá Act as the foremost expert within the product marketing discipline and an acknowledged authority within the organization
åá Develop business plans and product positioning in the marketplace.
åá Provide readout to leadership level regarding products and plans as assigned.
åá Collaborate with other AT&T offer teams to ensure customer experience and business services positions AT&T as the continued leader
åá Work with marketing and sales operations teams to develop service delivery and channel enablement plans.
åá Develop compelling positioning and value proposition and selling tools
åá Market Analysis: assess market and customer dynamics and incorporate into offer development and lifecycle activities.
åá Perform competitive analysis to evaluate product capabilities, pricing, promotion, distribution; analyze how these impact market share;
åá Recommend and implement changes required to be competitive.
åá Rationalize solution offerings by performing map/gap analysis against current offering and market opportunities.
åá Establish requirements to effectively manage and track to a plan of record, including total sales, revenue, churn and contribution
åá Motivate others to action and provide leadership qualities as needed.
åá Foster strong relationships with internal and external resources. Engage with different functional teams and business units (in order to drive business success and optimization.
åá Acts as team lead as needed to provide leadership to less experienced professionals
Required Qualifications:
Five years product management experience with wireless/telecom industry products
Experience with Mobile Analytics
Must be comfortable with conveying the value of new and emerging products, technologies or applications to senior level management and across a diverse product team
Product launch and lifecycle management experience
Previous experience leading a cross-functional organization in executing projects from ideation to completion
Strong analytic and fact-based decision-making skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and operate in a fast-paced, high-growth professional environment
Must possess both outstanding written and oral communication skills
Must be proficient using Microsoft Office products including Word, Power Point, Excel and Outlook.
Ability to clear a criminal background check and drug test.
The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation:
Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax
Desired Qualifications:
Six or more years product management experience, preferably in consumer new product development
Requisition ID: 1608738
Apply now Apply now

Responsible for maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber systems and networks. Supports cyber security initiatives through both predictive and reactive analysis, articulating emerging trends to leadership and staff. Coordinates resources during enterprise incident response efforts, driving incidents to timely and complete resolution. Performs network traffic analysis utilizing raw packet data, net flow, IDS, and custom sensor output as it pertains to the cyber security of communications networks. Reviews threat data from various sources and develops custom signatures for Open Source IDS or other custom detection capabilities. Correlates actionable security events from various sources including Security Information Management System (SIMS) data and develops unique correlation techniques. Utilizes understanding of attack signatures, tactics, techniques and procedures associated with advanced threats. Develops analytical products fusing enterprise and all-source intelligence. Be able to conduct malware analysis of attacker tools providing indicators for enterprise defensive measures, and reverse engineer attacker encoding protocols. Interfaces with external entities including law enforcement organizations, intelligence community organizations and other government agencies such as the Department of Defense.

Desired skills: Candidate should have UNIX Administrative skills; Command Line Scripting skills (PERL, python, shell scripting) to automate analysis task; Desired of hacker tactics, techniques and procedures (TTP); Be able to conduct malware analysis; Demonstrated hands on experience with various static and dynamic malware analysis tools; Knowledge of advanced threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures (TTP); Understanding of software exploits; Ability to analyze packed and obfuscated code; Comprehensive understanding of common Windows APIs and ability to analyze shellcode. Typical minimum requirements: Bachelors degree from an accredited college in a related discipline and 1 year experience or 3 years of professional experience with an IT Associates Degree.

categories_jobs_title: UX Designer Digital Experience Cricket Wireless
categories_jobs_requirement:
Atlanta, Georgia
As the Lead Professional User Experience Designer you will lead and manage a team of user experience designers toward development of user experiences for Cricket Wireless digital products. You will be responsible for developing and implementing the User Experience vision and strategic direction for digital products. In this role you‰Ûªll lead a team of user experience designers and drive process, consistent standards and push towards meet or exceeding business goals. You will also be gather and understand requirements and translating/ developing UX documentation (site maps, user flow diagrams, transaction flows, sketches, use case scenarios, wireframes, navigation models) for both digital experiences across multiple channels (web, mobile, tablet, social). The Lead will perform individual contributions as needed to support the team.
This role will also work closely with other team members including other Information Architects, Content Strategists, Product Owners, User Researchers, as well as Creative, Technology and Strategy groups.
Utilize industry best practices and UX standards to define and implement user interfaces that effectively communicate to Cricket Wireless sales and support teams. A firm understanding of user-centered design processes and interaction design principles will be crucial to success in this role. A level of comfort working collaboratively, interactively and in Agile will also drive success.
Required:
- 5+ years‰Ûª experience as a user experience designer, information architect, interaction designer, or experience designer (or similar role)
- Advanced proficiency in a variety of design tools including Axure, Omnigraffle, InDesign as well as the MS Office Suite and other prototyping tools
- Demonstrated ability to execute on UX of complex transactional interfaces, taxonomies and metadata frameworks, and templates for content management systems
- Demonstrated experience creating innovative experience across web, mobile, tablet, and social channels
- Demonstrated experience conducting user research and translating user research into design decisions
- Demonstrated experience using web analytics data to inform design decisions

Location: Any, Singapore
The role will be part of the Business Management team within Technical Services International (TSI). TSI has responsibility for the design, implementation and operation of all internal IT infrastructure across International (i.e. outside the domestic US).
This role has responsibility for all aspects of Service Management within TSI working as part of a global virtual team. The focus will be on critical sites and services in multiple countries but with focus on services delivered in Mexico and Europe due to recent and planned expansion there.
The successful candidate will have a strong IT technical background (to degree level or by several years of working in a technical IT role) and may have applied that knowledge in a previous Service Management role in a large organization. A qualification in the ITIL framework is highly desirable as you will be responsible for applying and developing process strategies and concepts.
The role will be responsible for developing and applying the Service Management strategy across the organization working with Project Teams, Engineers and Managers across all technologies, geographies and time zones.
Included is responsibility will be to drive service and process excellence, and delivery of new functionality, by being the customer advocate within TSI
Roles and Responsibilities:
Primarily the role has responsibility for:
‰Û¢ Managing, monitoring and improving TSI services at critical sites and for critical service

‰Û¢ Acting as a pipeline manager in the VPMO process ensuring quality services are successfully launched into the live environment through effective quality gates
‰Û¢ Developing, documenting, applying and improving service management processes
‰Û¢ Ensuring the processed are adhered to by all TSI International Staff
‰Û¢ Leading and running the service and process improvement
‰Û¢ Leading root cause analysis and problem elimination
‰Û¢ Developing and reporting on Service Management metrics
‰Û¢ Working with partner groups and vendors on items related to critical service and sites
‰Û¢ Providing education and coaching on service management to all TSI associates
‰Û¢ Contributing to financial management ensuring cost effective services
‰Û¢ Driving continuous improvement in the above areas
TSI services consist of the following:
‰Û¢ All typical office infrastructure ‰ÛÒ desktop PC, telephony, LAN, file & print, email, SharePoint, WAN, intranet. Microsoft technologies.
‰Û¢ Call Manager services, based on Cisco technologies
‰Û¢ Contact centre technologies for some 20 customer care centers worldwide, based on Cisco technologies
‰Û¢ Mobility services including, but not limited to, Blackberry Enterprise Services and other Smartphone services
‰Û¢ Infrastructure services such as servers (including virtualization), storage, backup, security and disaster recovery
‰Û¢ Teleconferencing based on Cisco Telepresence
‰Û¢ Internal business applications based on Sun, HP, Dell and IBM platforms
‰Û¢ Emerging technologies and services such as HVD, BYOD, Mobile computing
‰Û¢ Multiple interfaces to AT&T WAN technologies including most leading edge WAN services
Key Competencies and Skills:
MUST be fluent in English. Fluent Spanish is an advantage.
‰Û¢ Previous Experience as a successful Service Manager in a large organization
‰Û¢ Degree in an IT discipline or a closely related relevant discipline or strong relevant IT experience
‰Û¢ Strong background in IT with a focus and interest in service and process improvement.
‰Û¢ Certification in ITIL, ideally to Manager‰Ûªs Certificate level
‰Û¢ Familiarity with project management frameworks or methodologies
‰Û¢ A confident, open communicator and be capable of working independently and remotely from your immediate management team
‰Û¢ Able to demonstrate the ability to take an independent lead and be self-driven
‰Û¢ Able to demonstrate a diligent, methodical approach.
‰Û¢ Good numeric skills and be proficient in the use of Microsoft office suite.
‰Û¢ Good verbal and written communication skills
‰Û¢ Above all a zeal for delighting your customer, and for continuous improvement, is key to your approach to work
Education and Qualifications:
Likely to be degree educated, but a proven capability to deliver is more important.
Formal qualification in Service Management (e.g. ITIL) and/or Project Management (e.g. PMI, Prince II) is an advantage.

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist Statistics Research Department Big Data Research
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Bedminster, New Jersey
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We have an immediate need for a PhD level Statistician with a passion for extracting insights from data to join our Statistics Research Department. We work on problems from all aspects of AT&T‰Ûªs business, including new service creation, network design and optimization, marketing and customer care. These challenging business problems offer opportunities to establish external recognition while creating state-of-the-art, business-impacting solutions. You will make a difference: to our customers and employees by improving their experience; to our stakeholders by developing cost-effective solutions; and to the academic community as you contribute novel methodology or open source software that address real-world problems.
Our Research Lab enjoys a highly collaborative and academic environment, encouraging experimentation and innovation. Project roles are fluid ‰ÛÒ anyone can be the project lead or team member. Many researchers work directly with business unit leaders, and developing algorithms and solutions can be an interactive experience with them. Primary location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
Qualifications
- PhD or equivalent in Statistics, Machine Learning, or a data science field with an extensive statistics curriculum.
- Established excellence, passion, and curiosity in applied research demonstrated through publications, new research techniques, open source contributions, and patents.
- Expertise working with large industrial scale data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate data, prototype new tools, and extract actionable insights from that data.
- Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic solutions in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
- Accomplished R programmer, and experience coding with other languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java.
- Experience with modern data management systems like Hadoop, NoSQL, and Spark.
Qualified candidates will be asked to submit a Research Statement and 3-5 references. Please visit http://www.research.att.com/ to learn more about AT&T Research.
Requisition ID: 1628166-1
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Senior Inventive Scientist (Labs Big Data Research)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: New York, New York
External and Internal
In AT&T Labs' Big Data Research organization, we develop new methods for analyzing massive data sets to learn about our network and our customers, and to improve services and operations. We are a pioneer in big data technologies ‰ÛÒ developing novel methodologies for statistical computing, event prediction, fraud detection, visualization, text mining, data stream management, data quality and anomaly detection, and privacy preserving measures such as data anonymization.
We are looking for strong analysts in a data science field with a passion for extracting insights from large data sets. We work on problems that cut across all aspects of AT&T's business, including network and service management, marketing and customer care, network design and optimization, and new service creation. Many analysts work directly with business unit leaders. All have opportunities to invent novel, publishable methodology that address real-world problems. Increasingly we contribute to multiple data science disciplines through open source projects, led by AT&T.
We typically hire to fill two positions:
Our PhD level Inventive Scientists are technical leaders in their field, establishing external recognition while creating innovative, business-impacting solutions.
Data Scientists will usually have a Master‰Ûªs; they are responsible for the entire data ‰ÛÒ to ‰ÛÒ solution pipeline. They both support the Inventive Scientists and are responsible for their own projects.
Location can be Bedminster, NJ or New York, NY.
Desired areas of expertise:
- Spatiotemporal analysis of mobile data - The AT&T network generates billions of records per day from handheld devices, each one providing a data point in time and space. Understanding the dynamics of this data through time series and spatial statistics helps AT&T better serve its customers, improve its network, and develop new products and services.
- Statistical computation - AT&T is developing high-performance statistical models and algorithms (mostly in R) to leverage modern streaming and storage technologies. One example is the AT&T collaborative coding project RCloud http://rcloud.social/.
- Text mining - AT&T is modeling free-form text from millions of customer surveys, representative notes, and chats as one way to manage our business in real time. New methods are needed to keep up with the volume and complexity of this data.
- Data visualization - AT&T creates algorithms, systems, and techniques for visualizing new data sets at increasingly large scale. AT&T is especially interested in interactive visualization of very large geospatial and temporal data. One example is our open source project Nanocubes http://nanocubes.net .
- Database management and data quality - AT&T is building high-performance and low latency systems to manage high velocity data streams. These systems are critical for accurate processing and analysis of data from the AT&T mobile network. Analyzing the data to identify glitches, and cleaning the data to minimize distortion while preserving maximal underlying variation, are essential to ensure meaningful big data analytics.
- Predictive Modeling ‰ÛÒ We estimate models to predict customer behavior and sentiment, service disruptions, and event impacts. Models serve to both target, and to gain insight into variable relationships. Our rich customer and network data allows analysts to positively affect business outcomes and to pursue methodological research (comparing machine learning algorithms, for example).
Please visit http://www.research.att.com to learn more about AT&T Research.
Qualifications
- Inventive Scientist candidates shall have a PhD or equivalent in a data science field, including these most commonly: Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Engineering, and Mathematics.
- Data Science candidates shall have a Master‰Ûªs or PhD in a data science field.
- Experience and passion for finding solutions to real world, applied problems. In addition for Inventive Scientists, established excellence in applied research through publications, new research techniques, open source contributions, and patents.
- Expertise working with large industrial scale data sets, and the ability to use software to manipulate data, prototype new tools, and extract actionable insights from that data.
- Capable of presenting outcomes of analytic solutions in a format easily understood by a non-technical audience.
- Expert-level skills and abilities within field of knowledge, and demonstrated ability to develop new ideas from inception to prototype.
- Accomplished R programmer, and experience coding with other languages such as C/C++, Python, and Java.
- Experience with modern data management systems like Hadoop, NoSQL, and Spark.
- Candidates with 5+ years of relevant experience may be considered for a more senior position.
Qualified candidates may be asked to submit a Research Statement (required for Inventive Scientist applicants) and 3-5 references (required for Inventive Scientist applicants, optional but encouraged for Data Scientist applicants).
Requisition ID: 1615655-1
Apply now Apply now

Location: Pearl Harbor, Hawaii
AT&T NGEN (Navy) Communications Network Engineer Senior is responsible for supporting network design, operational support, hands-on implementing and configuration of network devices.
Roles and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Analyze and drive to root cause of problems.
Design, test, and recommended solution changes both problems and projects.
Develop workarounds to reduce or eliminate the impact of a problem or incident for which a full resolution is not yet available.
Build bundles and configurations to support solution changes and workarounds.
Provide both proactive and reactive Service Level Requirement (SLR) data analysis. Identify systemic trends, develop and design mitigation strategies and plans to ensure SLR agreements are met.
Participate or lead special or high visibility projects that may require solution workarounds or design changes.
Function as shift escalation point for both Incident Response and Problem Management issues when the shift runs out of technical options or when the requirement for management-level situation awareness become unusually high, or otherwise at the discretion of the NOC Manager. Act as a staffing reserve backfilling the shift on a short term or intermediate term or until the staffing deficiency is corrected as required by the NOC Manager.
Provide technical mentoring to all Watch Staff Shift resources through the creation, improvement and proctoring of training and engineering labs.
Provide direct one-on-one coaching and mentoring as required by the NOC Manager.
Required to learn new technologies that will be implemented and training and coaching the Watch Staff team members the new technology.
These responsibilities in addition to other duties may be assigned as necessary by the NOC Manager
Ten plus (10+) years of experience that includes network design, operational support, hands-on implementing and configuration of network devices such as servers, routers, hubs, switches, NICs, VPNs, WAN Accelerators, IPS, associated software tools, desktop computers, and cabling in a large LAN/MAN/BAN/WAN environment. As well as knowledge of TCP/IP protocols. Experience with secure networks, specifically Intel Community standards. Knowledge of GigE, OSPF, BGP, EIGRP and ATM is necessary. Strong knowledge of trouble ticketing software (HPSM) and networking monitoring solutions (NNMi w/iSPI, HP NA) a must. Previous experience working on military bases/sites, including previous military service highly desirable.
Education: Bachelor's Degree in computer and/or networking field preferred. CCNP required, CCIE Written preferred.
Skills: Strong communications, writing and editing skills needed to transfer information to individuals involved in the networking process. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to work in an organized fashion with focus on documented activity. Flexibility to occasionally work an unusual schedule required. Positive attitude and high initiative.
IAT-II / GSEC; Security+ CE; SSCP or CCNA-Security
Secret Clearance Required

Description
AT&T ENTERTAINMENT GROUP is continuing to expand our role as the world's largest video service. Our expansion into Anytime Anywhere Video, continued explosive growth in Pan-Americana with over-the-top services and with many other over-the-top offerings continuing to launch we are seeking energetic people with a drive to explore new technologies and architect new designs to support these services. As a member of the Network and Systems Architecture team, you will be integral in the full lifecycle design, development and integration of critical infrastructure projects for new AT&T ENTERTAINMENT GROUP Broadcast and Broadband systems for all AT&T ENTERTAINMENT GROUP deployments worldwide. As a senior level directory services and security expert, you will utilize your in-depth knowledge integrating a mixed, dynamic technical environment used to deliver services to our customers using satellite, broadband and other over-the-top delivery methods.
Architecture responsibilities include:
Developing technology roadmaps to fulfill current and future requirements.
Developing and tuning planning methodologies to onboard new infrastructure, software and ultimately services into the environment
Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to create requirements, evaluate vendor solutions and find solutions to integrate them into the environment
Developing strategies and testing in a lab environment to integrate existing infrastructure, software and databases into a common environment.
Designing, reviewing and presenting solutions to other peer groups.
Documenting non-functional requirements, infrastructure design, hardware, software and professional services appraisals and costs.
Reviewing new technologies that could reduce overall costs, create efficiencies and provide significant value.
Evaluating potential cross-platform consolidation tools.
Researching potential automation strategies.
Qualifications
A degree in engineering or related field is preferred.
5+ yearså_ experience with Microsoft Directory Services (AD, LDS) 2000, 2003, 2008(r2) in large corporate Environment including trusts (AD and other Kerberos implementations)
Experience supporting complex directory service environments on a global scale (Including directory site topologies)
Experience administering DNS and strong understanding of name services (Infoblox experience a plus)
Experience configuring Group Policy Objects to secure a Windows infrastructure
Experience designing and managing security in highly delegated Active Directory environment
Experience defining and managing proper site topologies to ensure proper scale and directory availability
Successfully guide troubleshooting of issues in a distributed system, working with operational teams and vendors as needed to isolated and restore service upon escalation
Root Cause analysis; work with other teams and staff to identify root cause of problems and make recommendations on how to avoid repeating problems
Well versed in leveraging Windows Perfmon to track performance for troubleshooting and scale
Knowledgeable in reading packet captures to find answers or track problems

Solid understanding of LDAP schema and customizations
Experience using Active Directory for authentication and authorization in a mixed environment, including *nix, OSX & mobile platforms

MCSE or MCITP certification
Experience managing a directory that meets PCI compliance requirements is helpful
Fluent in Spanish or Portuguese
Candidates must possess excellent communication skills and be successful working both independently and with cross-functional teams. Must be able to communicate both verbally and in writing to both peers and management/decision making teams.

Description
The Vendor Manager (VM) is responsible for coordinating, building, and maintaining all aspects of vendor projects for AT&T Software Engineering Department in a repeatable manner. This includes all of the following responsibility areas: RFP development, leading/managing throughout the overall vendor bidding process, proposal evaluations, vendor selection, Statements Of Work (SOW), and Change Requests (CR).
Through excellent communication skills, the VM ensures that vendor objectives remain aligned and on-track throughout the life of the project. The VM consistently manages and communicates with internal staff and vendors under a Managed Services model, ensuring vendor deliverables conform to negotiated scope, schedule, budget, and quality metrics according to contractual agreements. Tracks all aspects of project milestones, status, and delivery of projects.
The VM builds and maintains awareness of the details that drive individual project success and across projects, while building solid, strategic relationships with vendors. While the VM has no direct reports, must be able to successfully interact, engage, negotiate and manage upwards and at peer-level. The VM resolves problems/issues for vendors related to payments, information requests, and more.
The VM provides detailed financial and quantitative analysis, and seeks to reduce costs through efficiencies across the portfolio of projects they manage. The VM must be detail oriented, while keeping the Big Picture strategy at top-of-mind. The VM provides project plans, schedules, and details for internal evaluation and for vendor project delivery.
Ideally, the VM has domain experience in the area of embedded systems, Set-Top Boxes (STB), TV/Video and/or satellite communication systems.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Undergraduate degree

Overall Purpose: Develops solution architectures for AT&T business customers to address their business, application and communications needs. Key Roles and Responsibilities: The Senior Solutions Architect must be proficient at the techniques that go into the formulation of solutions, including collecting customer requirements and assessing solution alternatives based on tradeoffs in cost, performance, reliability and security, and be able to partner with the sales team to recommend the most appropriate solution for the customer. This requires practical skills and experience with many applications and technologies, and a thorough knowledge of the AT&T product set. The Senior Solutions Architect analyzes a customers business and network challenges and designs a comprehensive solution that integrates smoothly into the customers environment. Beyond the core responsibilities of a Solutions Architect, the Senior Solutions Architect must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, act with greater autonomy in managing their work load and provide more leadership to a sales opportunity. The Senior Solutions Architect may also lead solution engagements in promoting the cause of new services in order to achieve buy-in from the enterprises management seeking to create new opportunities and business relationships. Manages solution design with internal and external suppliers in a manner that is consistent with customer needs and in line with competitive realities. Location: Redmond, Washington
Technology Development Program (TDP) ‰ÛÒ Technology Operations
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From our industry leading wireless platforms to fully software-defined networks and world-class cloud infrastructure, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
This 36-month program is designed to transform you into an engineering expert at an accelerated rate. Here, you‰Ûªll learn from diverse perspectives, ideas and talents to gain well-rounded knowledge of the business. Through job rotations across our Network Operations & Engineering organizations, you‰Ûªll be able to gain exposure and explore the career areas that match your unique strengths. That means you may have the chance to customize your career path with multi-faceted placement opportunities ‰ÛÒ from network planning and design, to implementation and optimization.
You'll also have plenty of opportunities to build a lifelong career through project and team leadership opportunities, a specialized development curriculum, and our dedicated mentoring program. Here‰Ûªs your chance to break new ground and help us evolve our business to stay on top ‰ÛÒ all while building your technical, business and leadership skills. You‰Ûªll also be encouraged to join initiatives outside of the program to enhance your experience and share your passion.
After the program? You‰Ûªll have everything you need to support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations & Engineering. That means you‰Ûªll be a big part of keeping AT&T on the cutting edge.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Responsibilities may also include working with Labs, product development, and engineering teams to actually author process documentation, methods, procedures, and guidelines for current network planning, capacity management, and network builds. Coordinates and interfaces with internal and external customers to ensure service commitments are met. Uses engineering tools, various software applications and databases to assist in creating the engineering documents. Prepares / oversees cost/benefit estimates, presentations, negotiations, installation, problem resolution and multivendor product integration. May provide initial implementation support of networks to assure proper execution and provides resolution for system failures or degradations. Provide project management and documentation as required.
Job Contribution: Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within discipline/specialty area. Contributes to development of concepts/methods/techniques. Moderate team impact.
This is a full-time, paid position with employee benefits.
KNOWLEDGE Acquires/demonstrates basic knowledge of principles and methods. Knowledge limited to specific processes/procedures needed to perform assignments within own work area. Basic knowledge of ATT technologies. Limited skill in technical field.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Focused on data gathering/compilation/verification. Completes routine tasks. Reviews/solves routine problems applying clearly defined standard procedures.
INDEPENDENCE Highly directed and supervised; work is assigned, scheduled and prioritized by others. Works on detailed assignments. Work assignment is guided by standard procedures; judgment is minimal.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Contributes through quality and efficiency of own work. Supports technical teams maintaining current technologies.
COMMUNICATION Displays appropriate listening skills to receive training/directions. Exchanges procedural information with immediate colleagues and/or internal customers. Collaborates with others in own area and seeks assistance and feedback as appropriate. Seeks self-development opportunities; demonstrates aptitude for growth.
If you have a degree in Engineering (or a related technical field), a 3.0+ GPA and a passion for innovation, this program just might be your next big thing.

categories_jobs_title: Sr Specialist Tech Development Program Technology Operations
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Middletown, New Jersey
Technology Development Program (TDP) ‰ÛÒ Technology Operations
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From our industry leading wireless platforms to fully software-defined networks and world-class cloud infrastructure, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
This 36-month program is designed to transform you into an engineering expert at an accelerated rate. Here, you‰Ûªll learn from diverse perspectives, ideas and talents to gain well-rounded knowledge of the business. Through job rotations across our Network Operations & Engineering organizations, you‰Ûªll be able to gain exposure and explore the career areas that match your unique strengths. That means you may have the chance to customize your career path with multi-faceted placement opportunities ‰ÛÒ from network planning and design, to implementation and optimization.
You'll also have plenty of opportunities to build a lifelong career through project and team leadership opportunities, a specialized development curriculum, and our dedicated mentoring program. Here‰Ûªs your chance to break new ground and help us evolve our business to stay on top ‰ÛÒ all while building your technical, business and leadership skills. You‰Ûªll also be encouraged to join initiatives outside of the program to enhance your experience and share your passion.
After the program? You‰Ûªll have everything you need to support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations & Engineering. That means you‰Ûªll be a big part of keeping AT&T on the cutting edge.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Responsibilities may also include working with Labs, product development, and engineering teams to actually author process documentation, methods, procedures, and guidelines for current network planning, capacity management, and network builds. Coordinates and interfaces with internal and external customers to ensure service commitments are met. Uses engineering tools, various software applications and databases to assist in creating the engineering documents. Prepares / oversees cost/benefit estimates, presentations, negotiations, installation, problem resolution and multivendor product integration. May provide initial implementation support of networks to assure proper execution and provides resolution for system failures or degradations. Provide project management and documentation as required.
Job Contribution: Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within discipline/specialty area. Contributes to development of concepts/methods/techniques. Moderate team impact.
This is a full-time, paid position with employee benefits.
KNOWLEDGE Acquires/demonstrates basic knowledge of principles and methods. Knowledge limited to specific processes/procedures needed to perform assignments within own work area. Basic knowledge of ATT technologies. Limited skill in technical field.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Focused on data gathering/compilation/verification. Completes routine tasks. Reviews/solves routine problems applying clearly defined standard procedures.
INDEPENDENCE Highly directed and supervised; work is assigned, scheduled and prioritized by others. Works on detailed assignments. Work assignment is guided by standard procedures; judgment is minimal.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Contributes through quality and efficiency of own work. Supports technical teams maintaining current technologies.
COMMUNICATION Displays appropriate listening skills to receive training/directions. Exchanges procedural information with immediate colleagues and/or internal customers. Collaborates with others in own area and seeks assistance and feedback as appropriate. Seeks self-development opportunities; demonstrates aptitude for growth.
If you have a degree in Engineering (or a related technical field), a 3.0+ GPA and a passion for innovation, this program just might be your next big thing.
Apply now
Our employees say it best. Watch now >>
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are
committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V
AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position.
Must possess a valid driver‰Ûªs license and successfully complete a Motor Vehicle Record check for rotations that require driving.
Requisition ID: 1610728
Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Sr Specialist Tech Development Program Technology Operations
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Missouri
Technology Development Program (TDP) ‰ÛÒ Technology Operations
Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From our industry leading wireless platforms to fully software-defined networks and world-class cloud infrastructure, our team is pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out.
This 36-month program is designed to transform you into an engineering expert at an accelerated rate. Here, you‰Ûªll learn from diverse perspectives, ideas and talents to gain well-rounded knowledge of the business. Through job rotations across our Network Operations & Engineering organizations, you‰Ûªll be able to gain exposure and explore the career areas that match your unique strengths. That means you may have the chance to customize your career path with multi-faceted placement opportunities ‰ÛÒ from network planning and design, to implementation and optimization.
You'll also have plenty of opportunities to build a lifelong career through project and team leadership opportunities, a specialized development curriculum, and our dedicated mentoring program. Here‰Ûªs your chance to break new ground and help us evolve our business to stay on top ‰ÛÒ all while building your technical, business and leadership skills. You‰Ûªll also be encouraged to join initiatives outside of the program to enhance your experience and share your passion.
After the program? You‰Ûªll have everything you need to support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations & Engineering. That means you‰Ûªll be a big part of keeping AT&T on the cutting edge.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Responsibilities may also include working with Labs, product development, and engineering teams to actually author process documentation, methods, procedures, and guidelines for current network planning, capacity management, and network builds. Coordinates and interfaces with internal and external customers to ensure service commitments are met. Uses engineering tools, various software applications and databases to assist in creating the engineering documents. Prepares / oversees cost/benefit estimates, presentations, negotiations, installation, problem resolution and multivendor product integration. May provide initial implementation support of networks to assure proper execution and provides resolution for system failures or degradations. Provide project management and documentation as required.
Job Contribution: Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within discipline/specialty area. Contributes to development of concepts/methods/techniques. Moderate team impact.
This is a full-time, paid position with employee benefits.
KNOWLEDGE Acquires/demonstrates basic knowledge of principles and methods. Knowledge limited to specific processes/procedures needed to perform assignments within own work area. Basic knowledge of ATT technologies. Limited skill in technical field.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Focused on data gathering/compilation/verification. Completes routine tasks. Reviews/solves routine problems applying clearly defined standard procedures.
INDEPENDENCE Highly directed and supervised; work is assigned, scheduled and prioritized by others. Works on detailed assignments. Work assignment is guided by standard procedures; judgment is minimal.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Contributes through quality and efficiency of own work. Supports technical teams maintaining current technologies.
COMMUNICATION Displays appropriate listening skills to receive training/directions. Exchanges procedural information with immediate colleagues and/or internal customers. Collaborates with others in own area and seeks assistance and feedback as appropriate. Seeks self-development opportunities; demonstrates aptitude for growth.
If you have a degree in Engineering (or a related technical field), a 3.0+ GPA and a passion for innovation, this program just might be your next big thing.

Develop and execute strategic and tactical projects to meet Sales and Marketing business objectives within our Multi-Dwelling Unit (MDU) partner channels. This position will be accountable for gathering/documenting requirements, managing/refining business processes, facilitating systems and analysis discussions. The manager is expected to work independently; activities will include working with cross-functional groups (e.g., MDU Partners, Sales, Marketing, IT, Customer Service, Third Party Call Centers, etc.) to identify solutions and enhancements for program operations and support areas.
Responsibilities:
Launch key initiatives by: leading a project team, coordinating with third party partners (MDU partners, consulting companies, call centers, etc.), working with functional departments (Marketing, Sales, Customer Service, Supply Chain, Legal, IT, etc.).
Identify real and potential problems; provide alternative solutions.
Conduct best practice reviews to identify areas for improvement.
Identify, troubleshoot and facilitate quick resolution of operational and customer impacting issues that may arise.
Evaluate business unit decisions to ensure they are in the best interest of customers and company goals; escalate as needed.
Develop and maintain standard project documentation - project plans, agendas, action items lists, business rules/requirements, process flows
Facilitate meetings and provide meeting notes. Track and proactively work action items.
Prepare launch go/no-go checklists, develop detailed business requirements, confirm technical requirements drafted by IT, and create contingency plans.
Provide project updates to management that include progress, risks, issues and mitigation recommendations.
Perform and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) with internal business partners and external partners, report all issues to IT and ensure appropriate resolution.
Must be able to see the project, decisions and processes in terms of the big picture/cross-departmental impacts.

åá Strong problem solving and analytical skills, including a qualitative and quantitative skill set
åá Leadership qualities, including meeting facilitation, time management, organizational skills and ability to influence others
åá Demonstrated success managing teams; work effectively with business and technical managers
åá Ability to synthesize information and develop creative solutions to meet business objectives
åá Ability to accommodate change and adapt accordingly
åá Excellent communication skills, including ability to tailor communication to audience to achieve desired results
åá Experience with public speaking and presentation skills
åá Proficiency in standard MS Office applications and Visio
åá Experience delivering results in a fast moving, challenging environment
åá Expected travel 10%

Overall Purpose: Responsible for the performance of any/all functions involved in the development and/or maintenance of new or existing applications.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: Using programming language and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs. May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications. Job Contribution: Seasoned technical professional. Contributes through proven technical expertise. Has significant dept/functional impact.
KNOWLEDGE Subject Matter Expert (SME) within own discipline/specialty area; basic knowledge of other disciplines/specialty areas. Deep technical knowledge. Applies in depth knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards/processes. Integrates industry experience and deep professional/technical knowledge. Technical leader and recognized expert SME on select ATT technologies/systems/procedures.
ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Solves unique problems through evaluative judgment/precedent. Independently applies sophisticated analysis in evaluating issues. Develops new concepts/methods/techniques for cross functional initiatives. Recognizes/pursues alternative methods.
INDEPENDENCE Guided by department goals/objectives. Exercises latitude in determining objectives/approaches to projects. Leads multiple small to medium sized projects and technical breadth.
CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Key contributor on complex projects/initiatives. Impacts current and future business opportunities through application of specialized technical/ industry knowledge. Develops methods/techniques based on strategic project objectives.
COMMUNICATION Mentors and provides technical guidance and explains advanced concepts to others in work area. May mentor others in department. Coordinates across multiple departments. Promotes active listening and open communication. Provides leadership/guidance to others.
Technical Career Pathway (TCP) role. Entry into this title may require TCP Governance Board Review.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or related field

Proficient in application/software architecture (Definition, Business Process Modeling, etc.)
Understand application/software development and design.
Proficient in application/software testing (Unit, Integration, System, Case Planning, Design and Execution).
Understand Change Control Methodology.
Proficient in Development Methodolgies (AGILE, ITUP, 3D, etc.)
Knowledge in protocols (network, software).
Understand Development Tools (Rational Tools, Agile Tools, simulation tools, etc.)
Proficient in internet technologies/programming (WSDLS, HTML, DHTML, XHML, XML, .NET, Active X, SSL, HTTP, Weblogic, Websphere, etc.).
Understand operating systems (Linux, Unix, Windows).
Understand programming languages (C, C++, Java, Javascript, Ruby, Jboss, Perl, VXML, XML, etc.).
Desired Qualifications -
Understanding of project management process

Location: El Segundo, California
This position will provide Acquisition/Program Management support to the United States Air Force, Space and Missile Systems Center, Space Superiority Systems Directorate customer at Los Angeles Air Force Base, CA.
The candidate will be co-located and directly support the Joint Execution and Tasking System for Space (JETSS) program office. The candidate must demonstrate applicable acquisition skill level and experience in Space Control, Space Situational Awareness, Command and Control, or Space Superiority. This includes DoD life cycle program management support, including documentation development adhering to DODI 5000.02.
Specific work to be performed includes the following:
‰Û¢ Assess JETSS acquisition documentation and gaps in accordance with DODI 5000.02
‰Û¢ Develop JETSS acquisition documentation to meet MS C requirements in accordance with DODI 5000.02
‰Û¢ Evaluate JETSS program for cost, schedule, and performance programmatic risks relative to the JETSS
‰Û¢ Identify technical requirements for future JETSS spirals by participating in government generated studies aimed at identifying the future needs of the program
‰Û¢ Review the technical content of the JETSS Information Support Plan for compliance with program requirements, develop recommendations, and update the Information Support Plan once annually
‰Û¢ Review the JETSS Systems Engineering Plan and update the SEP at least once annually to address programmatic changes in the delivery of the current spiral
‰Û¢ Evaluate current and evolving AF technical policy and guidance against the existing JETSS technical approach and documentation and identify any changes that would be required to comply with the new guidance
‰Û¢ Provide the technical insight necessary to integrate JETSS into future JMS service packs
‰Û¢ Ability to provide a wide variety of acquisition/sustainment technical analyses, and program management support to a government PM
‰Û¢ Provides analysis of proposed costs, contractor Statements of Work, and technical content
‰Û¢ Ensures adherence to Government acquisition policies, master plans and schedules, and develops solutions to program problems
‰Û¢ Have a working knowledge of system acquisitions, specifically in Air Force and DoD environments, covering the DoD 5000 series
‰Û¢ Assist in the execution of acquisition strategies, including drafting Statement of Work, Statement of Objectives, Request for Proposal preparations, monitoring deliverables, and attending acquisition related meetings
‰Û¢ Travel requirement: Approximately 25%
DoD Top Secret/SSBI required (or must be eligible to obtain SCI)
BS/BA in technical or business field preferred. In lieu of a 4 year degree, a minimum of 5 years' experience in the following: systems engineering experience in an acquisition environment, development of requirements, specifications and proposals; familiar with a variety of acquisition concepts, phases, and procedures; participate in technical studies, and performance reviews; ability to function in a multi-contractor/customer environment, performs a variety of complicated tasks, a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected; demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills; and effective written and oral communication skills required.

The Principal Big Data Software Engineer is responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies. This position will use Big Data programming languages and technology, write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications. It will also analyze, design, program, debug and modify software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Position will interact with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented.
Specifically this Principal Big Data Software Engineer provides the backbone (the data and data platform) for the team as well as for the enterprise. This position helps to derive valuable insights and drive smart business decisions across AT&T. Additional responsibilities include the following:
Works with the raw data, cleanses it and finally polishes it to the format where it can be consumed by Data Scientists to create critical insights.
Assists with ad-hoc requests coming from business partners. These can be simple statistics or complex operations.
Expert level competency with Scala, Java, Spark, Map/Reduce, high performance tuning, machine learning methods for classification and deep learning for pattern recognition. In addition, the candidate must also have the ability to mentor and develop others in these technologies.
Strong communication and presentation skills are required to effectively convey relevant insights to the teams.
Performs analysis, implementation, and performance tuning for engineered artifacts.
Exercises judgment on how to effectively communicate highly technical and complex details through the use of visualization and careful selection of "knowns" versus "hypotheticals".

INDEPENDENCE - Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent.
CONTRIBUTION TO AT&T TECHNOLOGY - Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives.
COMMUNICATION - Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers.

AT&T is seeking hard-working and dependable candidates to support of the GSM-O contract at Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) located at Scott AFB, IL. DISA acts as the provider of GIG/Defense Information System Network (DISN) services to its customers the Department of Defense (DoD) and national security organizations. Candidate is familiar performing within a fixed price, performance-based environment where performance is based on pre-determined Service Level Agreement‰Ûªs (SLA‰Ûªs) or Acceptable Levels of Performance (ALP‰Ûªs). Candidate is required to support the development, documentation and tracking of measurements and metrics relevant to the ALP‰Ûªs. Member of the network team supporting DISA GSM-O program. Interfaces with Government counterparts, both CONUS and OCONUS, as well as LM and other subcontractor team members. Responsible for the network components used on the program with specific responsibilities including but not limited to evaluate system network requirements and make appropriate technical recommendations. Extensive network integration experience for a variety of network protocol standards. Experience analyzing VLAN, routing, IP addressing and sub-netting. Excellent project, technical, interpersonal, presentation and problem management skills. Use network monitoring tools to identify problems or help customers requiring assistance with network hardware, software, or inquiries. Provide problem determination/resolution based upon personal experience, expert opinion and standard operating procedures, including immediate resolution where possible. Works with other network technologists that are involved in network monitoring and maintenance, configuration management, and customer support. Document and propose solutions for network problems and work with appropriate personnel to achieve resolution. Participate in resolution of service-related issues. Desired skills: CCNA or CCNP, ITIL v3 Foundation certified - Ability to communicate orally, and in writing, detailed technical information on troubleshooting and implementation efforts. - Familiarization of DOD regulations and directives. - Equally proficient in Juniper and Cisco configuration, troubleshooting, and design. - Experience with Cisco IOS XR, JUNOS, and Cisco IOS codes. - Perl or other language scripting capable of running backup configs and other scripting to pull information from Cisco/Juniper routers - IPSEC configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - MPLS configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - QoS configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - Voice and video over IP configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - IPV6 configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - Security certification and/or knowledge of DDoS and other attack vectors experienced in today' networks. - Crypto configuration, troubleshooting, and design experience. - Layer 2/3 VPN and Firewall knowledge and experience. - Physical cable plant and wiring experience.
Required Skills: 5+ years of experience in telecommunications network management, operations, installation or development - DoD 8570 Level 2 IAT equivalent (Security+CE)

Our research programs are at the tip of the spear in creating advanced technologies in Data Analytics, Cloud Services, Intelligent Systems, and Networking and Service Quality Management. AT&T Labs draws on a rich heritage of innovation, including eight Nobel Prizes, and a strong culture that encourages openness, teamwork and collaboration across AT&T and within the industry.
The chosen candidate will focus on developing Access Transport Architectures for both mobility and wireline with the main focus on producing Forward Looking Architectures for both access networks to support the evolution of the business into SDN, 5G and diverse Wireless Broadband offering.
Daily responsibilities will focus on, but not be limited to:
Gathering requirements for future products, staying up-to-date with the access technologies (WiFi, Ethernet, LTE, 5G‰Û_) evolution, learning of new access technologies, participation in standards bodies, and evaluating new technologies
Modeling, prototyping, lab testing, Technology Survey creation, evaluation, documentation, and recommendation.
Work across functional teams to create integrated Access Solutions and would need to be a self-started, self-motivated, able to work under minimal direction, and possess excellent presentation skills.
Required Qualifications
Education: Candidate shall have a PhD in an approved field from an accredited university and a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, or a Master's degree in an approved field from an accredited university and a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience, or a Bachelor's degree in an approved field from an accredited university and a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience
What makes you stand out:
In Depth Knowledge and experience in transmission methods, RF and Mixed signal architecture MIMO, beamforming, coding, interference nulling‰Û_
In Depth Knowledge of Radio Interface standards: TDMA, FDMA, CDMA, OFDMA, SDMA/MU-MIMO, or hybrid.
Strong experience and passed work in the Architecture and design field
Well versed and excellent working knowledge of L2 and L3 protocols (TCP/IP, Networking and switching)
Excellent Knowledge of IEEE 802.11 standards with Hands-on experience with 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac and WiFi
In depth knowledge and hands on experience with LTE standards, modeling and analysis
Well versed in the 5G frameworks, proposed standards and proposed architectures
Exposure to Open Source projects like hostapd and open supplicants
Awesome Points:
Excellent understanding of ASICs, FPGAs, SoCs and networking hardware in general

You are an experienced Project Management, Engineering, or Operations professional with a passion for technology and problem solving. Technical Services

Location: Long Beach, California
As an IT System Administrator for the Broadcast Software Operations team at our California Broadcast Center in Long Beach, California, you will be part of a vital leadership team that supports ALL entertainment programming that is broadcast to 19+ million customers across Latin America.
In this role you will have constant hands- on opportunities to work with the latest technologies and coordinate cross-functionally with subject matter experts to ensure our technological initiatives stay competitive and cutting edge. You will be directly responsible for conducting root cause analysis, troubleshooting, maintaining, upgrading and installing multiple UNIX and Windows systems. These systems are both vendor provided and proprietary and support critical broadcast functions such as program guides, interactive TV applications and conditional access. You will also support our storage systems.
There will never be a dull moment in this very high speed, complex, large technical environment. You will install Operating Systems, manage automated maintenance activities such as deploying security patches and anti-virus software, and overseeing our 3PAR and Isilon storage units. In order to do this you will need to stay ahead of the learning curve on all applicable viable technology as it comes on line as part of your own professional and leadership development.
Day to Day Responsibilities may look like this:
Troubleshoot at a Tier II/Tier III level hardware, software and Windows/Linux operating system issues.
Work on multiple projects under tight deadlines, shifting priorities, and changing scopes.
Prioritize tasks to ensure deadlines are met and issues are resolved quickly and effectively.
Ongoing communication with staff and cross functional groups. Communication will range from troubleshooting and problem solving, to project updates and announcing change.
Evaluate and maintain a strong understanding of capabilities and limitations of all hardware, software, and subsystems. Communicate this through cross function groups as part of day-to-day training, risk management, and decision making that will affect future resource acquisitions.
Make recommendations to improve services, risk mitigation, processes, and/or allocation of resources.
Enhance exchange of knowledge throughout the organization through technical report writing and debriefing of findings, best practices, and processes.
Qualifications
BS degree in computer science or equivalent combination of education/experience preferred.
3-5 years of practical work experience as a Unix/Linux and Windows System Administrator.
Must have strong hands-on experience in root cause analysis and troubleshooting and an extensive background with UNIX-based operating systems and shell scripting, MS-DOS batch files and/or Perl on Win32/UNIX.
Must have experience installing/supporting software as well as a thorough understanding of Windows Server 2003-2012, Linux, Solaris, and HP-UX operating systems and TCP/ IP networking.
Must have experience with CFEngine, Centrify, SCCM, or similar system management software.
Must have experience with 3PAR, Isilon, or similar storage solutions.
Ability to communicate, connects with, and effectively manage expectations of senior management, technical subject matter experts, and support staff.
Confidence in communicating issues, making recommendations for solutions, implementing resolutions, and leading change across all levels of the organization.
Spanish fluency (verbal and written) is always a plus.
Unique Requirements of the Role:
Must be willing to work flexible shifts to support a 24-7-365 facility
Must be willing to work holidays, weekends, and overtime as needed.
Availability for occasional domestic travel and commuting between sites as needed
