categories_jobs_title: Principal IT Analyst Data Center Orchestration and Tools
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Denver, Colorado
Description
Are you someone who loves technology, has a passion for continuous improvement, and can quickly understand and adapt to new concepts? If so, YOU are the person we want to meet! If you want a job that has great compensation and benefits, offers free DIRECTV programming including sports packages, an onsite gym, pool table, video games, and a fun culture, you have found your dream job!
Job Summary:
The IT Operations Principal 1 candidate will work as a member of the Data Center Orchestration Services team. This team is responsible for providing support, maintenance, and enhancement services for selected products of the Infrastructure Applications department. The DCO team uses a number of different tools including Operations Orchestration (OO), Server Automation (SA), Puppet and some in house developed tools to automate simple to highly advanced tasks.
Candidate will maintain and administer all aspects of the DCO tools. As an experienced specialist with strong technical and analytical skills, one will be providing orchestration services in 24x7 open system environments. Supporting technologies Operation Orchestration (OO), Server Automation (SA), Puppet and custom tools.
The candidate will spend time supporting the operations and work with end-users to troubleshoot and resolve issues with existing operations. Knowledge of industry experience/knowledge to help mature the use of DCO in DIRECTV's environment is required.
The Data Center Orchestration Services Team operates on a 24x7x365 basis; on-call/off-hour may be required.
This position will be located at our Englewood, Colorado office; local candidates are preferred.
Essential Duties:
Data Center Orchestration, OO, NA, SA version 9.x or higher is necessary and high availability configurations of these tools
Designing, implementing, and maintaining OO flows
Troubleshoot to resolves incidents related DCO tools
Support installs and configurations of OO, SA, and NA products
Support installs and configurations of Puppet environment
Deploying, configuring, operationally maintaining and scaling OO, SA or Puppet for large environment, business critical applications
Mentor peers in the use, administration, and customization of DCO team tools and applications
Customize and extend Data Center Orchestration team tools based on business requirements
Debug low level operating system, networking, and application problems including Linux (RedHat), UNIX (HPUX), and Windows operating systems
Develop Python scripts, Shell scripts, PERL scripts, Visual Basic scripts, and batch files for automation of system and application administration
Develop custom applications using the DCO APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) and industry standard programming languages to meet business needs
Manage tickets and automation Computer Associates (CA) Service Desk
Monitor using HP Openview Suite (OMU, BAC, NNM, UCMDB)
Query Oracle database and Provision VMware Virtual Infrastructure
Troubleshoot and critical problem resolution
Initiate and maintain service desk tickets to include receiving or identifying incident/problem, track process, find resolution, make necessary correction to the incident/problem area, and close ticket
Support the ITIL model for best practices of IT processes
Create reports for metrics of system incidents, problems, and requests for all DCO products and distribute to appropriate members
Troubleshoot hardware and software incidents both locally, and remotely
Maintain quality control and customer service; work with vendors, and customers internal/external
Follow established polices and processes; improve process documentation in areas of responsibility
Take ownership of assigned tasks and drive to completion; provide status and follow-up as needed
On call; must be willing to support flexible working hours, including nights and weekends
Candidate may also be required to participate in the weekly on-call rotation; frequent overtime may be necessary.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience.
8+ years of functional experience
ITIL certified in at least basic foundation or higher levels
Highly tuned problem solving and analytical skills are necessary for this position
May mentor others within the team
Excels in Information Technology in a large distributed data center environment
2+ years professional experience with Data Center Orchestration tools or Puppet
System administration and debugging experience on at least two of the following platforms: Windows, Solaris, Linux, AIX, HP-UX
Automation of common tasks with PERL, Python, Shell scripts, VB scripts, and batch files
Network configuration and troubleshooting on large IP networks
Experience with software packaging (e.g. RPM, MSI, etc.) and software distribution
Experience with Puppet is strongly preferred
Performance monitoring, system tuning, high availability, and capacity planning experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience writing technical documentation
Must be customer-focused and have demonstrated strong teamwork, problem solving, and organizational/planning skills
The ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is also essential
Ability to produce effective results under pressure
Ability to adapt to technical changes in the industry
Possess good time management and priority skills
Maintains advanced knowledge on subject matter and often consulted on a variety of topics regarding function/specialty
Technical lead for medium to large projects; has at least one but may have multiple complex projects
Must be self-motivated, maintain positive attitude, high-energy, and able to work with minimal day-to-day project guidance
Exercises wide latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments
Ability to work varying shifts
Support for the environment 24 X 7
Some travel may be necessary (5%)

Job Description:
Location: Brno
Working hours: Daily/regular flexible 9am-5:30pm with rare late shift cover
Start: ASAP
A chance to work provisioning the latest Linux/Cloud installations to the global AT&T infrastructure, the world‰Ûªs leading network provider. This role is a fantastic opportunity for a System Administrator to develop their skills and work in an environment which allows them to see the latest technologies as well as work in a global team. This team works on a project basis therefore excellent soft skills, organization and project planning will also be a must for you to succeed.
This role works heavily with the latest high availability, top-end performance hardware and also with Virtual Machines which allows ones career to develop with Cloud based solutions and develop skills for the technologies of tomorrow.
You will be responsible for installation, configuration and support of servers (physical and virtual) on Linux and OpenStack/KVM platform in project based work regime.
Responsibilities:
- Installation, configuration and support of operating systems
- Provide troubleshooting and assistance to application teams
Requirements:
- Strong knowledge and 3+ years of experience Linux/Unix Systems Administration corporate environment - including OS installation, system and storage configuration and patch administration
- very good knowledge and experience of OpenStack
- Hypervisor KVM, BIOS, Firmware update
- Storage Technologies (NAS, SAN & Cloud Storage)
- Experience with configuration management tools (e.g. Chef)
- Experience with virtualisation technologies
- Strong overall networking skills TCP/IP VPN DNS routing firewalls VLAN
- Excellent communication skills (written and oral) in English
- Excellent team player
- Experience in working in projects
- Excellent team player and eagerness to learn new technologies
Good to have:
- Experience with monitoring (Nagios, etc.) technologies in production setting
- Experience with database technologies (MySQL, MondoDB)
- Scripting/development skills (Ruby, Bash, Perl, Python, etc.)
We offer:
- 25 days of vacation
- Meal vouchers (in value of 90 CZK)
- Compensation for income loss due to sickness
- Advanced medical program
- Company risk life insurance
- Centre teambuilding events plus
- Access to the company lab equipped with state-of-the-art devices
Additional Information:
Knowledge of Cloud architecture ‰ÛÒ e.g. OpenStack
Knowledge other operating system(s) ‰ÛÒ e.g. Solaris, HP-UX, AIX, Windows, Linux
Scripting skills (bash, Perl, Python, etc.)\

Location: El Segundo, California
This position will be accountable for managing the operational activities supporting the DIRECTV video Commercial lines of business. Activities include but are not limited to production support of projects and strategic initiatives impacting the Commercial business; reporting, specialty billing, production issue resolution; and the management of a team of 2-3 analysts. The position is expected to work independently to manage team deliverables and priorities. Additional activities will include working with cross-functional groups (e.g., Sales, Commercial Operations Project Management, IT, Customer Service, Legal, Dealer Compensation, etc.) to execute programs intended to increase sales, revenue and customer satisfaction. This position will also assist in identifying solutions, process efficiencies and enhancements for program development, operations and support areas.
Responsibilities:
Ensure reporting business needs are met, documented and delivered effectively and on time
Ensure flawless execution and delivery of the team‰Ûªs daily operational tasks
Support the launch of key initiatives by participating in the execution of projects with Marketing, Sales, Customer Service, Home Services, Legal, Finance and IT
Manage strategic initiatives ensuring day to day operations, integration, and performance are efficient and maximized
Manage a team of analysts, ensuring both individual and team objectives are accomplished successfully
Effectively communicate timelines, deliverables, road blocks, and success factors to Senior Management and business stakeholders
Help troubleshoot and manage production issues within the order management, compensation and reporting systems, and drive to resolution
Use effective time management tools to consistently meet deadlines and ensure preparedness in support of new programs
Work with Project Management team and business stakeholders to implement scalable solutions that can be leveraged across multiple sales channels ensuring efficient and effective operational support
Conduct best practices review to identify areas for improvement
Analyze workflow bottlenecks and streamline processes through establishing policies and procedures and system enhancements, as needed
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree and 2+ years relevant experience (working with multiple departments, organizational skills, documentation, operations, etc.) required
Hands-on experience managing operational support for strategic projects and programs
Demonstrated ability to lead a team of analysts to deliver daily operational tasks
Strong problem solving and analytical skills, including a qualitative and quantitative skill set
Sense of urgency when dealing with customer impacting issues or obstacles hitting project timelines
Ability to effectively operate within diverse and cross-functional groups
Flexibility and the ability to accommodate change
Leadership qualities, including meeting facilitation, time management, organizational skills and ability to influence others
Demonstrated ability to analyze complex issues and design appropriate solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact with all levels of senior management
Expertise in standard MS Office applications with strong focus on Excel, Access, PowerPoint & Outlook
Travel required (10% - 20%)
Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to manage and develop a staff of direct reports
Ability to query data bases in order to meet business reporting requirements
Proficiency in SQL
User acceptance training experience

Location: Los Angeles, California
Description
DIRECTV is now part of AT&T and one of the world's leading providers of digital television entertainment services delivering a premium video experience through state-of-the-art technology, unmatched programming, and industry leading customer service to more than 37 million customers in the U.S. and Latin America. Our innovations have led to eight Emmyå¨ Awards and hundreds of filings for US patents as we've introduced must-have technologies to the viewing experience. Our DVRs are considered the industry benchmark!
The DIRECTV Set Top Box Integration Team plans and delivers new feature releases that add to this world class customer experience, optimize market opportunities, enable new products, and reduce customer contact rates. We facilitate cross group communication. We design and implement processes that enable software lifecycle efficiencies.
If this sounds exciting to YOU, we are looking for an Integration Lead for our fast growing Hotel and existing legacy business. Your NEW management embraces change, cares about growing careers, and wants to hear your ideas ‰ÛÒ come ready to disrupt the status quo!
About YOU:
You have a strong software development background integrated with a spectrum of skills ‰ÛÒ from leading coordination meetings to understanding/driving critical blocking technical problems to managing and/or collaborating with a diverse group of employees and vendors globally.
You thrive at the opportunity to positively direct 15+ integration engineers and coordinate with multiple subsystem leads totaling over 150+ engineers. You are a firefighter that comes in to save the day when there are cross component issues. You can identify, set, and drive technical efforts required to resolve challenging regressions and issues that impact our software quality. You can facilitate discussions with a diverse global team of developers and other involved parties to solve problems and deliver improvements. You can clearly communicate technology issues, plans and solutions from both a business and a technical perspective.
You enjoy being in a visible role in a fast paced environment with many opportunities to contribute technically and creatively to maintain and grow our customer base. You proactively identify gaps in processes and/or technology and directly or indirectly bridge such to make a positive difference for DIRECTV and our customers.
You are a team player ‰ÛÒ a peer builder ‰ÛÒ an out-of-the box-thinker ‰ÛÒ eager to learn ‰ÛÒ driven ‰ÛÒ passionate ‰ÛÒ an overachiever ‰ÛÒ enjoy reading about or dabbling in new technology. Mostly, you are ready and eager to share your magic and uniqueness to delight our customers!
Qualifications
What You Will Do @ DIRECTV:
In 6 months:
Learn about our Emmy Award Winning embedded application architecture
Learn about our development lifecycle
Help establish and manage a specialized integration team
Manage release schedules
Help determine, document and bridge gaps in process and technology
Drive technical efforts required to resolve challenging integration issues and improvements
Challenge yourself to submit a patent disclosure and start earning extra income!
12 Months:
Gain a deeper understanding of DIRECTV‰Ûªs engineering application architectures
Continue to make improvements directly or indirectly via gap analysis
Drive technical efforts required to resolve challenging integration issues and improvements
Demonstrate contribution via reduced call volume metrics
18 Months:
Continue to gain a deeper understanding of engineering application architectures
Continue to make improvements directly or indirectly via gap analysis
Drive technical efforts required to resolve challenging integration issues and improvements
Demonstrate contribution via reduced call volume metrics
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science
C, C++, Java
Thorough understanding of embedded software systems
Experience using version control (Mercurial, CVS or GIT) in an IDE environment
5-10+ years of development experience
Ability to work independently in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Familiarity with front end user interface design, digital marketing, product development, and order processing is a strong plus.
Nice to Have:
Knowledge of existing DIRECTV Applications
MS or advanced degree in Computer Science or related subject
Experience with JIRA and Wiki Sites

Location: Los Angeles, California
Description
DIRECTV, now part of the AT&T family, has an internship program that ROCKS! We won‰Ûªt have you file papers and make copies‰Û_ we offer students much more. We offer the opportunity to work with the most cutting edge technology and bring the highest value in entertainment to the homes of your friends and family. We are seeking passionate students who can‰Ûªt‰Ûª stop watching sports, TV, movies, and news. We want technology-obsessed students who are excited to innovate and want to compete with the ever-changing tech world.
Over the span of 12 weeks, you will have the opportunity to work on real projects and develop meaningful mentor partnerships. Love to learn? Good, because you will participate in weekly lunch events with leaders, trainings and development courses. Don‰Ûªt forget the fun stuff‰Û_ social events, volunteer days and take an inside look at DIRECTV by touring our broadcast centers and joining a technician on a Ride-Along for the day. This is a paid internship! Meet our previous interns here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4KhSBmeuHag
________________________________________________________________
The world loves TV but the traditional world of video content distribution and consumption is changing dramatically. Do you want to be part of this digital entertainment revolution?
DIRECTV (Now part of the AT&T family) is one of the world's leading providers of digital television entertainment services delivering a premium video experience through state-of-the-art technology, unmatched programming, and industry leading customer service to more than 38 million customers in the U.S. and Latin America.
To maintain its leadership position, DIRECTV is looking for talented design interns to join its User Experience team based in Los Angeles. The User Experience team is responsible for the current and next generation design of the multi-screen entertainment experience for DIRECTV.
As a UX Design Intern, you will spend 12 glorious weeks in Los Angeles, CA as part of the DIRECTV Experience Design team and work closely with UX Designers, User Researchers, UI Designers and Engineers. You will be assigned a design problem and define, design and implement features for DIRECTV‰Ûªs all-screen entertainment experience.
You will have an assigned mentor to help guide you through your time with DIRECTV and gain valuable real world, portfolio-worthy work that could possibly be used by millions customers.
Job Duties & Requirements
User Experience: Partner with your assigned UX Design mentors to develop a high-quality user-centered solution for DIRECTV set-top-boxes and/or mobile devices. Brainstorm and collaborate with other UX designers, graphics specialists and engineers.
Documentation: Produce a variety of typical UX deliverables such as Competitive Audits, Heuristic Evaluations, User Journeys, Sitemaps, User Flows and Wireframes.
Deliverable & Deadline Management: With the help of your mentors, gain insights into how to give estimates and get experience in managing deadlines.
Research Participation: DIRECTV has an in-house research group so user research is always being conducted. You may not necessarily be able to do research for your particular assignment, but you will get experience in identifying areas for research and will definitely get to observe research for other DIRECTV initiatives.
Work hours and location: Hours are typically 9am to 6pm in El Segundo, CA offices.
Qualifications
Required Characteristics & Abilities
Creative problem solving: Assess and determine product goals, understand technical or business limitations, explore and ideate multiple design solutions, partner with mentors to assess feasibility, articulate pros/cons and make recommendations.
Collaboration: Work with your mentors and other UX designers and receive (and know what to do with) constructive design critiques, be able to defend your point of view and apply critique feedback into solution.
Communication: Crystal clarity in speech and writing, with the ability to present to a variety of audiences (ex: engineers, managers, executives)
Initiative: Lead/drive your project, meet deadlines and manage time. Be a self-starter but also know when to reach out for help.
Receptivity: Able to learn quickly and apply new knowledge adeptly. Open to discussion and debate while retaining a point-of-view.
Agility: Excels working in a fast-paced and fluid environment.
Passion for Design: You find yourself debating about improving elevator button interactions or improving wayfinding at your local mall.
Knowledge & Skills
Pursuing a degree in information architecture, interaction design, UX or a related field
Nice to have: online portfolio showcasing recent school projects, freelance work or even just things you have worked on in your spare time for fun
Nice to have: software proficiency in one or more of the following; Adobe InDesign, Balsamiq, Moqups, wireframe.cc, sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Flash, Acrobat, Omnigraffle, Axure, Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint or Visio
What‰Ûªs In It for You?
No grunt work‰Û_you will not be getting anyone coffee or doing data entry. You will get to design a real solution and get very good insights and experience as a UX Designer.
You will end up with portfolio-worthy work.
Practice presenting and defending your work and getting feedback on suggested improvements.
Tons of support from not only your assigned mentors but also the rest of the UX team. We are all passionate about cultivating future talent and take it very seriously.
Job
Internship

Communication- Explains advanced technical information to less experienced team members. Provides specialized technical guidance to others in work area. Builds productive internal/external relationships and collaborates with others in own team or across teams.

categories_jobs_title: Senior Space Systems Analyst MOD & Simulation (Government)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: El Segundo, California
Senior-level space systems analyst to perform a broad range of technical tasks in support of concept development, architecture definition and system development. Tasks include space control system architecture definition, cost-constrained architecture optimization, orbital analysis and planning, operations concept development, requirements flow-down from system level to subsystem and unit level, definition and performance of trade studies including system impact analysis if elements are lost/destroyed or negated, interface definition, requirements verification planning, and Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis of system and architecture performance under various assumptions of attacks. Candidate should be capable of both high-level performing system and subsystem performance analysis and detailed analysis and assessment of orbital constellations (including ground segment analysis), as appropriate to the specific task. Ability to work well in an integrated product team environment required. Candidate must be a self-starter.
MS in technical field required. 15 years in directly related analytical role required. EO/IR or RF modeling and analysis experience desired. Orbital Mechanics experience required. Must have experience with STK, Matlab, Microsoft Office (Access, Excel, Word and Powerpoint). Experience with Space Systems acquisition and operations, Intel community tasking and dissemination processes (technical as well as procedural) is a plus. Ability to communicate effectively orally through briefings.
Required Clearance: Active DoD Top Secret/SCI clearance mandatory. The ability to be accessed to the customers programs is mandatory.
Desired: Strong writing skills desirable. Knowledge of or experience in SMC space systems acquisition processes. Prior experience supporting complex Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) studies. A minimum of 10 years working directly with SMC acquisition directorates, a minimum of 5 years working directly with the SMC Space Superiority Systems Directorate.

categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Atlantic City, New Jersey
Cricket Wireless is a simple, smart, make-your-day-better wireless experience for anyone who wants first-class nationwide wireless service at a value price, with no annual contract. It‰Ûªs all about giving the customer the kind of wireless they deserve. Isn‰Ûªt that how all wireless should be? We think so. Cricket is available nationwide at Cricket branded retail stores, dealers, national retailers and at www.cricketwireless.com
Want to join a dynamic wireless company where your ideas and talents really matter? At Cricket, we work hard and have a great time doing it. We're looking for smart and driven people who want to make a difference. We offer our team members a competitive total rewards program which includes both short and long-term compensation and incentives, as well as a comprehensive benefits package.
We‰Ûªre a dynamic, growing, equal-opportunity employer where employees discover that a career can become a calling.
Position Overview
Primary job function is to assist the Store Manager in managing all aspects of the functions of the store/kiosk/cart in his/her absence.
Assists Store Manager in day-to-day store operations, including:
Targeted sales achievement Merchandising/promotional activities
Customer service and retention, Audits, Employee training, Inventory management, Cash handling, reconciliations and deposits
Customer satisfaction measured by surveys, Store safety and security
Works with the Store Manager to ensure attainment of all net sales and revenue goals including:
‰Û¢ Gross sales/net sales
‰Û¢ Accessory sales and margin targets
‰Û¢ Rate plan take rates
‰Û¢ Enhancement targets ‰ÛÒ features/text messaging/insurance sales, fees, data products and all other add on products
‰Û¢ Retention targets
‰Û¢ Automatic bill payment targets
Schedules employees for optimum store performance, including back up plans for peak hours, vacation, sick time, training, etc.
Ensures proper opening and closing of the retail location via completing reports and cash reconciliation.
Supports Store Manager in achieving goals by leading the team in inside sales, outside events and outbound marketing.
Drives success by ensuring employees follow the sales process.
Assists customers, handles customer escalations and promotes a positive customer experience.
Assists with the management of the approved store budget by monitoring adherence to customer fee and credit policies/practices.
Assists in the training of all retail staff of company sales procedures/policies, programs, promotions, incentives, etc.
Maintains desired store appearance according to company standards.
Provides input to Store Manager to maintain proper and adequate levels of inventory to support sales traffic.
Participates in month-end inventory reconciliation and audits with Inventory/Sales Representative and the Store Manager. Communicate to Store Manager any inventory discrepancies.
Assists the Store Manager as directed in coaching retail sales staff. Positively influences and motivates all employees by maintaining a team approach in the day-to-day management of all employees. Addresses performance issues to ensure quality and efficiency in the sales process.
Assists the Store Manager in recruiting, selecting and hiring staff.
Conducts weekly staff meetings to communicate company trends, happenings, performance statistics and standards when the Store Manager is absent/unavailable.
Achieves established sales quotas and leads by example in all aspects of the sales process, product knowledge and customer satisfaction/retention.
Assists in managing all aspects of store security and report additional needs or findings to the Store Manager. This includes off duty police officers, video surveillance, bank deposits, armored vehicle pick-up, etc.
Demonstrates technical competence for products and services sold.
Maintains a relationship with the Network Operations Department that allows for ongoing knowledge of and participation in network development, customer-related network issues and resolution of these issues.
Engages in community activities and business development that support business goals.
Shares best practices with other stores.
Position Requirements:
Cricket offers a work environment where you can achieve your professional and career development goals. We also offer a competitive compensation and benefits package for both Full Time and Part Time employees
Required Qualifications
Minimum 1 year proven retail sales experience.
Minimum 1 year experience proven leadership skills and employee development.
Desired Qualifications
Wireless Telecommunications Industry or High Tech Experience.
3 or more years of previous operations experience in a management role in a retail sales function.
Requisition ID: 1625750-C

Location: UNITED STATES
The Governance, Risk and Compliance Security Practice of AT&T Consulting Solutions is looking for qualified persons to join its team of world-class security and information risk management professionals. This position will be focused on providing guidance around security and privacy regulatory and industry standard requirements to our portfolio of Fortune 500 clients, conducting security risk assessments, and working with the practice leadership to keep abreast of developments in the information security space from both a strategic and technical perspective. Key job responsibilities will include:
Conduct information security assessments using industry accepted best practices and approaches to support enterprise business goals and objectives
Evaluate information security risk in context of business environment and industry requirements
Consult with clients on information security best practices and provide guidance on cost-effective strategies for implementation of security
Follow standard methodologies and develop new and innovative processes for delivering information security solutions
Focus on results and ability to work within tight timelines
Demonstrated ability to learn and apply critical thinking to a variety of situations
Design deliverable content to precisely reflect the engagement contract and client needs
Work with clients to help them understand where improvements could be made, and propose scenarios and solutions to address these areas of improvement
Build and nurture positive working relationships with clients with the intention to exceed client expectations
Required Qualifications
BA/BS in information technology, business administration, or related field preferred
3-5 years of experience in information risk management, security governance, program development, regulatory and controls experience
CISSP, CISM, or CISA certification a plus and preferred
Solid understanding of the evolving security and privacy controls environment, regulatory landscape and risk management techniques, principles and practices
Experience performing risk and compliance assessments and in-depth knowledge of industry standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., HIPAA, HITRUST, HITECH, FISMA, NIST, ISO 2700X, COBIT, FFIEC, NERC CIP, etc.)
Experience and firm understanding of the development and implementation of information security policies, standards and related procedures
Ability to provide risk-based recommendations based upon the size and complexity of the client‰Ûªs organization
Ability to educate clients of the risk implications associated with a particular business decision, and communicate the likelihood and impact of those decisions so clients can fully quantify those risks
Ability to translate complex technical information across all levels of the organization
Strong facilitation skills and a clear ability to build strong relationships with business stakeholders at all levels, including executive managers and vendors
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with a team, delivering high performance and customer satisfaction in a global, matrix-management environment
Strong business acumen and process-oriented thinking
Excellent presentation and issue resolution skills
Written communication skills for use in preparing formal documentation including deliverables, Statements of Work, proposals, white papers, and case studies
Verbal skills that include the ability to clearly articulate thoughts, be persuasive and to deliver presentation and training to all levels of management
Ability to undertake and complete tasks independently, meet schedules and delivery timelines, and to move swiftly from concepts and theory to action
Ability to interface with C-levels, as well as tactical implementers
Positive customer service and team attitude (helping others when required)
Able to manage projects from inception to successful implementation
Able to foster working relationships with the team and clients
Strong investigative and analysis skills with the ability to handle confidential information
Ability to travel
Keeps informed of advances in information security; self-motivator
Additional Qualifications
Consulting experience is a plus
Privacy experience a plus
Application development and understanding of SDLC is a plus
Understanding of available security tools and technologies
Requisition ID: 1630248

AT&T-DIRECTV is more than entertainment ‰ÛÒ we are a technology company. Our Northeast Coast Uplink Facility Technical Services Department is seeking a Technician 1 to work at the uplink facility located in New Hampton, NH.
Within the first 6 months, you will be working toward mastering the core competencies of our technicians. You will work closely with the Technical Operations Center to identify problems in specific markets/channels and restore the broadcast. Our customer satisfaction relies on keeping programming on-air and this can‰Ûªt be done without you.
Our environment offers the best of both worlds ‰ÛÒ we are a strong team and rely on each other, but much of the work is performed independently.
Responsibilities
Ensure consistent, high quality digital television signal transports and satellite transmissions.
Installation, diagnosis and maintenance of critical on-air video, audio, RF, baseband, signal processing, transport and transmission equipment. This responsibility includes DirecTV‰Ûªs Mpeg 2 and Mpeg 4 Broadcast transmissions streams and all associated Local Collection Facilities, Broadcast Centers, Ground station Equipment, and associated Monitor and Control hardware.
Configure and troubleshoot a variety of television broadcast, transport, and transmission equipment.
Perform routine maintenance on various subsystems.
Summarize and Present Technical information in both verbal and written form

categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: UNITED STATES
AT&T Consulting Solutions is a wholly owned subsidiary of AT&T (a Fortune Global Top 10 company). AT&T is looking for a sharp penetration tester for the position of a Senior Consultant located anywhere in the US to be a part of a dynamic team of experienced security professionals with varied experiences. AT&T consulting clients range from some of the largest networks in the world to small businesses requiring security consulting expertise.
Job Duties:
Perform network and application layer penetration tests for AT&T‰Ûªs customers‰Ûª Internet-accessible and internal applications and networks. A knowledge of wireless penetration testing and web application development security strongly desired. Incident Response and Forensic skills a plus. The candidate should have a deep understanding of TCP/IP, network discovery, DNS enumeration, vulnerability scanning, exploitation methods and privilege escalation. The candidate should also have an excellent grasp of web application exploitation and the OWASP list. The candidate must be able to write objective, detailed reports explaining security issues.
Requirements:
Bachelors degree or higher, Masters Degree preferred.
Information Security experience of a minimum of five years
Knowledge of Linux, UNIX, Windows and other operating systems
Knowledge of popular databases such as MSSQL, Oracle, and MySQL
Deep Knowledge of TCP/IP, network protocols, firewall evasion, ethical hacking, routing protocols
Experience in evading IDS/IPS, access control lists
Experience with Nmap, Nessus/Qualys, Metasploit, Paros, Kismet, aircrack-ng, etc.
Ability to write customized scripts using at least two of bash, Perl, Ruby, Python
Knowledge of C/C++, Java, C#, Python or similiar would be beneficial
Ability to travel 50%-75%, must possess drivers‰Ûª license
Strong report writing skills and ability to explain complex security issues to customers
Must be a flexible team player, hard-working, excellent communication and customer-facing skills
Security certifications such as CISSP, CEH, SANS GSEC, etc. preferred
Other industry certifications relating to IT security and program management preferred (GIAC, CEH, TNCP, ITILv2 PMP, etc...)
PCI DSS experience preferred
Technical Skills
Strong technical problem / resolution skills
Mid to advanced level infrastructure or security design capabilities for environments that include 10 to 20 security devices, processes or applications.
Mid to advanced level systems administration (UNIX/Linux, Windows, or mainframe)
Knowledge with different application architectures and platforms, their development challenges, their control configurations, and their inherent security strengths and weaknesses (e.g., ColdFusion, J2EE, .Net)
Mid to advanced level network administration (firewalls, IDS/IPS, network architecture)
Experience with web application penetration testing tools preferred, such as Burp Suite Pro, IBM AppScan, HP WebInspect, etc.
Advanced level of methods and knowledge of three or more of the following:
Vulnerability scanning
Penetration testing (network, system and application)
Application Security
Code Review
Forensics and Incident Response
Security event monitoring
Vendor certification or demonstrable in-depth technical expertise with at least three major security solution
Examples Only: Symantec, McAfee, VeriSign, Juniper, Checkpoint, Cisco, Arcsite, Tripwire, etc.
Demonstrable experience includes being able to gather customer requirements, design a solution, specify a build of materials, implement, tune/optimize, maintain or troubleshoot at an architecture component level for an existing solution
Additional Requirements
Bi-lingual candidates a plus
Incident Response and Forensic experience a strong plus
Ability to work independently and also collaborating closely with application developers, engineers and others.
Effective written, oral communication skills, and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong communications skills to be able to interact with technical and non-technical colleagues.
Knowledge of the latest security threats, techniques and exploits targeting vulnerabilities
Strong familiarity with multiple operating systems, databases, applications and platforms.
Understanding of SQL, XSS, CSRF and other trends in web exploitation
Working understanding of HTML and common web applications
Thorough understanding of computer networking and the OSI model
Cyber-threat research, reporting and development/implementation of vulnerability mitigation strategies a plus
Programming experience is a plus
Calculate and assess risk based on threats, vulnerabilities, and mitigating factors.
Knowledge of exploit development is a plus.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience evaluating IT process areas, such as logical and physical access, program development, change management, IT operations etc.
Strong task management skills and ability to multi-task.
Detail oriented and analytical.

Broadcast Operations first and foremost priority is to restore, record, and report all local channel issues including Live Local Streaming. The TOC (Technical Operations Center) as a group works in conjunction with our partners in Technical Services, Advanced Services Operations, Programming, Traffic, N.E.T. (National Escalation Team), and Field Engineering to maintain the on-air integrity of Local-into-Local (SLiL) broadcasts. The Castle Rock Broadcast Center is a 24 / 7 facility. We consider this an essential role at Broadcast Operations, so extended hours will be necessary when driving conditions are difficult for incoming shifts, staffing emergencies, or during periods multiple on air issues. This position starts on the overnight shift.
Key Roles and Responsibilities: A Broadcast Operators job is to respond quickly to outages and minimize impact to our customers. We monitor 2400+ TV stations across the Unites States. Reporting to the Manager of Broadcast Operations, Operators are the first line of support, so their assessment will determine the route and steps taken to resolve the issue. Operators will monitor for error messages received and act on tickets from our customer service team. Regular channel sweeps, responding to outages, and signal degradations are all expectations of this position. Operators will restore the signal as quick as possible, whether swapping to backup equipment, or escalating to our Tier 2 teams. Collaboration techniques are a bonus as interactions with other broadcast departments may be necessary in assisting in troubleshooting to resolution. Writing skills are necessary, as they will be documenting all actions in troubleshooting. The job will require that operators work on side projects and teams as deemed necessary. categories_jobs_title: Principal Software Engineer Big Data (Plano TX)
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Plano, Texas
Are you a Big Data Engineer who loves to put things together and build the future from the world's most massive data sets? Why? Because AT&T is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to develop high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, and text mining. We are looking for people with a ton of passion, a desire to try big things, people who have a lot of curiosity and can go deep into the lowest layer of a complex system. We want people who want to learn new things, and people who have a clear customer point-of-view.
The selected candidate will write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications within our Big Data Organization; Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions; Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented; Enjoy working in a highly agile environment.
AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment. If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you!
Desired Qualifications:
8+ years‰Ûª experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies
Hadoop certification is desired and highly relevant
A passion for building things from massive data sets and a passion to create the future in technology
Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM
Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred
Viewed as a pioneer within field
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

Location: Columbia, Maryland
This is a senior-level engineering job to help define and implement AT&T Public Sector Solutions (PSS) secure mobility solutions for PSS customers. The candidate will work as a member of a technical team to thoroughly understand US Government (USG) guidance on secure mobility such as the NSA/IAD‰Ûªs Commercial Solutions for Classified (CSfC) Capability Packages, NIAP Protection Profiles, and DoDI 8420.
The successful candidate will apply/adapt current and future AT&T mobility services, mobile industry technology, and information assurance tools and techniques to build solutions that comply with USG guidance. This job includes consideration of business interests and strategies for cybersecurity and cloud computing, so selected candidates will work with a range of information assurance topics and products. Specific responsibilities are to foster a thorough understanding of mobile threats and vulnerabilities across the technical team; develop and validate design options and architectures; document, explain and demo solutions to clients and business stakeholders; manage technical tasks to budget and schedule. The job requires interaction with cross-functional peers in AT&T, vendors and USG leads to develop product roadmaps, assess impacts, establish priorities, justify schedules and budgets, provide status, resolve issues and mitigate risks.
Responsibilities:
- Setup, operate, and evaluate the security of a virtual Evolved Packet Core (vEPC) based on next-generation, cloud-based technologies and incorporating dedicated physical mobile network elements as critical communications infrastructure.
- Work in concert with network and cloud security engineers to plan and execute test, analyze results, prove vulnerabilities and mitigations through functional prototypes, and make security recommendations.
- Lead security analysis activities specific to the mobile network.
Qualifications:
- Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science from an accredited university
- At least six years of hands-on experience in telecommunications
- At least three years of hands-on experience operating packet core mobility networks
- Prefer hands-on experience installing and configuring such components as HLR/HSS, GGSN/PGW/PCEF, SGSN/SGW, SMSC, and IMS. Experience with carrier-class virtual packet core elements highly preferred, experience in cloud-based systems especially related to telecommunications preferred.
- Prefer knowledge of vendor test and emulation equipment for mobility networks. Deep understanding of 2.5G/3G/LTE packet core architecture, network elements, interfaces, and protocols.
- Strong understanding of networking protocols to include IPv4/v6, TCP/UDP, SSH, SSL/TLS, and DNS.
- Prefer experience with operations and maintenance of mobility networks to include use of vendor O&M systems.
- Bonus if knowledgeable of hybrid circuit/packet-switched networks, SMS/MMS, IMS, and DRA
- Programming experience for testing/prototyping, automation, and analysis/development of OpenStack APIs in one or more languages to include Python, Node, PHP, or Java. C/C++ experience also a significant bonus.
- Comfortable with Linux and Microsoft Windows-based systems
- Advanced degrees and job-related certifications preferred
Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and possess or be able to attain TS/SCI with poly.

Location: Santa Maria, California
AT&T Government Solutions is currently seeking a Cyberspace/Space System SME to provide Subject Matter Expertise and analytic support to 14th AF activities.
Work Location: Vandenberg AFB
Employee shall establish processes and procedures to implement cyberspace operations orders from 24 AF. Individual shall review the generic/AF-wide orders and write a subordinate order tailoring the tasks to the technical details of space systems utilizing existing Air Force Forces (AFFOR) processes to order subordinate units to implement. Employee shall recommend and help improve/fix existing processes and implementation procedures. Individual shall track completion of ordered tasks to subordinate units and respond to questions from subordinate units for assistance with task completion. Employee shall collect and review Cyber Protection Team reports, CCRI reports, DTRA reports, IG inspections or other cyberspace security assessments of space mission systems and develop a process to task, track and develop Plan of Actions and Milestones (POA&M), then monitor progress of units and/or associated system program office (SPO) in remediation of reported recommendations. Employee shall recommend improvements for AFFOR processes/tools, in accordance with 14 AF governing instructions, policies, and/or procedures as cyberspace security initiatives continue to evolve. 10+ years of experience in cyberspace and space operations is a must. Employee will provide strategic theories, methodologies and direction to customer in support of Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP) activities for Space systems. Employee will comply with all customer security requirements. Participate in customer meetings and provide training to junior analysts, as required. Employee will be required to notify the government of any suspected security incidents in a timely manner, and assist in the investigation of incidents, as necessary. Strong oral and written communication skills, technical writing and briefing skills are required. Performance of duties after hours may be required
Strong oral and written communication, technical writing and briefing skills. Bachelor‰Ûªs degree
Required Clearance: TOP SECRET/SCI security clearance and willingness to sign consent to a polygraph.
Desired: 10+ years cyberspace/space operations experience

categories_jobs_title: Consultant Prof Services 3ATC Project Management\Consulting Engagements
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: California
AT&T Consultant Professional Services - Consulting Project Manager is responsible for the discovery, physical and logical design, project planning, project coordination, logistical planning, procurement, schedule development, equipment/software implementation and closeout of various consulting projects. AT&T Consulting Project Manager utilizes a structured approach to project management, which includes the following phases of a project: Initiation, Planning, Execution, Controlling and Closure.
Having project management consulting expertise, the AT&T Consultant Professional Services is involved in all areas of engagements from initiation to closure. Roles and responsibilities include but not limited to following:
Initiation
During the Initiation Process, the AT&T project manager works with the AT&T team and the customer to understand the needs of the customer and ensure they are met during the project implementation. During the Initiation Process, the project manager‰Ûªs activities include the following, as applicable:
Study all relevant documents, including but not limited to: Statements of Work, Bill() of Materials, client Standards and client Architecture guidelines.
Review entries made into AT&T‰Ûªs internal ordering, billing and tracking systems for completeness.
Begin dialogue with customer representatives, other AT&T work groups, AT&T subcontractors and 3rd party vendors to identify available resources and project team personnel.
Research the expected availability of proposed equipment and required resources.
Develop and review High-Level Project Milestone Schedule with customer representatives
Planning
The AT&T project manager works with the customer representatives and the AT&T project team resources to develop a detailed project plan as a road map to reach a successful outcome of the project. During the Planning Process, the project manager‰Ûªs activities include the following, as applicable:
Organize and lead project kick-off meeting() with appropriate AT&T and customer representatives.
Review all project documentation to develop a concise list of all project tasks.
Develop a detailed project communications plan, including, but not limited to: the contact list, project organization chart, status reporting channels, escalation process, responsibility matrix, documentation list, project Website, expected project reports and meeting agenda and dates.
Develop the Work Breakdown Structure (‰ÛÏWBS‰Û).
Organize the WBS within the proposed major milestones to set dates and dependencies.
Execution
The AT&T project manager coordinates and directs the various AT&T technical and organizational resources that are assigned to the project. Leadership, communication and negotiation skills are essential to effective project execution. During the execution process, the project manager‰Ûªs activities include the following, as applicable:
Drive the project using the project timeline prepared during the planning process.
Create a dynamic action list to track issues as they develop, who should resolve, and the results.
Organize, lead and report to customer the developments of project team meetings such as status report meetings, project planning meetings and design review meetings.
Receive and review all specifications and drawings deemed to be accurate and complete by AT&T engineering and distribute to AT&T field personnel as needed.
Interface with the AT&T staging center for delivery of made-ready network electronics, installation forces, contractors and others to allow timely arrivals to the Site per the project plan.
Control
The AT&T project manager ensures that project objectives are met by AT&T resources by monitoring and controlling project activities, which may include corrective actions. Variances to the project plan are continually evaluated and adjustments are made if necessary. These adjustments may occur throughout the life cycle of the project and are often in response to customer needs. During the Controlling Process, the project manager‰Ûªs activities include the following, as applicable:
Ensure verification of the project scope through several ongoing activities that include reviewing project documents and participating in discussion during project meetings, developing and maintaining the project schedule and establishing test and acceptance criteria.
Control changes to the project scope by verifying that activities are compliant with specifications, monitoring the project and updating the project plan. Changes to the SOWs, project schedule or other accepted documents will be made under the terms of the COR process and must be coordinated through the AT&T project manager.
Control project schedule by monitoring and reporting task progress versus schedule, managing critical path activities, triggering Equipment deliveries and AT&T field personnel, and maintaining the project schedule.
Confirm adherence to quality standards and monitor Customer satisfaction by ensuring specifications and designs are reviewed, approved and forwarded to field personnel, reviewing processes to ensure effectiveness, striving to foresee and mitigate project risks, and acting as single point of contact for responsibility for overall project success.
Gather, prepare, document and disseminate project information and performance reports via status reports. Track and document progress made versus project schedule, accomplishments to-date, and upcoming project tasks.
Closure
The AT&T project manager will pursue an orderly conclusion to the project‰Ûªs installation and the formal acceptance by the customer in order to transition to post-installation support such as monitoring and maintenance. During the closure process, the project manager‰Ûªs activities include the following, as applicable:
Consolidate test and acceptance records for the customer. Solicit, consolidate, and work with appropriate parties to clear punch items.
Ensure long-term maintenance and support organizations have appropriate documentation and contact information is provided to the customer and Chancellor‰Ûªs Office.
Solicit and consolidate key project documents and ‰ÛÏas-built‰Û drawings into project binder(s) or project CD(s).
Compares the list of project tasks with work performed to ensure the project is complete per the requirements.
Review all status reports and action items to ensure all items have been resolved. Obtain Customer acceptance of the work performed.
Travel is required.
This position is open to locations in California (Anywhere within the State of California).
Preferably within close proximity to one of the major metropolitan areas: San Diego, Orange County, greater Los Angeles area, San Jose, San Francisco Bay Area, Sacramento.
Requirements
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree or equivalent.
PMP Certification.
Ability to travel throughout the USA, up to 100% of the time. Travel is typically around 25% of time and is typically within the state of CA, but can be up to 100% and be throughout the country.
Skilled in use of MS Project, Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint
Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Ability to give polished presentations to groups of 20 or more people.
Ability to facilitate and lead group meetings.
Ability to lead teams and drives project results.
Program Management Experience.
Experience leading teams of Project Managers.
Experience managing LAN infrastructure migrations. Including: equipment procurement management, schedule development, scheduling of field engineering resources, engagement of third party vendors, oversight of engineering design process (performed by Network Engineer), oversight of field engineering activities, responsible for client communications, responsible for coordination with client personnel, responsible for the development of project documentation.
Experience in customer service(Ability to work effectively with clients in a complex political environment).
Ability to handle a heavy workload under tight timeframes.
Outstanding attention to detail.
Ability to adhere to strict program standards.
Adhere to complex program processes.
Ability to develop project management tools, templates and processes.
Can telecommute when not required on the client site. Might be required to be on client site up to 100% of the time.
Must be resident in California, preferably in or near one of the major metropolitan areas (Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Jose, San Diego or Sacramento) or willing to be a resident in the State of California for this position. No Relocation options.
Vaild drivers license and MVR
Desired Education and Certification
åá Bachelors of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, or MIS is preferred
åá Industry Certifications
Requisition ID: 1629822

åá Execute store‰Ûªs implementation of The AT&T Retail Promise
åá Assist Store Manager to:

o Coach personnel on ‰ÛÏopportunities‰Û with key sales and reputation metrics, recognize teams on positive performance against key sales and reputation

åá Facilitate weekly personnel training/educational sessions as directed by Store Manager
åá Monitor Customer Experience Dashboard
åá Resolve or escalate appropriately any billing or service issues
o Deliver the right customer experience by assisting with management of the store, customer coordination, the welcome and wait time process, supporting the team and assisting sales personnel with customer transactions
åá Consistently demonstrate excellent leadership and coaching skills
Employee Management and Development
åá Assist, inspire and engage employees by motivating team to succeed
åá Lead by example
åá Develop employees for growth and promotion
åá Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach employees, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service
åá Improve employee engagement through leadership skills
åá Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach all employees as needed, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service
åá Improve store employee engagement through leadership skills
åá Assist Store Manager in ensuring personnel adhere to the Code of Business Conduct and company policies as directed by Store Manager
åá Fully understand and assist in educating personnel on compensation plan and how to maximize their earnings
åá Assist in ensuring all time cards are reviewed and accurate
åá Communicate temporary assignments and overtime for floating personnel
Product Launches
åá Partner with Store Manager to successfully launch new products, services or processes

åá Inspect that employees are properly trained on new products and promotions to sell with confidence
åá Report concerns with sellers‰Ûª knowledge and/or behavior to Store Manager or provide coaching as appropriate
åá Coordinate with security, facilities and mall management to ensure smooth product launch day execution
Store Operations
Staffing/Scheduling
åá Assist Store Manager with scheduling, coverage and resource planning to ensure the store has the right number of employees in the right roles at the right times
åá Facilitate the monthly scheduling process
Merchandising
åá Adhere to the iPOG and the merchandising standards
åá Instill a sense of pride and ownership in store appearance ‰ÛÒ where all employees understand their store is the face of AT&T to every customer
Compliance
åá Drive operational compliance of back office processes, procedures and policies
åá Inspect existing and new retail programs, tools and training
Other
åá Report fraudulent activity to Asset Protection
åá On call for store emergencies
Demonstrate AT&T Extraordinary Leader Model Characteristics
åá Continuously display high integrity
åá Develop strategic perspective and champion change
åá Inspire others to high performance through collaboration and teamwork
åá Utilize professional expertise to solve problems and analyze issues
åá Capture initiative and strive for results

Three or more years sales/customer service experience in the telecommunications or related industry
Previous management experience
Well developed planning, analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong communication, leadership, and presentation skills
Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax
Ability to work at multiple locations within district preferred
Familiarity with wireless terminology and AT&T Mobility systems preferred
Assistant Store Managers are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives!

Maintain inventories at adequate levels, promote sales, and maintain the appearance of the store. Complete accounting and paperwork associated with cash receipts and prices and conducts physical inventories. Job level is determined by meeting store opportunity, customer satisfaction, audit scores, and other criteria.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Customer Experience and Sales
åá Fully accountable for store implementation of The AT&T Retail Promise
åá Fully accountable for execution of sales, service and customer experience initiatives in store
åá Supervise store personnel to:
o Meet and exceed assigned goals for: customer experience and reputation, sales and service, revenue and productivity
o Demonstrate the right customer behaviors defined by Delivering an Extraordinary Experience
o Ensure every seller follows the AT&T Retail Experience and executes on all 5 Key Behaviors at all times
o Consistently demonstrate excellent leadership and coaching skills
o Create a work environment where motivated people can excel
åá Oversee Store floor experience ‰ÛÒ Act as Floor General
o Own Customer Coordination,Welcome and Wait Time process
o Support Team and assist with customer transactions
åá Coach and counsel personnel on ‰ÛÏopportunities‰Û with key sales and reputation metrics, recognize positive performance against key sales and reputation metrics and hold people accountable for poor performance
åá Perform role plays with personnel on a regular basis to demonstrate ‰ÛÏwhat right looks like‰Û
åá Facilitate weekly personnel training/educational sessions
åá Monitor the Customer FeedbackTool on a daily basis
åá Resolve or escalate appropriately any billing or service issues
Employee Management and Development
åá Interview, hire and make necessary discipline decisions, including terminations, for store personnel
åá Inspire and engage employees by motivating team to succeed
åá Lead by example
åá Develop employees for growth and promotion by delegating appropriate responsibilities and inspecting completion
åá Improve employee engagement throughout territory through appropriate behaviors and actions
åá Develop and execute individual development plans for store personnel
åá Observe and coach employees to provide feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service
åá Conduct On The Spot (OTS) Coaching
åá Execute A & D process for direct reports
åá Ensure personnel adhere to the Code of Business Conduct and conduct investigations with HR as needed
åá Resolve quickly any Rep or Store level fraud issues communicated by ARSM, may involve working with Asset Protection and/or HQ Credit and Collections
åá Fully understand and assist in educating personnel on the compensation plan and ensure employees know how to maximize
åá Ensure Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) compliance
åá Approve and communicate temporary assignments and overtime for floating personnel
Product Launches
åá Partner with Area Retail Sales Manager and other appropriate parties to successfully launch new products, services or processes
åá Actively inspect post-launch and drive improved results with best practices
åá Inspect that employees are properly trained on new products and promotions to sell with confidence
åá Document and report concerns with sellers‰Ûª knowledge and/or behavior and provide additional coaching and/or discipline as appropriate
åá Coordinate with security, facilities and mall management to ensure smooth product launch day execution
Store Operations
Staffing/Scheduling
åá Act as Floor General ‰ÛÒ responsible for all activity in store at all times
åá On the sales floor the majority of the time to coach and develop personnel
åá Partner with Area Retail Sales Manager to review headcount forecast plan and staffing
åá Employ Scheduling Tool to properly staff hot zones and meet business needs, training and special events such as product launches
åá Ensure employee preferences/constraints are loaded into the Scheduling Tool on a monthly basis
Merchandising
åá Accountable for adhering to the iPOG and the merchandising standards
åá Instill a sense of pride and ownership in store appearance ‰ÛÒ where all employees understand their store is the face of AT&T to every customer
Compliance
åá Drive operational compliance of back office processes, procedures and policies
åá Ensure timely completion of required training to empower personnel to succeed
åá Implement, execute and inspect existing and new retail programs, tools and training
åá Execute monthly cost reviews of overtime, discounts, returns and credits
åá Responsible for performing Access Review Tool (ART) periodic audits for direct employees to ensure they have the appropriate level of system/tool access for their roles and responsibilities.
Other
åá Report fraudulent activity to Asset Protection
åá On call for store emergencies
Demonstrate AT&T Extraordinary Leader Model Characteristics
åá Continuously display high integrity
åá Develop strategic perspective and champion change
åá Inspire others to high performance through collaboration and teamwork
åá Utilize professional expertise to solve problems and analyze issues
åá Capture initiative and strive for results
Required Qualifications
Two years sales/customer service experience in telecommunications or related industry
One year management experience
Excellent sales skills and demonstrated ability to meet or exceed performance standards
Ability to motivate and lead direct reports
Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays
Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax
Desired Qualifications
Three or more years sales/customer service experience in the telecommunications or related industry
Previous management experience in the telecommunications or related industry
Effective communication, presentation and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
Ability to work at multiple locations within district preferred
Familiarity with wireless terminology and AT&T Mobility systems preferred

categories_jobs_title: Principal Member of Technical Staff 5G RADIO NETWORK OPTIMIZATION
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Middletown, New Jersey
We are looking for a Principal Member of Technical Staff to join our Wireless Access Architecture and Devices team. If you want to get involved in advanced 5G technology and contribute in our esteemed technical staff discipline then read
below about our exciting opportunity!
Working as a Principal Member of Technical Staff, you will be required to demonstrate your highly technical skills and deep understanding and working familiarity with wireless communication systems in general and 3GPP based 3G/4G/5G cellular systems in general and the Radio Access Technology in particular. To attain this technical level, you will be required to have or be capable of exhibiting significant contributions in these areas. Your contribution can be external to the company as well as internal. As the Principal Member of Technical Staff, you will be recognized in the company as a technical leader within this area and may lead projects across multiple groups as it relates to AT&T 4G and 5G cellular networks.
Your contribution will be significant towards the overall AT&T technology strategy for 5G Radio Access Networks. Daily responsibilities involve:
Develop new concepts as they relate to optimization of various elements of L1/L2 of a 5G radio access networks using techniques such as machine learning, linear/nonlinear programing etc.
Develop novel cross-layer optimization techniques for better traffic management and service level optimization and work with other groups to create a SDN based framework for AT&T RAN controller.
Work on developing a framework of new concepts and algorithms that can be used in a multi-RAT multi-service environment network optimization.
Focus on optimization techniques as they relate to various L1/L2/L3 components of the 5G RAN as well as service aware traffic management and optimization.
Analyze the benefit of implementing such optimization techniques in AT&T 5G network via modeling and simulations.
Work with other teams to ensure the implementation of such optimization techniques in AT&T SDN based RAN Controller.
Education: Master or PhD degree in an approved field such as Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering or Mathematics from an accredited university.
Experience: PhD in an approved field with a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience or Masters in an approved field with a minimum of 10 years or relevant experience.
Awesome Points:
Extensive and in depth understanding and experience of cellular networks including 4G and 5G.
Experience with optimization techniques and analytical and/or simulation based analysis of wireless networks.
Familiarity with Radio Access Network protocols for LTE, LTE advanced, and 5G radio access network with particular L1/L2 optimization and cross level optimization.
Good understanding of SDN/NFV in the context of radio access networks and how that applies to our domain 2.0 vision of 5G.
Experience with application of aforementioned skill and concepts toward research and development of new technology, concepts and ideas for wireless networks.
Experience with development of simulation platform using platforms such as MatLab, NS-2/NS-3, C/C++, OpNET etc.
Things that will make you stand out:
Ability to solve complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues
Uses extensive research, interpretative thinking and innovative methods in developing solutions
Has the ability to explain and provide technical expertise to peers across the company
Can promote good working relationships and develop mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers
Requisition ID: 1624054-1
Apply now Apply now

categories_jobs_title: Sr Specialist System Engineer Data Center Orchestration and Tools
categories_jobs_requirement:
Location: Greenwood Village, Colorado
Are you someone who loves technology, has a passion for continuous improvement, and can quickly understand and adapt to new concepts? If so, YOU are the person we want to meet!
Job Summary:
The IT Analyst candidate will work as a member of the Data Center Orchestration Services team. This team is responsible for providing support, maintenance, and enhancement services for selected products of the Infrastructure Applications department. The Operations Orchestration (OO) is the primary tool in the AT&T/DIRECTV Data Center Automation (DCA) suite. The client utilizes DCO to automate the server provisioning and the change management process in AT&T's cloud computing and other data center environments.
Candidate will maintain and administer all aspects of the Data Center Orchestration. As an analyst with strong technical and analytical skills, one will be providing orchestration services in 24x7 open system environments. Supporting technologies Operation Orchestration (OO), Network Automation (NA), Server Automation (SA), and Business Service Automation Essentials (BSAE) are necessary.
The candidate will spend time supporting the operations and work with end-users to troubleshoot and resolve issues with existing operations. Knowledge of industry experience/knowledge to help mature the use of DCO in DIRECTV's environment is required.
The Data Center Orchestration Services Team operates on a 24x7x365 basis; on-call/off-hour may be required.
This position will be located at our Englewood, Colorado office; local candidates are preferred.
Essential Duties:
Data Center Orchestration, OO, NA, SA version 9.x or higher is necessary and high availability configurations of these tools
Designing, implementing, and maintaining OO flows
Troubleshoot to resolves incidents related to flows and operations in DCO
Support installs and configurations of OO, SA, and NA products
Deploying, configuring, operationally maintaining and scaling OO, NA, and SA for large environment, business critical applications
Customize and extend Data Center Automation products (OO, NA, and SA) based on business requirements
Debug low level operating system, networking, and application problems including Linux (RedHat), UNIX (HPUX), and Windows operating systems
Develop Python scripts, Shell scripts, PERL scripts, Visual Basic scripts, and batch files for automation of system and application administration
Develop custom applications using the DCO APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) and industry standard programming languages to meet business needs
Manage tickets and automation Computer Associates (CA) Service Desk
Monitor using HP Openview Suite (OMU, BAC, NNM, UCMDB)
Query Oracle database and Provision VMware Virtual Infrastructure
Troubleshoot and critical problem resolution
Initiate and maintain service desk tickets to include receiving or identifying incident/problem, track process, find resolution, make necessary correction to the incident/problem area, and close ticket
Support the ITIL model for best practices of IT processes
Create reports for metrics of system incidents, problems, and requests for all DCO products and distribute to appropriate members
Troubleshoot hardware and software incidents both locally, and remotely
Assist with various projects relating to the DCO OO, SA, and NA tools
Maintain quality control and customer service; work with vendors, and customers internal/external
Follow established polices and processes; improve process documentation in areas of responsibility
Take ownership of assigned tasks and drive to completion; provide status and follow-up as needed
On call; must be willing to support flexible working hours, including nights and weekends
Candidate may also be required to participate in the weekly on-call rotation; frequent overtime may be necessary.
Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience.
Highly tuned problem solving and analytical skills are necessary for this position
Basic understanding of system administration and debugging of one of the following platforms: Windows, Solaris, Linux, AIX, HP-UX
Automation of common tasks with PERL, Python, Shell scripts, VB scripts, and batch files
Network configuration and troubleshooting on large IP networks
Experience with software packaging (e.g. RPM, MSI, etc.) and software distribution
Performance monitoring, system tuning, high availability, and capacity planning experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must be customer-focused and have demonstrated strong teamwork, problem solving, and organizational/planning skills
The ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment is also essential
Ability to produce effective results under pressure
Ability to adapt to technical changes in the industry
Possess good time management and priority skills
Exercises wide latitude in determining objectives and approaches to critical assignments
Ability to work varying shifts
Support for the environment 24 X 7
Some travel may be necessary (5%)
Requisition ID: 1632114
