The System Administrator will be part of a System Administration Team responsible for the operation and maintenance of a complex computing environment. The environment consists of multiple Microsoft Active Directory domains and network-based Linux servers configured to Department of Defense standards. Services must be maintained on at least three (3) different classification levels: Unclassified, Secret and Top Secret Sensitive Compartmented Information. Ideal candidates will have strong, hands-on experience in most of the following technical areas: Enterprise Messaging Administration, Desktop and Security Administration, Server and Storage Management Administration, Boundary System Administration and Digital Telecommunication Software Operations. This position will also develop system diagrams and documentation, performance metrics and other configuration management deliverables as needed. This position operates with appreciable latitude in developing methodologies and presenting solutions to problems. This job is located in Washington D.C. and will require candidate to be on customer site daily with no telework option.
This position is part of a 24x7 on call support team
Requires a minimum of 5 years of full-time hands-on experience in operating and maintaining a computing environment which includes a messaging system, desktop and server support, firewall and DNS operation and maintenance, and digital telecommunications support. Candidate must maintain a DoD Directive 8570.01M, Information Assurance Workforce Improvement Program, certification over the life of the contract.
Required Clearance: Must hold a current Top Secret/SCI security clearance, based upon a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI), and be favorably adjudicated and approved for Presidential Support Duty (PSD) access.
Desired: Security+ or other DoD Directive 8570.01-M certification. Candidates should have experience in messaging operations with the proven skills to design, configure, operate and maintain messaging systems which include email, instant messaging, voicemail and other communications to common smartphones and tablets. Proficiency operating and maintaining Microsoft Windows 7 and Windows 8 Operating Systems; the Microsoft System Center 2012 suite of products; and Microsoft Server 2008/2012 platforms. Hands-on experience with software deployment, vulnerability remediation, group policy, Active Directory, firewalls, load balancers, DNS, server virtualization, archiving, and clustering services. Personnel should be skilled in the operation of Microsoft Lync 2010/2013, Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013, Linux Servers, and Oracle database management. Experience with the DoD Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and STIG compliance.

Location: Los Angeles, California
At DIRECTV we entertain the future. Our Technology team is delivering technology that powers the best video experience on every screen. We even have a few Emmys to prove it. We seek the brightest minds to help us transform what TV means to the world. We want you to imagine who you can become with the support of DIRECTV. Grow your career and ENTERTAIN YOUR FUTURE as an Application Management Engineer with our Advanced Services Operations team.
Responsibilities:
Manage and maintain application health and performance.
Ability to work in a 24/7 environment, with scheduled call-back responsibilities
Provide technical leadership on resolving application and platform issues and guidance for less experienced engineers
Document and maintain knowledge of supported applications and platforms
Analyze root cause and offer design solutions for immediate fixes and long term remediation
Provide a technical plan for effective monitoring and alerting
Automate common fixes for quicker response
Work with architecture, engineering and development teams to provide production requirements and review of new software releases prior to live deployment.
Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated proficiency of UNIX administration concepts and best practices for Red Hat Linux, Oracle Linux, and HPUX in an enterprise computing environment.
Demonstrable proficiency of systems administration concepts as they pertain to enterprise computing systems and industry best practices.
Database administration and architecture concepts and practices using Oracle and DB2 (at a minimum), in addition to other database technologies that may be used by production or lab systems: MySQL, Sybase, Postgres, etc.
Storage administration concepts and practices using EMC, Ibrix, Netapp, and/or 3PAR in addition to related management and backup software.
Scripting or programming proficiency (Perl, shell, Python, PHP, JAVA, C/C++, etc.).
Able to create/update/administer online source code or documentation repositories, such as CVS or SVN, Wikis, or other web-based repositories.
Have a thorough understanding of the software development lifecycle, including the application design, testing, and release processes, that can be used to support and contribute to the development of applications designed by DIRECTV Engineering and external vendors, alike.
Proficiency in generating technical drawings that show equipment location, layout, and data flow according to site standards using technical drawing packages.
Desired Qualifications:
BS degree and/or the equivalent in training and experience preferred.
Demonstrates ability to follow departmental direction and generate/update documentation that will result in completed project milestones and tasks with minimal supervision.
Capable of following deployment plans, performing maintenance requests, and/or generation of SOPs used by various support organizations.
Capable of taking knowledge and championing learning initiatives to bring others up to speed and improve the services knowledge base among department principals.
Proficiency in locating/obtaining knowledge of industry best practices relating to primary and secondary skills.
Uses good judgment in independent problem solving and can be used to lead problem solving efforts among peers and colleagues.
Can be held accountable for documenting and tracking assigned or volunteered tasks.

Location: El Segundo, California
The Digital Entertainment Products Group within DIRECTV is charged with oversight and product management for DIRECTV's IP-delivered products, including our suite of VOD streaming and live streaming apps and website, in addition to creating the best cross-platform entertainment experiences for advanced consumers. The ideal candidate will be passionate about television, movies, entertainment, and technology. He/She will have a deep understanding of video on demand and live streaming industries and be a champion for the consumer. He/she will then execute against that vision via small, medium, and long-term projects. The candidate will be part of a team that believes in working fast, being accountable, and learning from mistakes.
In this role, you will‰Û_
Establish and deliver on a 2-3 year roadmap of major initiatives that will unlock new content offerings for TV Everywhere.
Develop and maintain expertise in TV Everywhere content services as well as monetization and measurement of these services.
Identify and implement ways to optimize content workflows and processes.
Be looked to as the creator of new/cutting-edge ways of thinking, creating and executing on product ideas.
Bridge technical teams with the programming deal writers to ensure that any new projects based on contractual obligations and programmer requirements are met on time.
Engage customers, prospects, programming partners, and internal stakeholders to determine business requirements and strategic objectives.
Create product documentation including product briefs, PRD‰Ûªs, and use cases.
5-7 years‰Ûª experience in managing or leading digital product development initiatives or related experience.
Excellent critical and analytical thinking skills.
Extensive experience and knowledge of TV Everywhere, including but not limited to video on demand, live TV streaming services, authentication on programmer sites and apps, measurement, and dynamic ad insertion.
Experience working with programming and external content providers.
Previous work on set top boxes, mobile/ tablet apps, connected TVs, or game consoles
Exceptional user experience intuition and understanding across different consumption platforms.
Ability to interact with a diverse set of technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in an agile development process (Scrum, Kanban) strongly preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills required.
Must be self-motivated and accountable, owning projects from inception to launch.
Ability to adapt rapidly in a fast moving environment with shifting priorities and the ability to react quickly, dynamically, and intelligently.
Ability to understand and engage with technical teams on highly complex projects.
Undergraduate degree required (preferably in CS, Engineering, Market Research or related field), MBA preferred

Client has requested AT&T‰Ûªs assistance to support transformation planning, design, testing, engineering, and implementation of the future state Next Generation DC platform. As part of the effort AT&T will perform technology designs and upgrades to support the refresh and transformation sites, globally. For the client program, AT&T will serve as the project lead in the transformation activities providing Program and Project Management, Technical Leadership, and Technical SME support:
Positions requires the following:
Collaborate, confer and provides consulting services and manages project activities from client identification through final invoicing. Works on billable consulting service projects. Demonstrates broad product knowledge with the customer within a specific discipline. Works independently on highly complex projects, or may work in a team as assigned by the project leader. Technical responsibilities will include problem identification, system architecture definition, hardware/software specification and/or design, implementation, testing, client training, and deployment. Leads all technical aspects of delivery, customer satisfaction, and accurate timekeeping for billing purposes, on projects where the Consultant is the only technical resource or lead technical resource. Demonstrates expert knowledge of principles, theories and concepts in applicable discipline, plus high level of working knowledge in other related fields. May assist less experienced peers when needed. Work is performed under minimal direction. Travel to client location in support of project delivery is required.
Preferred location is New Jersey but other locations will be considered
Education: Typically requires a Bachelors degree.
Experience: Typically requires five to eight years of direct work experience.
Supervisory: No
A senior resource engaged as the primary project lead and technical architect for the duration of the transformation activity. The Lead Technical Architect role is expected to be a core element in the detailed planning and design of the proposed solution. This position will provide infrastructure, and Data Center (DC) engineering services to develop the detailed design plans for the proposed solution, which includes the list in the ‰ÛÏDC Transformation Technologies and Platforms section of the document‰Û. Expert level knowledge of the Juniper Technology Platform & Data Center technologies is required.
This role will take the lead role in overall design, implementation, technical migration coordination, and deployment of the proposed solution. Specific focus will be on the build-out of core components and readiness for migration of client users. This resource will typically have eight to ten years of experience in system integration, and will hold senior industry certification or equivalent to skill sets. Specific functions include:
Technical project governance
Coordination and functional group leadership of the AT&T, client, and vendor-provided technical / engineering resources assigned to the project
Support for the development of implementation, migration and system test plans
Performance as a dedicated Tier 3 escalation resource for the project technical team
Project technical lead for the transformation
Overall design, implementation, technical migration coordination, and deployment of the proposed solution

Location: Denver, Colorado
Description
ROOT SPORTS Rocky Mountain is the television home of the Colorado Rockies, Utah Jazz, Mountain West, Big Sky Conference and the University of Denver. The network delivers more than 350 live events each year and is available to approximately 2.5 million households across nine states including Colorado, Utah, and Wyoming and parts of Idaho, Kansas, Nebraska, Nevada, New Mexico and South Dakota.
ROOT SPORTS Rocky Mountain is owned and operated by DIRECTV Sports Networks, LLC and is now a part of the AT&T family. DIRECTV Sports Networks operates regional sports networks in the Southwest, Northwest, Pittsburgh and Rocky Mountain regions. The four networks combined reach approximately 13 million households across 22 states and have exclusive programming and distribution partnerships with more than 25 teams and conferences.
Chief Engineer
This position is responsible for the planning, deployment and integrity of mission critical broadcast television technology in a 7-day-a-week production environment, including remote live sports productions, live studio, post production, facility and IT. The ideal candidate will have a strong track record of success in designing, building, managing and maintaining broadcast television facilities with a history of exceptional strategic and execution skills that deliver reliable, technically sound productions.
The Chief Engineer is responsible for long term capital planning, design, execution and maintenance related to the owned and operated technical plant, plus execution of technology integration across multiple owned and 3rd party services and facilities. This position has responsibility for oversight of signal integrity through all production and transmission environments including remote production trucks at home and away venues, studio, fiber and satellite transmission and distribution of the channel signal at network operations in Atlanta. As such, the Chief Engineer is responsible for troubleshooting, maintenance and repair of complex hardware and software systems.
This position will manage broadcast engineers and must be able to productively work cross-functionally within the region and across multiple networks, interacting with the Director of Technology and other Chief Engineers to establish best practices and long-term capital plans. The successful candidate must be able to work effectively across multiple disciplines, with other engineers, production, Creative Services, IT and operations. They will be especially adept at working well under pressure, offering quick and accurate solutions to critical issues in a live broadcast environment.
Essential Functions:
‰Û¢ Reports directly to the Executive Producer and oversees the Engineering, Facilities, and IT for a complex broadcast, production and office environment.
‰Û¢ Strategically plan, conceptualize, design, install, test, and commission varying degrees of television broadcast systems (Studio, NOC/TOC, Production Control Rooms, etc).
‰Û¢ Supervise, develop, and schedule engineering department, including part-time engineers as needed.
‰Û¢ Responsible for the Network‰Ûªs technical integrity, including studio and live events, remote operations, and overall maintenance and support of technical production equipment and systems.
‰Û¢ Development and accountability for capital and operating budgets - project management, task delegation and oversight of key initiatives. Works closely with other Chief Engineers as well as Dir of Technology on current and future operating and capital budgets.
‰Û¢ Responsible for planning and implementation of Service Maintenance Agreements for broadcast and facility environments.
‰Û¢ Primary liaison to the production team working closely to define and prioritize projects, communicate status of projects and provide timely service and support.
‰Û¢ Manage compliance with local, state and federal laws.
‰Û¢ Responsible for quality control of all incoming feeds to ensure proper video and audio quality for ROOT SPORTS Rocky Mountain broadcast of live events.
‰Û¢ Quickly troubleshoot and repair technical problems that occur.
‰Û¢ Partner with production, IT and outside vendors to ensure this fast-paced, high-volume broadcast facility is running smoothly and meets the needs of the business.
Qualifications
Required Skills & Abilities:
‰Û¢ Minimum of 8 years of broadcast engineering experience is required, priority on live event experience, live Sports experience preferred. Associate or Bachelor degree in Broadcast Engineering preferred.
‰Û¢ Minimum of 5 years of supervisory, staff and project management, preferably as Chief Engineer or Assistant Chief Engineer in a complex television production facility.
‰Û¢ Prior experience as a broadcast systems integrator a plus.
‰Û¢ Minimum of 5 years of experience in operating (OPEX) and capital (CAPEX) budgets required. Must have the ability to foresee the technological needs of the buisness, and forecast as best as possible variances of both OPEX and CAPEX budgets. Candidate will work with Executive Producer, Finance Director, as well as Director of Technology to plan and forecast budgets.
‰Û¢ Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills.
‰Û¢ Proven track record of project delivery and a predisposition to providing excellent customer service to internal clients.
‰Û¢ Strong analytical and organizational skills to effectively prioritize work and resolve issues.
‰Û¢ Candidate must have working knowledge of CAD systems, will be responsible for updating and organizing documentation of broadcast systems. 5 years experience of CAD preferred.
‰Û¢ Exceptional technical knowledge of all areas of television and related equipment, particularly distribution, production, transmission and automation.
‰Û¢ High level of proficiency in the use of broadcast related test equipment including, but not limited to, waveform monitors, vector scopes, multi-meters, oscilloscopes, test signal generators, MPEG Analyzers, etc.
‰Û¢ Good knowledge of broadcast facility power-functions and fundamentals: Generator, UPS, and transfer switch. Experience in maintenance and upkeep of these systems strongly preferred.
‰Û¢ Knowledge of satellite, microwave and fiber transmissions.
‰Û¢ Knowledge of transcoding platforms, workflows, and file movement.
‰Û¢ Minimum of 5 years‰Ûª experience in IT or equivalent education required. Candidate must be proficient in MS Windows enterprise, experience in Windows Server and AD environments preferred. Candidate will support both broadcast and office IT environments. Knowledge and understanding of basic IP and subnets required.
‰Û¢ Experience supporting and maintaining Adobe Premiere edit systems including SAN, Fibre Distribution, NAS, LTO preferred. MAM/DAM experience a plus.
‰Û¢ Experience supporting Octopus NRCS and Chyron Camio systems a plus.
‰Û¢ Back-end support experience for 3D design programs and related rendering environments.
‰Û¢ Excellent reasoning skills in order assist in troubleshooting problems.
‰Û¢ Prior experience supporting IT systems in MS Office software applications (Outlook, Excel, Word etc.).
‰Û¢ Must be able to work highly varied and flexible hours in support of live sporting events (i.e. nights, weekends, and holidays).
‰Û¢ 1st and 3rd First Class FCC license or SBE certification a plus.

Location: Long Beach, California
AT&T is more than entertainment - we are a technology company with a core focus on innovation and service excellence. There are a lot of great things happening at AT&T. To support these exciting changes, we need a technically savvy change driver to join our Service Control Operations team in Long Beach, California. In this role, you will have direct impact on day to day service management and support of various systems that deliver entertainment to over 19 million subscribers in Latin America.
As a System/Application Administrator for the Broadcast Software Operations team at our California Broadcast Center in Long Beach, California, you will be part of a service operations team that provides entertainment to over 19 million customers across Latin America.
In this role you will have constant hands- on opportunities to work with the latest technologies and coordinate cross-functionally with subject matter experts to ensure our technological initiatives stay competitive and cutting edge. You will be directly responsible for conducting root cause analysis, troubleshooting, maintaining, upgrading and installing multiple UNIX and Windows systems. These systems are both vendor provided and proprietary and support critical broadcast functions such as program guides, interactive TV applications and conditional access.
There will never be a dull moment in this very high speed, complex, large technical environment. You will install the OS, install and configure off-the-shelf applications or applications that are built in-house, work with our network team to establish connectivity, assist with testing, and support the system after it launches. In order to do this you will need to stay ahead of the learning curve on all applicable viable technology as it comes on line as part of your own professional and leadership development.
Responsibilities:
Troubleshoot at a Tier II/Tier III level hardware, software and Windows/Linux operating system issues.
Creating Test Plans and Design Specifications, User Acceptance Plans, SQA Checklists, and other documentation as necessary.
Carry out testing on software applications developed by our Software Engineering group.
Work on multiple projects under tight deadlines, shifting priorities, and changing scopes.
Prioritize tasks to ensure deadlines are met and issues are resolved quickly and effectively.
Ongoing communication with staff and cross functional groups. Communication will range from troubleshooting and problem solving, to project updates and announcing change.
Evaluate and maintain a strong understanding of capabilities and limitations of all hardware, software, and subsystems. Communicate this through cross function groups as part of day-to-day training, risk management, and decision making that will affect future resource acquisitions.
Make recommendations to improve services, risk mitigation, processes, and/or allocation of resources
Enhance exchange of knowledge throughout the organization through technical report writing and debriefing of findings, best practices, and processes.
Desired Qualifications:
BS degree in computer science or equivalent combination of education/experience preferred.
1-2 years of practical work experience as a Unix/Linux or Windows System/Application Administrator preferred.
Must have strong hands-on experience in root cause analysis and troubleshooting and an extensive background with UNIX-based operating systems and shell scripting, MS-DOS batch files and/or Perl on Win32/ UNIX.
Must have experience installing/supporting hardware (including cabling) and software as well as a thorough understanding of Windows Server 2003-2012, Linux, and Solaris operating systems and TCP/ IP networking.
Experience with Relational Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, Sybase, DB2). Should have experience writing SQL commands and analyzing the results in order to resolve issues.
Ability to communicate effectively and manage expectations of internal customers, technical subject matter experts, peers and management.
Confidence in communicating issues, making recommendations for solutions, implementing resolutions, and leading change across all levels of the organization.
Spanish fluency (verbal and written) is a plus
Unique Requirements of the Role:
Must be willing to work flexible shifts to support a 24/7 facility
Must be willing to work holidays, weekends, and overtime as needed.
Availability for occasional domestic travel and commuting between sites as needed.
